Review: i ve been installing these in my house a well a a few buddy for home automation a few note on these if your looking to automate your home this is the best device i ve seen for z wave i personally have been using smartthings a a note to those who are looking to do ha as others have noted led is on by default but is easily changed i changed my to on only when the light is on the bedroom because i didn t want the light to shine in the room during the night however in the kitchen i have the led on when the light is on and v by far these switch are going to run you about 10 more than the competition but your going to save some time and effort with this switch the box come with the neutral wire which most do not and it a pain to make your own all the time given unlike the others out there your house wire plug into the switch this is an advantage for sure since you don t need wire nut likewise if your short on room in a box this is perfect the others out there have wire coming off the back of the switch and add more of a mess inside the electric box if you like this review please indicate so by clicking the box below
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: you need to check your wiring before ordering these these switch require 3 wire load line and neutral some of my light switch box do not have a neutral and our electrician could not get the switch to work called the company to confirm apparently lowes ha some z wave switch which do not require the neutral wire i m giving a 5 star since it is not the fault of the switch just do not want someone else to run into my difficulty
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: i now have a number of these working well
Review: add on comments may 26 2016 it s been over a year now since i installed this and i must say the set up ha worked flawlessly my garden light come on and because it s based on sunset time i never have to adjust for seasonal change or daylight saving time change the way i would have to with those pesky clock timer that come with the garden light transformer i had one instance where a rain storm tripped the gfic and i texted my house keeper to hit the re set on the gfic and all wa good i have also one of these receptacle control a robotic web cam that ha worked really well also a i use it to re boot the webcam from canada if i needed to i ve done this 2x in the past year sometimes i need to check or confirm something late at night and i can turn on the garden light and have a look around with the webcam the led set up is dope i get the equivalent of 300 watt of lighting using only 1 10 the power i will deploy more of these at another house for a similar set up truly allows great control and flexibility in a vacation home my original review perfect installation wa a breeze paired no problem on my schlage nexia z wave network i put a gfci before it put it in a nice bubble cover hubbell mm2420c now i can script and remotely control my garden light malibu 8301 9601 01 50 watt cast metal flood lights black matte in coastal fl i am doing this from canada the light come on 15 minute before sunset and shut off at 11pm the light are running sunthin mr 16 5 watt led s driven by a 60 watt ledwholesalers led power suppply driver transformer 120 to 12 volt dc output water resistance 60 watt 3204 12v most of the previously mentioned item have been purchased through amazon a one order i love it when everything come together
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i wa amazed at how easy this wa to install the instruction are clear and the terminal are well labeled it even came with the neutral wire i installed one in the garage to control my coach light via wink and alexa it is so nice having the light on a programmed schedule now using the dimmer i can dial down the brightness with either the switch or my mobile app
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works great when the household wiring allows installation
Review: i am told by my installer that there are 7 accepted way to wire switch to light but only 1 of which is compatible with z wave so for now we re limited to where we can install these switch which of course is not where i prefer to have them installed we are still researching if anyone ha any advice please leave a comment so i can have the switch installed and update this review my recent immersion into z wave wa the trane tzemt400bb3nx n n sl home energy management thermostat with nexia home intelligence white z wave and the schlage fe599grnx cam 619 acc 619 keypad lever home security kit with nexia home intelligence satin nickel z wave however i learned from a customer service rep at nexia that only powered component thermostat light switch outlet etc will act a repeater and battery operated component entry door lock dead bolt motion sensor will not act a a repeater hence the cause of my dropped connection to my thermostat and he highly recommended i add more powered component to my network thanks justin hence i ordered a small pile of these switch that i now unfortunately cannot use due to the wiring in my home in the single location we were able to install one of these switch it s working great using my nexia account the driveway light now turn out automatically 30 minute prior to dusk and turn off at a preset time then during the preset off time until a preset time in the morning the switch is part of a scene activated when there is motion detected on the driveway and then sends u an alert email and text message after a no motion message is passed back to the system this switch is then sent a message to again turn off but only during those very late night hour i have yet to see an off the shelf light that could be programmed to do this elaborate programming very nifty the quality of this switch is superb the functionality is superb but i m docking a star due to the lack of feasibility in many wiring configuration
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: probably the best option for z wave smart switch
Review: great product i replaced over a dozen switch in my home to enable voice command using the wink hub and amazon echo i chose the ge smart switch since it support 3 way configuration where you have more than one switch that control the same light fixture and us z wave technology a opposed to a vendor specific offering like lutron caseta i love the blue indicator light easy to see in the dark that illuminates whenever the light is off attaching and removing electrical wire to and from the switch is simple just tighten the corresponding screw no soldering the ground wire or fumbling a push in style switch to release the wire not sure if that make the connection le secure though be aware the switch is larger than a standard toggle switch though so it take up more space in the box and leaf le room for all the wire you may have to spend some time arranging the wire before screwing in the switch or cram really hard i did that once and the neutral wire detached from the screw nut i also had to repeatedly remove all the side bar the three prong that stick out on the side to get them to fit next to each other but presumably they re useful in certain installation and wa only annoying because i had more than a dozen to install the dimmer function itself is also a little sub optimal if you re accustomed to a slider to control the brightness for the smart switch it s variable depending on how long you toggle the switch how long you hold the on or off position and that can result in what feel like a slight delay between the time you press the button to when the light dims or brightens
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: i am not sure why others have bashed this a
Review: i am not sure why others have bashed this a not being well made it is typical construction with a very heavy aluminum front plate the screw for clamping the wire were typical construction and allowed normal tightening without stripping fyi be sure you read the instruction and take note about the pairing distance of 10 or le the short pairing distance is the design of the z wave interface not a problem with this device if you are pairing this to a fixed alarm panel or similar device you may need to power it up with an extension cord and place it near the z wave host for pairing once you have registered it with the host you can power it down then install it in the switch box
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: these are an excellent way to save from having to purchase a bunch
Review: these are an excellent way to save from having to purchase a bunch of smart led light and instead just change the outlet for example say you have a living room with six can light if you bought six hue bulb so you can remotely control the light with your phone you would need to spend 60 bulb x 6 with this outlet you need just one outlet note the outlet i am reviewing is only an on off and doe not have a dimmer function see dimmer smart switch which is 10 more than the standard the reason i only gave it 4 5 star is due to it huge size and amount of real estate it take up in the switch box it ll be just fine if you are installing it in a stand alone box but if you are trying to install it a shared box you will not only have trouble but run out of room quickly the box say you can bend the side metal plate and then provides amp instruction for maximum amount of amp but my electrician tell me that s a bad idea a they need room on the side i know there are a lot of review complaining about the different look of the switch sticking out horizontal rather than at an angle but the reason for this is the switch is always active for use by a person in location touching the switch or remotely e g by a phone the smart bulb for example always have to be on and if i have one installed on a floor lamp and the lamp is switched off i cannot control the light remotely from my phone for example however with this outlet even if they have manually been turned off you can still control them remotely from my phone or ipad for example since the switch is always on hence the reason it s always in the middle position overall very happy with the product and plan to order many many more given space in my box
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: this wa very easy to install and then add to my smartthings network
Review: this wa very easy to install and then add to my smartthings network had it up and running in very short order i like that using this outlet allows me to set smartthings to automatically turn on my living room light at sunset and then turn it off at 11pm i used to use a plug in timer and it wa a pain to keep adjusting the on time a the time it get dark varies day to day it s also nice if i want it on to say echo turn on the living room light
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: z wave beaming relay help tie multiple distant z wave items together
Review: i bought this because of it s beaming feature i didn t really need a light but i had several z wave deadbolt in my house that were located to far away from one another to complete the z wave mesh network since they re battery powered lock they need a device with beaming feature to serve a a relay hub and this fit the bill nicely as others mentioned it s a little tricky to install just because it need three wire where many switch will only have two a third neutral connection is required since the switch itself need to be powered in addition to switching the load off and on to whatever you re actively switching pairing it with my vera controller wa something of a pain and i had to consult a few web forum it seems the initial connection can be hard to make but once it s made it stick just fine it took me probably 10 12 attempt just repeating the pairing process over and over again until my vera unit flashed it leds at me indicating a proper handshake after the initial setup however the switch ha performed exactly a expected i have it turning an exterior porch light off and on per scene definition in vera my initial reason for buying it to serve a a hub relay for my z wave deadbolt worked great too where i had several too far away to consistently report into vera with this in the mix i get solid connection to them all
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: my first choice for smart light control
Review: let me start by saying that i have a large number of smart device in my home all integrated through wink i have lighting controlled by a variety of mean including bulb and smart outlet on power strip this smart light switch by ge is by far the most reliable way to have smart light control for a quick comparison of the method i have used smart bulbs very convenient and work in any light fixture that the bulb fit into convenience is the biggest factor and they are relatively inexpensive if there are few bulb in the fixture however if you have fixture with more than 3 bulb smart switch become a more affordable option the downside to these in my experience seems to be that they are more annoying to set up le reliable and resetting can be very difficult if they aren t working properly if you don t get the on off pattern timing perfect they won t reset of the many smart bulb i put in a combo of cree connected and ge link i had multiple that required multiple reset and were not always responsive in addition the bulb always need power to work with smart control so if someone hit the light switch to turn them off you can t turn them back on with smart control like wink smartthings or amazon echo one last downside is that each bulb is triggered with it own command from the smart home management system so they come on in a wave one upside to these is adding smart control to a ceiling fan running off of only one wall switch with the ceiling fan you can put in smart bulb and use those to control the light without turning off the whole fan if you don t want to use the cord smart switch definitely my favorite method these are extremely reliable in comparison to other method only took me 1 try to get each of them connected to the hub and they have always responded since i set them up a few week ago i have never had to reset any of them in addition you can turn the light off at the switch and still have them work with your smart home configuration if you want to turn them back on the downside is the price a smart bulb are often found for 10 15 each so if you don t need more than 3 the switch is definitely more expensive in addition installation is a bit more complicated a you have to wire the switch into the wall whereas bulb can just be plugged in a usual smart power strips i have the pivot power genius it is a bit slow and somewhat unreliable it frequently turn off on it own it is very inexpensive now but just a reliable lighting control i don t recommend this method i can t compare to other smart outlet though in short this switch is great it is reliable relatively easy to install and not very expensive if you want smart control in a fixture with more than 3 bulb this is the way to go if you want smart control for fixture with le than 3 bulb and don t mind the extra cost this is the way to go eventually i plan on replacing a many smart bulb a possible with these smart switch because they are much more convenient to use and much more reliable i would highly recommend this smart switch because it work so well and is le expensive than competitor switch like leviton awesome product
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: installed several of these and everything went smoothly they are wider than a standard toggle switch but still fit in all the panel i even have one triple switch panel and they fit side by side after installing them i flipped on the switch then went to the z wave controller and it automatically detected and added the device no having to mess with tamper switch like other z wave device which this doesn t have anyways i know some people were wondering about whether the neutral connection is required i do have the neutral wire and it wa necessary to connect the neutral before the switch worked so i cannot comment on if the neutral connection is required if you don t have the neutral wire
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works with metal switch plate and plastic electrical box in my installation
Review: i wa hesitant to install this in a 4 gang plastic switch box with a decorative metal switch plate i wa worried that the metal plate would interfere with the signal however it work perfectly probably because of the plastic box the switch is about 20 foot from the smart things hub on the next floor the response time is about 2 second using my smartphone out of range of my local wifi network using 4g phone network and instantaneous when the phone is connected to my local wifi now that i know this work so well i will be adding several more things to my system it would be a minor but nice improvement when adding device if the smart things app would pop up a message telling you to tap the device switch to sync instead of just showing it is searching for device a the rotating symbol spin around this is covered in the written instruction but it is easily overlooked
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: was a bit apprehensive about this a my first attempt to install a z wave light control the instruction were easy to follow but i ve basic understanding of electrical wiring and did some basic work at home previously the unit itself it much larger than a standard light switch make sure you have enough space to install this i had to move some wire around to make this fit but mainly due to the wiring work of the electrician who wired the house once installed setting it up wa not difficult my controller wa able to recognize it quickly and everything wa up and running in minute so nice to be able turn my light on off when i m not physically near the switch a little bit pricy though
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: with alexa you cannot go wrong
Review: this we just installed vivint smart home security system and added an amazon echo and i love it all i have to do now is say alexa kitchen light on and bam it s on when i m done alexa kitchen light off and go about my mary little way may seem lazy right not when the builder of your home put the light switch to the kitchen down the hall and about the equivalent of two bedroom away from the edge of the kitchen who doe that now i dont have to run down the hall like zombie are chasing me to turn the kitchen light on when i m down for a midnight snack love it and plan to do my whole house a few at a time also with our vivint system and echo we do not need the base for this a it tie directly into vivint and alexa access the switch from there
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: good would be great with the inclusion of led indicator great way to automate home light
Review: the reason i m giving this 4 5 star is that pricing should be cheaper being that there isn t much tech going into the add on switch not only that but i wish ge incorporated the led light onto the add on switch a well so you can easily locate the switch in a dark room but let s talk about why it did earn the 4 star first of all they were fairly simple to install paired easily with my samsung smartthings hub gen 2 and have been working reliably since i can also easily control the light through amazon s alexa enabled device but that s because of interoperability between alexa and samsung please be sure to check and make sure you have a neutral wire available before ordering this switch or it s counterpart also i m not an electrician by any mean but am a self taught handyman and i believe almost anyone can install this light with the help of google
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i bought this a my first z wave light switch to test it out i have a homeseer setup with a aeotec z stick for the software and controller hardware first the installation process in summary the switch feel very solid and well made instructions are very simple and do not explain everything you need to know i will buy more now that i know what to do this took me more than a little while to do because the instruction were not very clear the diagram indicates you only have to connect the hot and line wire to light it show the ground and neutral a optional i connected the ground but not the neutral after trying everything i could think of i finally gave up and called tech support the tech informed me that i had to connect the neutral switch for it to work he explained that i needed to take the little white wire included with the box and connect it to the bundle of white wire in the box not explained in the instruction after that it worked like a charm the instruction also don t explain how to initiate pairing the tech told me to turn the power on and then back off to initiate pairing it worked on the first try with my z stick
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: often the gang box isn t deep enough to hold all the wire easily and requires some force to get everything in place
Review: very difficult to fit into multigang box often the gang box isn t deep enough to hold all the wire easily and requires some force to get everything in place if there wa a way to make these smaller so they fit into normal gang box easier that would be a major improvement with this device functionally they work perfectly i wa able to get smartthings to control this device very easily upon applying power and even get amazon alexa to control it a well i would like to put more of these in my house but the difficulty of installation ha made me double think that
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: pool light application conversion and alexa integration
Review: ihave had this installed for about two week now took a while to convert everything from incandescent to led and then to this switch didn t realize at first i needed neutral wire had to run a neutral line to box i used this outside for my pool light on my swimming pool remains to be seen if this can hold up in the phoenix az summer and not fail i think it said rated to 104 degree f definitely get a lot hotter in the summer plus this switch is enclosed in a metal junction box i never thought the z wave function would transmit in this metal enclosure but it doe i also interfaced it with alexa and samsung smarthings all work well except the dimming function is not accurate percentage of dimming on the app doe not correlate well perhaps related to the type of led bulb i have in my pool now when i want pool light on i just say alexa pool light on or off pretty cool i have a spa light and also waterfall that are now potential for home automation this home automation stuff can go on and on definitely cool converting over incandescent bulb to led and then to automation definitely requires some electrical and mechanical skill on your part you are pushing the envelope and could not have done it without some forum like on amazon to answer question and multiple internet inquires to understand limitation and technicality but it is fun and keep my brain engaged
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: they seem to be well manufactured and solid but do they work yes this product is exactly a described pay attention to the direction the direction are very clear i first purchased two ge 12723 add on switches with one ge z wave wireless lighting control dimmer switch in order to test them out before buying them for the entire house i ran several test first i connected the controller dimmer by itself with one incandescent light and one led light in a a two way configuration everything worked fine then i added one add on switch so now we have a three way configuration everything worked fine then i added the second add on switch now we have a four way configuration everything worked fine in other reading and review i heard that some dimmer have problem with low load on the line the dimmer would not turn on at all so i removed the incandescent light leaving only one 5 watt led light now you can t get much lower load than that happily the switch worked flawlessly that s it for the actual review but here is a little background in my last home ten year ago there were few option for automation at that time i did a lot of research and decided on lutron radio ra a proprietary system i have to say that system wa solid expensive but solid it never failed needless to say i wa very happy with it for over 5 year until i wanted to add to it then i discovered that lutron discontinued radio ra and replaced it with radio ra ii which wa not downward compatible so my only option were to replace everything in my house or buy used if i could find it i felt that lutron betrayed there original customer by not supporting the first version so on my new home i have decided to use an open architecture type system and i have decided on zwave now i can buy all of the component part from many company hub switch sensor everything and i am no longer dependent on a single proprietary company with open architecture you have more option more development more competition which all lead to more innovation and lower price today there are aspect of zwave product that need improvement but it s getting better every day and more and more company are getting on board if one company abandon zwave there are many more out there to choose from
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: as i slowly make my home smarter i needed something to control a ceiling light that ha four bulb my requirement were pretty simple i wanted it to fit in the same space a the existing switch and work with my smartthings hub and my amazon echos this switch fit the bill installation wa easy the switch i replaced didn t use a neutral wire which is required for this switch but the neutral wa in the box so i just hooked it up with the included white wire and i wa in business note i m not an electrician but this this really wa easy works great with all of my other smart home product i m now able to just say alexa turn on the bedroom light or set up the smartthings to turn the light on in the morning etc
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: love love love being able to have a new switch available that doesn t require a neutral even though i have a brand new house there happened to be two switch that didn t have a neutral so now i m able to get the rest of my light and switch automated also before i switched out to my incandescence bulb the cfls flickered like crazy it s mentioned in the description of the product no cfls and no led light on this switch i assumed that to mean because of the fact there s always current running through the circuit and those type of bulb would never fully turn off cfls and leds do work with the ge switch that require neutral though
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: very nice feature we never have to worry about touching
Review: i use this with the adt pulse system to control a light with a camera we have an outdoor camera that over look a certain door at our house normally we leave the light off because no one is ever out there however i wa able to program this successfully to turn on only at night when that camera detects motion it work very quickly in fact i approached it from several different angle and each time the light turned on in enough time to get full hd color shot of the person around the door window the camera over look once the camera go 15 min without detecting motion it turn the light back off very nice feature we never have to worry about touching the light switch either a i wa working on the house and motion feature tied in to adt kept the light on until i left we also never worry about leaving the light on installation wa easy but some note 1 you must have 3 wire minimum to use this in the switch box line hot load black to light neutral 2 if your switch is in line with the light and the neutral go from the light back to the breaker box and not to the switch you cant use this the z wave need to stay powered if your neutral line from your light go back to the switch you can use this so if you only have a black wire in to the switch and black wire away from the switch but no neutral wire in the switch you will have to either add a neutral or you cant use it 3 easy to install if you know what your doing i had this installed and up and running in le than 10 minute from receiving the package opening it to having it up and working
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: primary add on work great but maybe not with fluorescent
Review: i got the primary and the add on switch to replace a 3 way fluorescent kitchen light a 3 way is used where two switch control one light all wa wonderful for about an hour or so then the add on switch would not turn on the light and it would turn it off by pressing either the top or the bottom button rather than just the bottom i turned off the power at the main panel to reset the switch and all wa well again for about an hour or so i called tech support the first question she asked wa what kind of light i had connected she said it would work with cfl bulb but possibly not all fluorescent or maybe i had a bad switch and should replace them she suggested i try these switch on other light first well we have wanted to put led bulb in the kitchen anyway so i opted to replace the fluorescent bulb with led bulb and bypass the ballast when i did this the switch still did not work correctly i didn t actually know at this point if the switch were bad originally or if the ballast in the fluorescent fixture had damaged the switch the tech support person did not know either amazon replaced the switch and now all is well i love them they work with wink and they work with the amazon echo my original 3 way had three wire black white red in the primary switch i made the black the line the white the load and the red the traveler of course you also connect the white wire included with the switch to the neutral the add on switch only allows two connection the included white wire for the neutral and the traveler which in my case wa red since the add on switch doe not connect to 120v power i used a wire nut not included to join the black and white together
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: easy install but big box and bright blue light
Review: installation is simple if you know how to turn off your circuit breaker and have a screwdriver you can do it yourself one downside to this unit is that behind the face is a large box containing the electronics if you have an older home with small electrical box or if your electrical box is crowded with other outlet and too much extra wiring it can be a bit of a challenge to fit of course you can take this opp if you have an older home with small electrical box or if your electrical box is crowded with other outlet and too much extra wiring it can be a bit of a challenge to fit opportunity to do some organization of the wiring trimming excess etc another downside to this unit is that there is a blue light on the front that is quite bright depending on your installation location and particular use that light may create an unexpected point of focus for something that should be a unobtrusive a a power outlet still this is a good unit and the installation is easy
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great for non dimmable under cabinet led light
Review: i use these with my samsung smartthings hub they paired right up in our kitchen we have these under cabinet led strip that plug into an outlet so i used these outlet to control the led light i didn t need dimming control because the led strip aren t dimmable anyway one of the two outlet is controlled by z wave and the other one is always on i hadn t realized before but there s a button in between the outlet which you can use to manually switch power to the z wave outlet this is always good when whatever smart lighting program i ve set isn t working for some reason and my wife just want the damn light to come on this hasn t actually happened to me yet but i know i would get an earful were it to happen and there weren t a manual switch i ve already told her about since these node of your home automation network are powered they extend your mesh network i had an outdoor z wave switch in my garage that the network wa not reaching until i installed these outlet in the kitchen at which point everything connected up fine
