Review: i am new to home automation and recently started working on home automation one thing at a time i bought a used switch from amazon warehouse and it work perfectly i have it connected to my samsung smartthings the smartthings recognized the switch within a minute and is working flawlessly since i use it to control a light and the existing switch wa installed without a neutral connection i wa real confused a to where to find a neutral connection but after a little search i found all the neutral white wire are all spindle together and is kept in the back of the box installed the supplied white wire on the switch and added it to other white wire and all problem solved i bought another one and installed it today both are working good and i am really liking home automation now it s real easy to install but please shut off the breaker before trying any electrical system update
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: love the zwave product instruction is not that clear on how to install the switch after spending 10 minute searching the web for hint and tip found useful information to install the switching and the color coding of the wire after the switch installed i spent the next three day mostly in the evening after work to try to get the switch registered with the smartthings hub not much instruction nor anything on the switch to tell me what is going on would be nice if there is somekind of light a inidicator that it is alive and sending signal or failing sending out signal after trying random thing based on some instruction found on the web manage to get the switch registerd with the controller i still don t know what i did that register it just lucky i guess there are a few more switch that i want to convert over to zwave however due to the hard time configurating this one cause me to pause on the next purchase
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i love these switch ya they are a little expensive but they work great pairs very easily with my smartthings hub 2 i didn t think i would add so many thing to my hub but i ve got at least 30 thing on it now with at least 12 routine and different smart apps and everything with these switch are working great i ve never need to rental them or anything they are bigger than your normal switch but with a little squishing they have fit into all of my gang box my house wa made in 1969 if thats any reference to anyone you do need a neutral wire connect for these switch to work if there isn t already a neutral wire in your gang box there is one that come with the switch i have these switch connected to 6 led s on one witch all the way to just one led light bulb on another switch and i haven t had any problem with buzzing or not working right its expensive but it worked perfect for me ill keep buying them
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: cool at first then a headache
Review: i purchased this along with the samsung smarthing hub after the hub app and update were done it connected nicely to the ge z wave outlet and wa able to use my iphone or alexia to control the outlet i loved it then after two week my love faded i called ge tech support and they advised that the outlet wa ok a i could manually turn it off and on and the blue light wa on so i called samsung they looked at the account and advised that the hub wa fine and that the outlet wa not communicating to the hub long story short i returned the ge outlet now back to a good old outlet not a cool but reliable i might be returning the hub a well just waiting to see if i m going to spring for another wireless outlet
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have been using this outlet for a few month now it is hooked into my wink controller so i can control it from my phone from across the city i got this specifically to control a non remote control pedestal fan this outlet plus the fan equaled the cost of a fan that had remote control built in so it wa basically a free controlled outlet there is a blue led in the middle of the outlet that led is lit when the switched outlet is off it is incredibly bright and with the outlet in my bedroom it is too bright thankfully it turn off when the outlet is on so it s almost always off according to the instruction and what i found online the led can be set to work differently always on always off or switched with the outlet sadly that isn t an option on the wink that isn t an issue with the outlet though just in case it isn t clear only one of the outlet is switched the other one is always on
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: bought this add on switch to run the 3 way switch
Review: bought this add on switch to run the 3 way switch around my house for my iris by lowes system to automate my light switch only have 2 pole not including the ground so wiring is a little different from standard 3 pole 3 way switch once i traced the source common and traveler wire connecting the switch took only minute the component of this switch is 2 time the size dept of a regular switch so fitting this switch to a 2 gang outlet box can be a change
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: good switch but remember requires a neutral and hot load terminal order matter
Review: this is a good switch and simple to install with 2 caveat 1 load black line hot black terminal position matter unlike on a standard single pole switch 2 requires a neutral connection create one by using a pigtail connection to the neutral wire bundle in the existing box i had to run back and forth to my panel a few time until i figured this out the wiring diagram doe show this setup but doesn t explicitly explain the hot load order matter and that the switch requires a neutral to function once wired up switch work great and is easy to pair
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: i wa glad it came with the jumper because i didn t feel
Review: i bought this so i could remotely control my front porch light i ve installed and replaced light switch before and the instruction don t make it clear that the white wire is mandatory and that is what the extra piece of wire is for i installed the line load and ground and turned power back on line wa live but load wa not and the light would not turn on i found a video just in case i missed something and the video mentioned to install the white wire using the included jumper i wa glad it came with the jumper because i didn t feel like undoing the existing wire and figuring out which one i needed since i wa installing in a three gang box after that wa connected i turned the power on again and got the switch connected to my smartthings hub without dragging it from one room to another and without having to exclude it first i just opened smartthings on my phone found the ge light zwave light switch and flicked the switch and i wa good to go
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: put some z in your wave
Review: so far so good i bought two to connect to my wink hub in a medium room they wired up easily and have functioned for a few month i guess my only thing is how bright the blue led is on the outlet fortunately the two outlet are hidden by a piece of furniture and it block it some people may like the brightness some may not i suppose it depends on the intended usage i also wish they came in a duplex style plug but these two thing are tiny in relation to the positive i had to add one more thing when adding the outlet to my hub it didn t link right a a ge plug i believe i used leviton for it to function correctly when setting everything up
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i ve been building out my smart home automation within the house and needed a z wave light switch that would replace a malfunctioning timer switch controlling my outdoor stoop and garage light install is a snap but remember you must have a neutral wire for this work took under 10 minute to remove the old switch install this new switch have my smartthings hub discover it and then to add the simple timer rule on and sunset off at sunrise acts a a z wave repeater a well so my other device are all connecting much better now i can now start to add more complex rule controlling when and why light go on and off thru smartthings mobile app nice switch good price work great
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i ve installed 5 of these ge z wave light switches 12722 now and they are work great the first 3 took me 1 5 hour to install although it say int the manual that it should take about 15 min but once i figured it out the next set of 2 wa easy i only needed to connect 3 wire 1 hot 1 common and 1 neutral white i have my switch connected to samsung smartthings hub one thing that wa annoying wa that the switch had to be within 10 ft or so of the st hub otherwise it d wouldn t connect but once it s connected they work great i have mine set up so that the little blue light stay on when the light is off it make it easier to find the light switch in the dark the switch doe make a clicking sound when you press it to turn it on off but i barely notice it great product for great price here on amazon
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: good product need fine tuning to become great
Review: i set up a 3 way the good it s a nice solution the way it power light up and down reminds me of a lutron the bad the thing is massive the control switch requires every type of wire in the box so once you pull them all out good luck getting them back in getting the thing to fit in the box took a much time a wiring it if you have older style box get ready for frustration i have no idea how you would do a 4 gang not a lot of room once you stuff and i mean stuff these giant in the controller switch is too tall the slide switch will lock up once you put a faceplate on because the thing need to be about 1 16 of an inch shorter to move in a standard faceplate cutout so make sure it is set to on because it will never move again the instruction stink i wa all over google and youtube to make sure i wasn t going to mi wire it they ought to direct you to a video specific to the switch because it is not a typical wiring setup besides explaining to the diy installer in basic language what the heck the 4 wire do how the circuit operates in the controller slave setup is just a basic safety item in this case
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: hard to physically hard wire work great after that
Review: works great with my vera edge hub also look and feel like a real light switch even an expensive real light switch not a cheap or complicated gadget i had to push the button a few time to get it pair but that wasn t a big deal like maybe it took 20 second instead of 10 second then it paired just fine even with the hub across the house they also come with a pigtail wire to help you attached to the neutral which is nice since the neutral is not wired to a regular mechanical switch so if you have a neutral in a wire nut at the back of box you re all set the problem with these is that these are the hardest switch to install i ve ever encountered in term of actually attaching the wire to the screw terminal the screw tend to fall into the housing until they re tightened and they re recessed into the housing in way that make it hard to get the wire around them maybe there s some trick i don t know if i add more i m undecided whether to see if another brand is easier to install or just stick with this brand for consistency and because in the end it doe work
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: the switch easily paired with both a veralite controller a well a
Review: the switch easily paired with both a veralite controller a well a the wink hub i just purchased we are using several of these to control outdoor light on our porch garage door sidewalk the run on a schedule to come on every night around dark and shut off at 10pm with veralite they work flawlessly and you are even able to change the variable to turn the blue led indicator on when the switch is on and off when the switch is off by default it is the other way around vera also always a dynamic start time in the schedule so you can turn on at sunset or sunset several minute no need to adjust the on time based on the season it doe it for you wink is still having issue correctly reporting the status of generic z wave device such a this one it keep track of the on off of each switch if i am using the wink app to control them however if you use the switch manually heaven forbid or use them in a wink schedule the app just doesn t keep up the good thing about z wave is that on and off are distinct value so if you cycle through your light in the wink app flipping them on and off you can rest assured the app is now is sync with the light hopefully this is something wink address sooner than later where wink doe have an advantage is their native support for geo fencing in addition to a set schedule i have always wanted veralite to turn the outside light on for 15 20 min if my wife and i happen to arrive home late after 10pm when the light are off this is something easily built into a wink robot which us your iphone location to let wink know when you are arriving at or leaving from a set address veralite doe have some third party iphone location add in but have never really got them working all that well
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: great connected switch it wa easy to install although i needed to do some more research on correctly wiring it the wiring diagram wa initially unclear especially the ground common wiring which when you blow the diagram up all of a sudden become more clear the switch work well and wa easily able to be configured and recognized by the samsun smarthings hub it wa easily configured to turn on my outside light at sunset and turn them off at sunrise it work flawlessly and ha never dropped the connection or failed to work it work a a regular switch all the time which doe not impact the automated function there is a small blue led light on the lower right corner than is lit when the device is connected but not on it go off when the switch is activated i loved this switch so much i ve ordered two more to replace other outside light switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great switch if you have a neutral wire
Review: i have five of the ge z wave plus product and all of them function near perfectly one thing to keep in mind is that all of the in wall connection require a neutral wire to be present do yourself a favor and check your wall box first to see if the wiring is already there other than that it is a simple deal to wire them in and connect them to your z wave hub i use wink 2 ge is one of the few that actually offer an in wall fan controller and it actually work great you get more than just low medium high but the entire 1 100 range i ve taken quite a shine to setting my fan on 1 and it is just enough to keep the air moving without adding a windchill to it
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: this z wave smart switch is the perfect solution to bridge the physical
Review: this z wave smart switch is the perfect solution to bridge the physical and virtual world in your smart home no need to search around for the remote or wait for you app to load in order to control a relay up in the light fixture this switch wa easy to wire joined painlessly to my z wave network and look very clean i would highly recommend this switch for you smart home to clear up a little confusion this device need a neutral wire there s a very good chance that you have that if your ha ha been built fairly recently 10 year the neutral wire is typically white whereas the load and line will be black my only complaint is the cost of this device but that is a fact of life with z wave currently hopefully in the future these device will be more accessible and priced more reasonably
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i searched the internet high and low to find z wave light switch that will work on a 3 way switch meaning two different switch can control the same light for example this wa the only brand i found that would work for me because my house is filled with 3 way switch these are really nice because you can buy the 19 add on slave switch to go with this any way this totally solved my problem and need or should i say want for having my entire house equipped with smart switch now when i go to bed i can just turn off all the light at once from my iphone vivint alarm panel my husband android phone tablet etc another nice perk is that these switch can be added to a vivint sky panel security alarm because it run off z wave then you don t need to buy a hub if connecting to your vivint sky panel just call vivint customer service and they ll give you a temporary code to get into what s called the tool panel and walk you there adding them something else you should know is that these are deep and will be a tight fit when installing them because the back is much deeper than a regular switch not a big deal but just know it will be a tight fit
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: fast shipping and a great price adt wanted 109 00 for this exact same switch plus instal installation wa pretty easy but a other reviewer have mentioned you must use all four wire hot common load ground this switch once installed linked up immediately to my adt pulse alarm system this switch is fairly large so in order to fit it into my junction box with 3 other switch i had to remove the side tab no big deal bend them back and forth a couple of time and they come right off easiest to do this before you install the switch into the wall at 41 00 this wa a great deal if you are comfortable working with electricity if not even if you need to hire an electrician the money you save on buying this switch from this seller will offset the money you will pay the electrician make sure if you install this yourself you use a volt meter to determine which of the 2 black wire in your junction box is the hot wire and which is your load wire
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: love the duplex plug i really hate the brightness of the led in my bedroom
Review: can the led be any brighter i bought the duplex plug only a couple day ago put it in my bedroom to control a lamp via the amazon echo and the wink hub i ve done a lot of electrical work so this wa easy to put in and connect it wasn t the easiest z wave for the wink hub to find i have a lot of light switch and lock that were easier but my biggest complaint is about the super bright blue led that shine on my bed from across the room it s like having a night lite on whenever the z wave switch is turned off will i buy another one sure will i put it in a room where i sleep never again
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i purchased 4 of these so far install will depend on your setup mine wa a pain but it had nothing to do with the product just my electrical setup the one thing to pay close attention to is that these require a neutral wire instructions and information on the product page are very clear about this but it took me a few try to figure out why it wasn t working not all of my switch had neutral so i had to improvise a bit once i got past the installation setup wa easy and the work beautifully i m going to buy at least 2 dimmer i thought these were dimmer but that wa my fault they re not took a few time for my wink hub to recognize them during setup but i worked around it and highly recommend these this is a great solution for controlling item that you can t simply replace a bulb for
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great outlet that work flawlwssly with my vera lite controller
Review: this thing work spectacularly i have it installed in my medium cabinet because my cable provider cannot figure out why the internet keep dropping out the only thing i have to do to restore internet service is unplug the modem and plug it back in this wa getting tiresome a i would wake up almost every morning without internet access i plugged the modem into this and have a scene that run on my vera lite every five minute if the vera can t talk to google a simple get request it assumes that the internet is down and shuts off the modem i have another scene that say if the modem is off at any point turn it on in fifteen second i now have a log of every time the internet go out and am working with my isp to find a resolution but i am happy that i have a watchdog on the internet connection all thanks to this little outlet the bottom of the two outlet is the z wave enabled one by the way
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works with adt pulse from 15 ft away on different floor
Review: this is to advertise my stupidity and to save everyone else the same trouble i went through i struggled for 2 day to pair it with adt pulse the mistake i wa making wa i thought the load and line connection were interchangeable in a typical switch that is likely true so didn t pay much attention to what load v line meant so i connected the line to load and vice versa the switch never came on i thought the switch wasn t close enough to the gateway that s why it wasn t pairing note that even without pairing you must be able to get the led on if not then your wiring is off useful info it work with adt pulse a many have already said more importantly you do not need to bring the switch very close to the gateway which can be very difficult to do for this device in my case the switch wa on the first floor and the gateway in the basement about 15 foot away i guess with a couple of wall in between challenges apart from me confusing with the load and line the main challenge are i you need to have a neutral ii the switch doe take a lot of space so fitting them inside the box can be a bit of challenge i installed two together iii breaking the tab away requires some non trivial effort
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: the switch itself is sturdy and connection were a breeze
Review: i installed this on a three way light circuit along with an add on switch if you have limited electrical experience you may want to consider getting professional help this is at the outside edge for a causal diy take your time and identify line load traveler with a multimeter on both of your existing switch before disconnecting them note that you will need to connect a neutral because the switch itself is a working item not merely an interruptor the switch itself is sturdy and connection were a breeze it is a sizable item so if you have a multi gang box you may find space get tight if you try to place more than one of these one i had it hooked up correctly it worked fine it did take a couple of attempt to get it added to my network wink hub definitely follow the recommendation to have the hub within 10 of your device when you establish a connection after that range isn t any issue has been totally reliable both using the hub both voice and app a well a the switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: when it work with samsung smart things it is great problem is it often doesn t work
Review: this product along with samsung smart things is so unreliable the app may turn on the light but might not turn them off biggest problem the app or alexa will indicate your the command wa completed when it hasn t been you may end up keeping a light or series of light on when you think they are off defeats the purpose if you have to constantly second guess what the app alexa say completely inaccurate most of the time on the positive side when it works it is great i have had this for a few week and once again it is completely ineffective i don t know if it is the fault of ge smart switch or samsung smart things but i can say i am frustrated
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i got this to add to my iots using the samsungthings v2 hub i bought one toggle switch to test i did not want to have to replace the face plate this wa more expensive than the paddle switch which i have bought several pros works with smartthings hub v2 easy to setup and install worked with existing switch plate ge brand is reliable good review cons price should be under 20 more expensive than paddle switch only came in one color toggle is a bit odd and stand out recommendations add a ivory cap to toggle lower price offer 4 pack for 100
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: one bad switch out of four
Review: bought 3 of these to use with smartthings hub the first two switch installed a expected and synched with the hub instantly the third switch refused to synch with the hub but did work fine on manual after a few hour of trying to get a synch i realized the switch wa probably bad tried calling jayco but there wa a two hour wait on the phone i am not going to wait that long contacted amazon on monday after noon and there wa a new switch on my porch by tuesday afternoon i have no idea how amazon doe this but they must be using teleportation or black magic anyway the new switch installed easily and synched with the hub instantly even though i got one bad switch i still give these switch 5 star and will buy more
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: defective over time with blinking blue light of death
Review: i bought around 40 of these altogether and z waved my house all up light dimmer lock sensor you name it the only problem is these ge module keep flaking out and dying they go into a mode where the blue light flash and neither the z wave control nor the manual control work it d be one thing if it just lost z wave connectivity but the fact that it doesn t degrade gracefully into a normal lightswitch is an absolute failing the manual contains no information about what a blinking blue light mean i ve been unable to hard reset them or get the working again which mean i need to start returning these a they fail other minor problem i could live with the blue light sometimes fails a well a few of my 40 never have a blue light despite it z wave config for when it s on there s a quarter second of latency between touching them and the light actually turning on or off disappointed in ge i wanted to love these
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: 5 stars for dimming switch and on off switch but 2 stars for fan control
Review: z wave pairing work fine and easy for all ge switch physical button on dimming and on off switch are great but more difficult to use on fan control model fan control ha only 3 speed so you need to press long enough to get to the next speed but not too long or you will skip the medium speed not a major issue but compare to other ge switch fan control is not a easy to use the indicator light is customizable can turn on when switch is on or programmed to turn on when switch is off based on your need dimming and on off switch work fine with fluorescent light or led the fan control switch is designed for fan only and shouldn t be used for light on off and dimming switch report their status to the controller but fan control doesn t it s a major disadvantage the other even more serious issue with fan control is that medium and low speed can t be adjusted and set far too low all fan i have tried just stopped spinning on low and most of them didn t spin even on medium setting one minor complain for all ge switch it would be nice if they could measure and report power usage fyi this is a newer version of ge switch with neutral wire
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: solid z wave switch with z wave plus
Review: arrived earlier than expected the new zwave plus switch is the exact same size a the previous model the 12724 and look identical the function of the switch feel very solid and the installation wa just a easy a always the additional color faceplace is perfect for those needing light almond color and match existing normal switch perfectly no problem pairing and operating with samsung smartthings but doe not appear to have any of the new feature such a instant status or scene a of yet
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great switch with relatively easy install
Review: i ordered this switch to install and pair with my smartthings hub after reading through the included instruction i wasn t sure exactly how to install it i called an electrician friend who helped me with the first one and i installed the remaining 9 on my own the switch paired easily and look great i plan to purchase more to expand my smartthings installation
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works great connected to the hub note that this switch must be grounded to operate
Review: we have a rental property which ha a smart things hub with several light an internet connected lock and a moisture sensor connected i installed the ge z wave smart switch to control a kitchen light my goal wa to have several light programmed to go on and off while the house is not occupied i installed this by swapping out a single spdt switch that the original switch wa not grounded and i installed the z wave switch in the same way that the original switch wa wired i found that in this set up it did not work the ge z wave switch need to be grounded to function properly i connected the ground and it worked a expected the instruction that are packaged with the switch do indicate that it should be wired to neutral hot and ground
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: super easy install doe require a neutral wire with the new wink update 3 3 25 my hub recognized the switch with easy it replaced a lutron dimer that caused my fan to hum now everything is perfect it doe come with an almond color toggle if the white doesn t do it for you but we are going for a very clean white look
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: you don t need an electrician to install this switch
Review: so the first thing i noticed is the offer to have an electrician install this switch for 125 well i m no electrician but i have done some rewiring in our house throughout the year secondly almost all the product of this type of item sold thru amazon come with an installation video under the product description this particular video is very good after watching it several time i wa ready to pull the old switch and install this one first problem when i pulled the old switch is that the two black line were not marked for load or line i have a volt meter and applied power to identify the load and line the line snap into the switch very easily and there is a little jumper cable included for the two white neutral wire after installation i installed the ge smart floodlight bulb and pushed the bottom toggle once and the little blue led indicator on the switch lit pulled up my wink hub and it recognized the switch and bulb told alexa to turn the light on and voila it worked i then told alexa to turn this light on 30 minute before sunset and off 30 minute after sunrise will let this run for a few day and if there are not any issue i plan to upgrade all my outdoor floodlight to this system i ve also established a floodlight group in the wink hub so i can control all light outside with one command happy install everyone
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: ended up returning it and glad i did
Review: i bought another vendor s zigbee toggle switch on amazon that wa cheaper initially ended up returning it and glad i did this ge unit is of much better quality comes with the two short screw usually needed for reattaching the plate shorter than normal wall plate screw also come with a short pigtail wire for the neutral which is a nice inclusion most importantly i wa able to insert the wire tighten the screw and the wire held fast the cheaper unit not ge would not hold the wire tightly and they kept popping out despite tightening the terminal screw a best a i could unit is working superbly so far and connected to samsung smartthings without a hitch very pleased will be buying more of these
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i ve been useing this product since i order it with my home control system i am useing its been able to handle the ac i run on a box truck that i use this on to turn on and off depending on the tempture it ha had no heating issue with the amprage it pulling so having two more of these installed to handle two more ac unit easy to installed and setup with the home system i use simply press button several time while your system in pairing mode and your good to go
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: nice product work well with smarthings
Review: i have been looking for z wave fan control for a while the other model available is from leviton which is way more expensive 87 on amazon i installed the ge smart fan control switch over the weekend since i am an experienced z wave user have over 40 device on smartthings the implementation wa very straight forward you do need neutral wire white for this switch to work smartthings doe not recognize this switch a a correct device type automatically when i first added this switch wa added a a on off switch i had remove this device from the network and add again a a ge dimmer it work fine with three speed mode available operating this switch manually is little bit tricky and need to get use to it tapping on switch toggle between on and off to change speed one ha to hold on keep switch pressed watch the blinking light to notice the changed speed mode i would have been much happier if the correct device type fan control wa added to smartthings but am happy to operate it a a dimmer listed
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: setup is fairly easy just look at the diagram that come with it make sure to connect the neutral wire i am by no mean an experience electrician in fact prior to this my only electrical experience wa flipping the breaker connection to smartthings it syncs up with smartthings pretty easily i use it in mode away home etc leak smoke notification easy peasy i am not a fan of the price a it add up replacing several switch in your house however if you want a truly smart house or smart lighting i am a believer in smart switch compared to smart bulb which i also own and use
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i am using with the wink home hub it work like a charm it does take a neutral wire i tried without the neutral and it would not even turn on at all i saw review that said the neutral wa not required but that is not the case there were neutral wire in the box so i wa ok switch came with a neutral jumper my switch went into a 3 gang box it wa a little tight in the box but nothing major i did move this to the middle of the 3 switch it is about the same size a a gfci outlet it is great to turn the light on off while outside
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: let me say i love my switch and dimmer so far and am ordering more only to see they re out of stock i control my outdoor kitchen with them and looking to add more functionality to my home i use a samsung smartthings hub and apparently they are also compatible with adt pulse issues raised by others valuable to know yes you need a neutral wire in your box to operate the device they need power for the z wave electronics there s no way around this unless someone develops a battery powered version yes they are large and did not fit in my original switch box i replaced it with a conventional box and all is good yes i had issue pairing but it wasn t that difficult and it wasn t anything difficult to resolve for those who have issue pairing or keeping the device paired it could be a signal strength issue i had this behavior with a garage door opener i added a device between my hub and the garage and the problem wa solved it extended the z wave mesh for a reliable connection overall highly recommended i just read the first 20 or so negative review and most i suggest discounting
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: easy to install be sure you have a neutral
Review: works great easy to install and easy to pair and use with homeseer hs3 i ve purchased dozen of these and have noticed that some of them don t immediately pair i had to go through the remove sequence before i could include and successfully pair a few of them odd note that you do need a neutral white wire for these to work in my experience they do not function without a neutral white wire
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: so this switch is used in conjunction with a ge 12727 switch in a 3 way setup once i figured out that this switch existed it wa easy to install it in conjunction with the other ge z wave switch the instruction were very straightforward showing me what a typical 3 way configuration looked like and also the setup with the ge switch you have to be able to identify which switch ha the hot wire and which one just ha the two traveler but if you get it right it work fine for me it worked the first time it s actually better than a normal 3 way switch setup because for both switch up is on and down is off with a typical 3 way switch pair one of them is always on when the switch is down
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great switch i have it connected with my instance
Review: great switch i have it connected with my instance of openhab and it work beautifully openhab found the device in no time and setup wa a breeze the only complaint discomfort that i have with this switch is that every time it trigger there s an audible click it s not that big of a deal but if you want absolute silence you might want to look elsewhere another thing that you need to know is that while it s a toggle switch the switch lever never leaf the center you pull it up down to turn on off the light and the lever come back to the center position other than that i absolutely love it and would highly recommend p s word of caution this switch requires neutral white wire you should check that your electrical wire ha 3 wire in it before buying this switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: add on ha no night light ge12723 add on compared to linear wt00z add on switch
Review: the add on switch work fine beware that unlike the ge12722 3way switch or dimmer switch the add on switch doe not have the led light on the bottom so you can find it in the dark i find this very handy and miss this feature note that the linear wt00z add on switch does have the led night light although it is not interchangeable with the ge 12723 in term of wiring the ge 12723 requires a traveler from the master switch the wt00z doe not require a traveler just line and neutral which can be a big advantage if you are adding a remote 3way switch since you do not need wire connecting master and add on to use wt00z with ge switch pair both with smartthings controller then use wt00z with smart lighting app to control the ge or any other switch basically the wt00z can act a a one button scene controller and remotely control a ge switch or whatever group of device you like the wt00z ha radio built in unlike the ge 12723 add on switch which is designed to work specially with the ge 3way or dimmer switch via the traveler wire
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this wa easy to wire up and linked right up to my adt pulse system 3 wire blk hot wht common green neutral this again like i have posted on other z wave product i have bought on amazon wa a lot le expensive than what adt would charge you for the exact same item in fact this item wa not even offered to me when adt updated my system probable because they are not electrician and it is much easier profitable to just sell you their adapter that plug into your existing outlet no electrician needed i bought one of those when they upgraded my system because i wa not informed that the ge z wave receptacle even existed other wise i would have gone that route instead it is a much cleaner custom look than their plug in there is nothing wrong with the plug in in fact you might like the fact that it is not hard wired in you can move it around the house anywhere you like if you do prefer the plug in buy it here on amazon and you will save a lot of money
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: work very well but you might need to break down and get assistance to install
Review: i am very happy with my switch i now have a half dozen of these installed all talking perfectly with my smarthub i wanted to echo jonathan birge s sentiment in the helpful comment section for this product that these can be somewhat challenging to install i installed the first couple myself and they worked perfectly then i ordered more switch and wa almost immediately stumped by my 1976 home s wiring i m no slouch for simple electrical task but these are not a simple one for one swap for your existing switch i have no problem working my way through a 3 way switch installation hint just draw it out on a piece of paper but i do confess that the need for neutral line and my desire to stay in code and not crossfeed my circuit had me resort to finally calling a local electrician the money wa well spent and i ve now moved a little more into the 21st century
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great switch but watch the face plate screws
Review: these switch work great before you buy look at the wiring in the box for the switch you are about to replace and make sure that there is a neutral wire in the box this switch will not work without a neutral wire also make sure you know which wire is the load go to the light and which wire is the line always hot and come from the breaker panel use a meter to be sure this switch requires that neutral line and load are all connected to the correct terminal on the switch also if you do not want to use the white cover plate screw that come with the switch you must shorten your current plat crew a others have noted 1 2 star for this i think there is a design flaw in the switch regardless most off the shelf wire stripper have a bolt cutter built into them http www amazon com tools vise grip stripper crimper 2078309 dp b000jnnwq2 ref sr_1_1 s power hand tool ie utf8 qid 1440418485 sr 1 1 keywords wire stripper the other 1 2 star is due to the fact that they only come in white
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: clean install and work great with adt pulse
Review: i bought 3 of these ge jasco z wave on off switch and all of them work great so far i ran into some wiring challenge with two switch that i wanted to replace so had to ditch self install and call an electrician to get the neutral properly fished out and connected once wired in the switch were instantaneously discovered by the z wave hub i have a netgear router hub that is z wave enabled provided by adt for their pulse security system the ge 45609 switch are in adt s approved list of device and i am able to control the switch using my pulse android app if you have adt pulse with at least one automation device lamp module switch thermostat etc then you don t need to buy another z wave hub and you don t need to pay adt for adding more z wave device to your mesh network i believe adt need to initially enable z wave connectivity in your router account hence the dependency on having at least one automation device you may be able to get z wave activated without purchasing a unit by calling their customer service but i cannot comment on the success rate of that the documentation that come with the switch is not very crisp about how to get it in discovery mode for pairing with the hub i enabled search in the hub and tapped the switch a few time and it did the trick for installation in older gang box you may need to creatively route the existing wire to accommodate the depth of the switch without shorting any contact also if you plan to install more than one in a switch box you will likely need to break off the metal tab on either side of the switch if you rock those tab gently with plier they come off cleanly noticed recently that lowes sell a variant of this switch for their iris platform under the series number 45637 for around 35 while superficial analysis make me think that it is the exact same switch a the 45609 i will need to try one to confirm will post an update when i do so
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: it work and we love it
Review: this wa easy to install ge ha an excellent youtube channel and worked flawlessly from the get go it paired easily with my smartthings hub and alexa control it from there my family love being able to control the lighting by voice and manually controlling the switch also work extremely well i m very pleased with this purchase we ll be filling the house with these
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: a nice option for anyone looking at z wave compatible home automation device
Review: i have a combination of insteon and z wave product in my setup now i recently installed a schlage door lock in anticipation for my kid starting to walk home from school a they get older i wanted to get notification when someone unlocked the door via the keypad to get thing operating correctly i had to add some switch to extend the z wave signal to the front door the z wave for me wa a bit more problematic setting up and i had to factory reset the device a number of time so they would be discovered properly so far so good and they are priced a bit cheaper than the insteon product
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: very nice if you are connected to a hub
Review: well you really need to read everything carefully i saw alexa compatible and i saw ge and i ordered the switch unfortunately it wasn t until i had installed it that i saw it needed a hub in order for it to operate back it went i see other switch mentioning the fact that a hub is not needed this is mentioned in the main description i wish they had mentioned that this needs hub connection i am guessing that this is a very good unit hence the star rating the unit wa easy to install and looked good
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great add on switch for the ge three way z wave switch
Review: the ge jasco add on switch z wave work perfectly with the three way z wave switch i am using this in a finished basement hallway and have included it in a wink home automation set up currently it is triggered either by a person going down the stair when the basement door open there is a tripper sensor on the door that trigger a robot to turn on the light or when some one press one of the paddle button this setup work great the switch included into my setup with no issue and i have been using them for several month now with out issue highly recommend these for anyone looking to expand their existing z wave installation or start a new ha setup while maintaining the convenience of standard decor style light switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i now have many of these switch i use them with a wink controlled by either a harmony hub or echo depending on what i am doing at the moment usually the echo these never lose connection and work perfectly the blue light on them is not intrusive and even work well in a bedroom the only thing i wish these had wa the ability to send status without being polled i guess another company hold the patent for that sometimes the wink doe not see them a being off and therefore doesn t trigger the activity i have set when one of them is turned off for a few second when it is manually turned off
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: easy to configure good construction make wiring safe and secure
Review: i use this with samasung smartthings i wa easy to configure i used temporary wire hookup powered to on then smartthings quickly configured the switch is very sturdy and ha wire screw lug that make wiring easy very secure and safe i first installed one liked it so much i purchased two more and installed them two in one electrical box i did first configure before installing to make sure they were working they control led light bulb two outdoor and one indoor very sturdy and much better than my old x 10 light switch which leak current in the off position especially noticeably with led light bulb also the ge switch are properly grounded they made my wiring much better i would highly recommend this switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: great product to fit into your z wave implementation i have adt pulse especially if you have cfl bulb this switch requires a common wire connection it us the line and common to power the switch note that most house only wire light switch with two wire the line power coming into the switch and the load wire going off to the light while the common wire which return from the light is typically bundled in the back of the box with all the other common wire i had to make a trip to the hardware store to buy some wire 12 awg white to tap into that common wire bundle and connect to the switch note also that the line power and load to light wire must be connected in the right spot a well took me an hour the first time because i had no clue about the wiring or what i had or needed and it didn t work after the trip to the hardware store took only 10 minute to install properly once i knew what i wa doing
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: ge add on switch need wire nut connector for installation not included in package
Review: this review is specifically for the ge add on switch which is needed in 3 way and 4 way setup along with the primary ge z wave on off or dimmer switch i ve purchased several of these for multiple 3 way and 4 way configuration in my home and they work great my main reason in posting this review is to reiterate one important thing about the install that is not mentioned enough in other review you will need a wire nut connector for the installation of the add on switch the wire nut connector is not included with the package if you do not have any extra one around your home you should buy some to have on hand for installation of the add on the add on switch will be replacing your existing switch in your 3 way 4 way setup which are likely wired with wire for ground bare or green line black load black and traveler red the add on switch will need wire connection for ground bare green traveler red and neutral new connection white the neutral wire is included with the add on switch and you will need to connect it to your existing neutral wire that should already be in your wall the add on doe not use the line black and load black wire you will need to use the wire nut connector to connect the line and load wire together to complete installation
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: don t like them very much is hard to set the
Review: bought 50 of these for a remodel wish i d tested a few first don t like them very much is hard to set the dim without using the app has an oddity where sometimes the light doesn t turn on or revers direction vi a vi the paddle works decently when used with smartthings alexa but the actual switch themselves leave a lot to be desired lutron one look like it s got a better approach to dimming the light from switch i ve got a few more to do in the house and at the risk of mixing and matching will try something else
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have a few different zwave switch in my house ranging from these jasco in wall indoor and outdoor to lutron and levinton i have had no complaint about any except these in wall switch which is why i am rating it 3 star installation wa easier than the other in wall switch but there is a half second delay from pushing the switch to the relay clicking it is super annoying and other reviewer have had the same issue none of the other ge switch that i have used have the same delay
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i purchased the receptacle so i could operate a lamp through my honeywell lynx 5100 security system with a z wave card at our second home i had a few issue with the pairing operator error a the button is meant to be pushed on off instead of holding it down during the pairing once i figured that out the pairing wa easy and it is working a designed please be aware that the literature say that it need to be within 10 foot of the hub during pairing my installation wa closer to 15 foot but it worked a few other observation comment only one of the receptacle is controlled the other remains hot at all time the blue led is very bright if you are using it in a bedroom and are sensitive to light it may bother you wire nut are included it ha a big footprint so it will not work in a small outlet box and may present an issue if ganged you need a neutral white wire i may purchase a few more for other lamp
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this product ge lighting control on off switch z wave in wall works with amazon alexa 12722 work flawlessly with my wink hub 2 and 2nd gen echo dot alexa the only potential downside for anyone with an older house is that a neutral wire is required at the switch box for installation i am not an electrician or contractor but the included instruction provide a clear guide to installation i have installed this switch both a a stand alone and with two of the ge add on switch ge add on switch for z wave zigbee and ge bluetooth wireless lighting controls 12723 in a 4 way switch configuration with no problem whatsoever other than figuring out how my wiring wa run there is a split second delay a the relay is activated but i find this acceptable the small blue led at the botton of the switch light up when the switched light is off and go dark when the switched light is on i believe this behavior can be altered by the user although i have not tried to do so the switch doe not dim it is simply on off for an excellent smart home dimmer switch i definitely recommend the lutron caseta wireless in wall dimmer 600 150 watt single pole works with amazon alexa overall i am thoroughly satisfied with this product and recommend it highly for anyone embarking on a smart home journey
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works exactly a you d hope
Review: i bought several of these to automate the light for a friend s house we bought her an echo and wink hub at the same time these are a easy to install and setup a any light switch simply unscrew the old one and screw in the new one it s worth noting that the switch itself doesn t move from an up to a down position or vice versa like a traditional switch would the switch stick out at 90 degree to the wall flipping it up turn the light one and down off but once you ve moved the switch a spring return it to the neutral center position like a joystick
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have placed quite a few of these in my house i am controlling them with a veralite zwave controller the installation of these unit wa very easy pairing them wa super simple and they work and look great i just found out today that they are persistent through a power outage if the light were on they will stay on when the power is restored and they connected back up with my veralite with no issue immediately when power wa restored they have also done a good job of repeating the zwave signal improving the reliability of some door and window sensor that i had previously installed farther away from my base unit they just work no magic voodoo required i like these switch and will be purchasing more over time
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: after switching my security company to adt for their pulse service i had home automation a part of the package adt supply you with only one indoor appliance plug and the rest of the automation is up to you i had 2 area in the house that i thought could benefit from automation one the lighting switch is not easily accessible and the other wa for a light that we had to remember to turn it on each night and turn it off in the morning it did the trick for both of them the scheduled one more so than the inaccessible one as i had to log in with my user name and password to adt iphone app to turn on and off the light it is not the most convenient thing ever however for the light that need to go on at night and off in the morning it is working great installation wa not the easiest for me i actually thought of returning the package a i thought i could never get it working my old switch had only 2 wire both black one wa the input and the other wa the load the z switch needed also an neutral wire none of my current switch appears to have the ground wire installed after realizing that there is actually a neutral white wire bundle in my switch box a short trip to home depot to be that wire for le than a dollar it worked you need to follow the diagram the black input in my switch box came from a black wire bundle the neutral go to a white wire bundle and the load wa a singe wire not attached to a bundle the difference between this switch and conventional light switch is that this switch is active it need to be powered on by it s own supply whereas the conventional switch are there just to interrupt the circuit or connect it it is bulkier than conventional switch so if you have a crowded box there is a lot of wire to be pushed back all in all we really like it i would have given it 4 5 star not five it doe the trick and doe it well it also work a a z wave repeater making it easier to cover dead spot in your household i already installed 2 of those and debating installing the third
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: this is my go to z wave switch
Review: i have installed three of these thus far one controlling 7 cfl down light in our eaves one controlling the outdoor outlet for our christmas light led and one that control the light on our back patio incandescent so i can therefore verify that they work well with all three type of bulb if you ve ever installed a light switch before then you find that this switch installs quite easily a long a you have a neutral in your switch box in my experience this ha been a bundle of white wire in the back of the box all connected by a single wire nut so it s pretty easy to use a loose piece of wire to connect the neutral lug on the switch to this bundle the neutral is required because this switch ha a relay in it which is why it will work well with cfl and led light and also why it will make a small click noise when it actuates some review have mentioned the blue led for all three of the installation mentioned above i chose to set the led so that it is on when the switch is on the opposite of the default because i prefer to have an indication of the switch s status and this is more intuitive to me for indoor light you might prefer to leave the default setting making it easier to find the switch in the dark i have had no issue adding these to my controller vera lite but like any z wave device you may have to remove them and re add to get them to work i m sure i ll be adding several more of these to my house
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: i use to to turn my window unit a c off if i forget to turn it off before i leave
Review: i had this installed in my living room because i kept forgetting to turn the a c window unit off we ll this fixed that problem right up now i can turn it off from my phone if i leave for work and remember i forgot it on the only kind of annoying thing about using this method is that to turn the a c back on i have to open the app on my phone and turn the switch back on which is ok i guess because at least it provides me with what i need for the purpose i wanted it for also keep in mind you ll need a hub to make this work i use the smartthings hub i know it will also work with the wink hub and if you have a vivint sky panel security alarm it work with that too another thing to note is only the bottom plug is a smart plug the top plug is a regular outlet
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: functionally this work great it s connected to my wink hub and ha worked fine for the few month i ve had it it wa fairly simple to wire up and with some mashing the wire and switch fit just fine into the gang box i m not so great about the switch portion itself it doesn t look like a normal switch and it ll stick out like a sore thumb in a multiple gang arrangement the on off action is also considerably different than your run of the mill switch the above isn t a huge thing but i like thing to match and blend in this doesn t maybe it s a limitation of the technology i don t know just wanted people to be aware
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: controls my dining room chandelier with 5 led bulb dimmer feature work well dims effectively from 10 through 100 with my old fixture and cheap led dimmable bulb amazon asin b071kx21v5 crlight led candelabra bulb 6w 2700k warm white 700lm 60w equivalent e12 base dimmable led candle bulbs b11 clear glass torpedo shape bullet top 360 degrees beam angle pack of 6 i do occasionally notice very minor flickering around 25 and below but no guest ha mentioned or noticed it
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: good switch but missing a key feature
Review: these switch work very well so far inclusion to the z wave network ha been easy and consistent for those doing diy like myself raspberry pi 3 with homegenie one important issue with this switch is that it doe not support the association command class this mean that it doe not send a status update to your controller when manually operated by that i mean physically turning a light off or on with the switch rocker it doe send out a nodeinfo frame however so i wa able to work around it with a program instead of constantly polling it other than that they are good switch and will likely buy more of them since the price is reasonable and they seem well made
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i bought these because they were the only z wave switch i found that actually rock both up and down which to me is intuitive one big surprise is that people all across the internet state that ge jasco switch do not provide instant feedback notification when operated manually i can tell you that is false i have 1 jasco and 3 ge branded unit and all send notice to my phone the instant the relay kick in the light and yes i m taking about when i press the button on the switch i use girder 6 from promixis with an aeon labs z stick to run my network and i do have polling set to one minute however i can stand there and flip the switch on and off and see every single change which is not possible with polling you can also reverse the way the status led work on them to have it come on when the switch is on if you want if they hold up and continue to work like they do now i ll be extremely happy with them the only thing i didn t like wa the size of the internal housing and the recessed screw terminal but i managed to get them in the box make sure you have a neutral wire to hook them up
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: had some problem with wall plate intallation and 12724 didn t work correctly with wink hub
Review: i bought 12724 and 12723 version the add on work fine and wa easy to install the problem wa with 12724 the wink hub couldn t turn it off correctly every time i wa trying to turn off the fight the hub wa lowering the brightness and then turning light off i wa needed the dimming functionality for now and decided to install a stitch the switch is much louder but it least it work fine then i had some difficulty to install the wall plate the original screw didn t want to go in easily used a lot of force to tight them integration with amazon dot 2 is amazing
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: easy compatibility with front point security
Review: once the system saw the switch it started functioning perfectly being able to turn table lamp on and off remotely is good but i ve always thought that anyone casing the neighborhood would more likely think there really might be someone at home if ceiling light could join in this switch accomplishes that if you are at all handy around the house you should be able to install this switch yourself be prepared to wrestle the wire a bit because like most fancy function switch this thing bulk large in the switch box it take some maneuvering and a little bit of muscle to get the wire in and then have the face plate set level with the wall there are two ongoing feature of this switch that you should know about one is that it ha a blue led monitor light i can t remember what the function of it is but it stay on all night it shed very very little light but it doe give out some and you have to live with that the other thing that take a little getting used to is that it switch the current electronically so it doesn t have the usual snick when you push it on or off when you press the switch what s happening is that you are actually pressing a micro switch that signal the electronics to switch the current there s nothing wrong with that but every time i press the switch i still notice that it doesn t feel or sound the same a the other switch in my house i m thinking i ll get another one or two of these but maybe that s just the geek in me that think it s neat that i can turn on the light from a couple of thousand mile away
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: first of many to be installed into my house
Review: after a month s use it ha worked flawlessly easy to install even came with the extra ground wire that i didn t notice until i had already installed with my own wire stash i have in a 3 gang box and it look a little different from the other original but only i notice that the other two will be in the expected off or on position and this of course stay in a neutral position no complaint here just completing the review i will purchase more a i move from room to room

Header: works good with aeon labs z stick
Review: i m not an electrician but i am not a stranger to installing light switch everything worked good but some thing to keep in mind 1st of all this thing go pretty deep into the electrical box so deep that if i want to add anymore to my home i will be forced to switch out the original metal box that s there now where i installed this switch the in wall box wa already switched to a plastic one when we remodeled the house so i had no issue there the fact i have i m going to have to switch out the in wall metal box to deeper plastic one if i want to add more of these to my home isn t the fault of the switch it s just the time period of when the house wa built so i won t lower my rating of this product because of it like the other reviewer have said you need to make yourself a little negative white jumper from the switch to the bundled negative wire and wire nut them all together to make this switch work normally this doesn t need to be done with regular switch where you would just bundle all the negative wire together and wire nut them also you have to split up the main power and the power going to the light on the switch a well once i read the direction and had to turn the power off and on several time to find which wire wa main power it wa easy i had someone helping me so i wouldn t have to keep running back to the electrical box one more thing to add is the screw themselves on this switch were extremely hard to break free almost feel like they are glued in place for some reason lol once i broke them free it wa easy but man get ready to use some muscle to break them free also other reviewer have added that when you put the wire in the back of the switch that these are not the push type you must push the wire into place and screw down the corresponding screw to securely lock the wire into place other version of normal switch allow you to just push the wire in and it will hold this is not the case with this light switch once setup the switch button take some getting used to but once you get used to it it not bad they don t actually toggle up or down like a normal switch its more like a push button setting up with z wave wa easy using aeon dsa02203 zwus labs z wave z stick series 2 usb dongle a my controller put the z stick into add mode the direction for the switch to add the zwave switch to a controller is press on or off on the switch with the z wave controller in add mode the z stick added the device right away with no issue using the aeon labs z wave z stick and incontrol home automation software for my setup with no issue even with all it minor problem it still function perfectly and will buy more soon update 8 12 13 purchased another for the kitchen and work perfectly a the 1st one doe no issue controlling remotely and breeze to setup
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: make sure you have a white nutral wire
Review: i bought 3 of these unit to control the light in my kitchen replacing the switch that controlled the light above my kitchen island and the bank of light 3 spot above my cabinet had no problem and work well these switch require a nutral white wire be connected so that the switch can be powered on continously when i tried to replace the switch that controlled the bank of light above my counter the original switch just had the black power wire with no white common wire in the box and the smart switch wouldn t work i tried running the white common wire from an adjacent power plug but that didn t work either maybe the issue wa because all of this wiring wa behind a gfi so the lesson here is before ordering this item inspect the wiring of where you plan on installing this switch to insure that a white common wire is present in my situation all my kitchen light are now controlled by alexa except for this one bank of light which is still manual

Header: works exactly as expected plus a tech tip for you
Review: used this to control the low voltage landscape lighting transformer malibu type stuff it wa learned into a 2gig system in a manner of second with no issue tech tip the key to a stress free learn process is very simple before you learn any new z wave device into the network you must first delete it it doe not matter if the product is brand new or used doing this will eliminate any potential problem the second tip is to make sure and have a load plugged into the controlled outlet if you use a lamp make sure there is a light bulb in it pretty much any non motor appliance device will work no vacuum cleaner many z wave 110v device require this to delete or learn the item in work properly every control system is different but trust me take the extra couple of second to do these thing and you will have smooth sailing you can thank me later cheers

Header: excellent product work great with smartthings not simple to install
Review: i recently purchased and installed two of these smart switch for my smartthings home automation system to control a porch ceiling light and an entry hall ceiling light one is dimmable and i installed it a a 3 way switch using the ge 12728 z wave wireless lighting control add on switch and the other is a simple non dimmable off on smart switch despite some significant challenge in getting the 3 way set up installed properly it is all working perfectly and i am very pleased i would definitely buy more in fact i probably will a i further develop my home automation integration with smartthings v 2 hub went flawlessly i like especially that via smartthings smartlighting app i can easily set the dimmer level e g to 30 when the light come on as mentioned my only real problem wa to figure out how to wire the 3 way switch set up correctly i did finally get it working correctly at one point i figured i would have to break down and call an electrician but pushed thru and figured it out but it took a long time and a good bit of trial and error the instruction are accurate but for me in any case i had to carefully read them over and over and go step by step i did find a great youtube video tutorial that wa excellent and got me on the right track http www youtube com watch v fx1lue9llsq what i discovered to be the cause of my trouble with the wiring besides the fact that i m not an electrician wa that the 3 way switch i wa replacing had been wired in a non standard way it ended up to be critical for me to figure out which switch i wa replacing wa the line or primary switch and which wa the load or add on switch once i had that then both the youtube video tutorial and the manual made good sense oh well along the way i feel like i earned an amateur electrician certification and saved a bundle by not having to bring in an electrician but for the feint of heart and if your home wiring is a bit complex you might just want to pay to have someone else do it this difficulty with the installation is the only reason i didn t give this a 5 star review
