Review: i had this installed in 10 minute simply took the black wire hot off old switch and placed it on new terminal marked for it the othe black wire going to the light i put on the load terminal marked a well and i added a pigtail to the existing white wire aka common to the zwave marked common this also had the traveler terminal but wa taped over to be removed only if using a a 3 way switch mine wa not simply a switch in one place only you must install the white wire a the unit need power of it own to work i have done alot of my own wiring and i have an old house so i often would feed the switch after the the light rather than through the switch box which is great but in that case you would not have a white wire to use a a common i refer to this a a switch leg not sure what electrician call it i enrolled or learned it in to a lynx touch l5100 alarm system with a zwave module saw it once i activated it i edited it name description and all is done i will be controlling this via smart phone and or ipad app total connect 2 in the automation tab i have a very large garage 50 foot detached and i put this switch out there so some light would be on when i pulled in or anytime i wanted without going out to do it so this unit is seen or linked in an exterior building i wa concerned a it isnt far but with wall and such it work perfect this zwave technology will get easier and le expensive i think of it a a new hobby i went from a 50 cent switch to 40 00 haha enjoy hope this review wa helpful a the one i read before i bought were helpful to me

Header: i gave it 4 star because it wa more complicated
Review: i gave it 4 star because it wa more complicated wiring them up 4 way and the instruction were not very clear i finally figured it out and once you understand what is going on with these switch it make sense forget about what you already know about your typical 3 way and 4 way switch wiring in my situation i wanted to replace 3 switch that controlled our stairway light so i purchased one 12722 on off switch and two 12723 add on switch think of the 1272 a the master switch because it is basically doing all the work the add on switch just send a signal down one of the traveler wire to the master switch to tell it to turn on or off the master switch ha 4 connections when you look at the back of the switch they are e top left load power out to the light f top right traveler this is where the add on switch are connected to c lower left line power in from the breaker b neutral neutral the add on switch only have two connection dd top traveler wire back to the master switch bb bot neutral so once you figure out your line in and load out it is fairly simple to wire up in my situation i had 3 location left middle right power came into the box on the left line and power went out to the light from the box on the right load i wanted to put the master switch in the box on the right ge recommends to put it in the middle if you can but my middle box wa crammed full of wire and i didn t want to deal with it the three box are connected with each other with 3 wire red black and white since my power wa coming in to the box on the left and i wanted it to go to the box on the right i jumpered the two black wire togethor in both the left and middle box that way line wa passed directly to the box on the right the two add on switch were going in to the box on the left and the middle box they each take two wire a neutral and a traveler wire note they can use the same traveler wire so in the box on the left i had a red wire which i connected to the add on the switch in the middle box i connected the two red wire together with a wire nut and added a jumper to connect to that add on switch and in the box on the right i connected the red traveler wire to the traveler connection on the master switch again the add on box can use the same traveler wire since they only send a control signal down that wire to the master switch when you turn one of the add on box off or on edit to add i have an older z wave network that us mostly intermatic devices that i bought from amazon in 2008 i am also using think essentials software from control think out of business now that run on my home server a the primary controller i am happy to report that i wa able to easily add this newer switch to my existing z wave network work great
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: good so far and a fairly decent value

Header: work fine but ground screw is in a ridiculous location
Review: this switch work a advertised i use it with tube smartthings 2 hub however the designer located the ground screw on the top of the thing s body this mean that you need to remove the ground screw in order to get it to fit in some plastic box the heavy duty gray one in particular thus creating a safety hazard and code violation this wa simply a poor design choice a there is no functional reason fir such a location if they d located the ground screw on the side of the body this would be a non issue

Header: series 300 z wave not series 500 if you can wait for the new model i suggest waiting
Review: approximately two year ago zwave came up with a new standard it is called series 5 series 500 zwave plus it is a major improvement over series 300 product that being said this is one of my favorite wave 300 light switch it work great for for a series 300 product one thing that none of the other manufacturer mention is that all switch except of this one and the homeseer switch don t update the controller instantly about that status of the switch being on or off this one update instantly this can be very convenient for example if you want to open your garage door or turn on other light when you manually turn this light switch on the problem with the homeseer switch is this feature on updating the controller instantly is claimed to currently only work with the homeseer controller some people are working on some plugins for the vera to work with the homeseer switch but i haven t been able to confirm if they got it working or not ge ha announced a series 500 version of this switch they even have the manual online unfortunately it isn t currently available anywhere that i could find unlike other ge jasco product there is no link on their web page to purchase it i suspect the new model will be out very very soon series 500 is night and day better than series 300 it take away a lot of the aggravation of series 300 if you can wait a little longer for the new model i would overall i like the quality of this switch it work great with vera plus i like how they made the blue led smaller than the previous model fyi ge jasco are the same company product they just use different name depending upon whether they are selling to consumer or contractor
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i already have somewhat of a z wave system in the house through verizon my front porch light stopped working and no not just the bulb a few month ago so i troubleshooted a few thing i figured since i had to replace the porch light i might a well replace the switch inside i didn t have to but i figured it would be nice to have the light programmed to turn on at certain time can t do that with a flip switch installation wa easy no problem whatsoever i will say that it s a lot bigger than an actual switch so make sure you have room in your junction box now come the tricky part for z wave wait no tricky part my system picked it up automatically the blue indicator light is great to have to make sure it s on when it s supposed to be

Header: works great but one thing to think about the
Review: works great but one thing to think about the switch itself is really big compared to what it is replacing and getting it back in the electrical box may be a challenge depending on how well your electrician set up the box with wire in the first place in a standard box it barely fit then if the wiring is not terminated well in the box it s a tough fit if you have a 2 or 3 plate with other switch good luck getting one of these in there with all the other wiring i had bought 3 1 for a single plate and 2 for a 3 plate that control 2 set of outside light the single wa a tight fit and the 3 plate i could only install 1 of these switch because i had to move all of the wiring out from behind this one switch and put it behind the other 2 and that left no room for the other wave switch the hardest part of installing this wa jamming it back in the electrical box and getting the short screw to secure it down i had to find 2 longer screw to even reach the screw hole in the electrical box once in it work great but finding it took a little playing around too i had the blue light on and i selected find thing it spun for 30 minute and found nothing then i reset everything and tried again nothing tried again and this time when it wa searching i went over and toggled the switch a few time turning the light on and off and it found it instantly not sure if this is part of the instruction but i ve connected lot of thing and only these switch required me to toggle the switch for it to be found
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: great concept work well with my z wave controller and smarphone app however it doe not have the blue led like the primary switch when you install it in a 2 3 4 gang box and 1 or more of the others are a primary with the blue led it look like something is wrong with it because there is no blue light to expand the blue light is on when the actual light is off this help you find it in the dark so naturally you start to recognize that a switch without a blue light mean the light is on when you walk by a 3 4 gang box and want to turn a light on you tend to look past the switch without a blue light because you subconsciously assume it must be on i end up hitting multiple switch trying to get the right one and the overall impression a visitor get when they see the one switch with no light is that it must be burned out its inconsistent please add a blue light to all of them

Header: fantastic product but can take forever to install if you are not electrically savy
Review: i have this product installed and synced to my nexia home intelligence system put the first one on my front house light and used nexia to automate the turn off at sunrise and on at sunset to sync i simply pressed the plus button on my nexia gateway pressed the up on this zwave switch and waited for light to go back to solid worked first time now the install holy cow did i spend a ton of time on this mainly because of my own ineptitude when it come to electrical circuitry hopefully you can benefit from my folly first off this switch requires a neutral wire old home may not have this if you don t look at other answered question to understand how to install or other option fyi the neutral wire is most often the white wire in your switch box in mine there were four neutral wire tied together via wire nut the easiest way is to buy some 10 gauge romex and just run another wire from the switch to this wire nut i of course didn t do it this way cut one of the wire to short had to splice up in the wall blah blah i hate wire second if you have everything plugged in and you have cussed at the switch for not working try switching the load and hot wire the two black wire third you must have a proper ground wire in my box there were extra ground wire tied together so i just grabbed one and it worked most importantly even a tempting a it may be not to always walk back to your fuse box and turn it off between attempt
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: easy installation just remove the old switch 2 wire and connect those two wire to the new switch from the new switch connect the common wire to the common terminal in the switch this provides the common for the switch internal electronics and you re done the hot lead doe matter which screw is used this is because the hot side power the internal electronics just like the common easy install nothing to it took 5 minute to install connection to my smartthings hub wa a simple a pushing up on the switch and holding it for a second or two a documented and telling smartthings a new switch wa available took another minute easy in le than 10 minute my kitchen accent lighting wa automated the switch look exactly light the photo the lever is slightly smaller than a traditional switch it return to center so it doe not give a visual clue that it is on or off there is no status light which might have been a nice addition also there is a very quiet click a the internal relay turn on or off it s barely noticeable

Header: losing star a the day go on
Review: i have 16 of these throughout the house i ve had them for 1 2 year now and have had a few failure the one in the garage completely stopped working even though the light indicator wa on the relay must have went bad because toggling the switch there wa no relay click another one the light indicator stopped working the switch still work but no led indicator not a big deal on two of them in high traffic area the plastic on the switch ha broken so when you toggle it sometimes the plastic stick out all in all haven t had any other issue i d recommend it as others have said they are bulky update jul 3 17 after 3 yr i ve started to get a lot of locked up switch that would not turn on or off even by pressing the switch i would have to use a screw driver to pop out the little power disconnect to get the switch to respond after which it would work for 3 9 day before failing randomly i recorded min and max day per switch i slowly started replacing them with leviton switch i currently have 6 of these jasco ge switch left in my network that seem to be stable
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works with the vivint go control panel
Review: i have eight of these paired with my vivint go control panel the software in the vivint program allows these or any z wave switch to respond to sensor like having the light turn on when a door open or to respond to an alarm by turning on or to run off a daily schedule of on off time i did have a couple switch that were slow to pair with the controller just keep turning the switch on and off when your controller is in learn mode until the controller see it it may take a dozen time but they all eventually paired up this wa more of a problem the farther the switch wa from the controller once paired the controller can then jump signal through other z wave device to get to one that are farther away the advantage of the mesh network so if you have a switch far away from your controller install other switch in between that run other light first and then the farther switch can get signal repeated through the other z wave device
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this is a good product and is priced reasonably i installed it without any difficulty however a wiring note the original switch only used a source or line input and the switch leg or output to light for light to work these switch because they are electronic switch with additional function require the common or white wire connected to work a a light switch or a remote switch this is not a big deal a all house wiring ha three wire ground white common and black power or switch leg output wiring diagram doe show the correct connection and i only mentioned it a some might be confused why the original switch used the two black wire and no white but still worked also a note the input 110v source go on the connection on the same end a the white or common the light go on the terminal labeled z wave and is shown going to light in the diagram hope this help have had no issue with this switch and by the way the switch color is white if that make a difference have not been able to find an ivory or almond switch anywhere
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great device to upgrade your light to a smart light
Review: great device to upgrade your light to a smart light in your smart home i use it for the front porch light and the smartthings hub to control the light at sunrise sunset and other activity that i want to set i got tired of coming home after dark to realize i forgot to turn on the porch light and i wanted to save energy a well pairs well with st hub and is almost 100 when st service is working correctly installation is a little bit daunting at first but don t be afraid to get your hand in the outlet box once you ensure the breaker is off you have to mention this nowadays this outlet is deeper than your standard light switch so it may take some cramming or reorganizing the cable in the outlet box to make it fit a big thing to ensure while you are done wiring it up and screwing it in because this switch stay in the middle neutral position it is hard to tell which way is up so visually check the front plate of the switch it will indicate which direction is up this will save you the time unscrewing flipping and repacking the outlet box once installed i really like this product will be buying more of these to upgrade the rest of my smart house

Review: i ll preface this review with you need to be electrically literate and experienced to start out with these work great but you must understand how different they are from normal switch you find in your home the neutral is not optional how else would the radio frequency control work if it couldn t draw power the blue led status light tell me if the light is on or off from across the room the color is a dead match for the simon xt panel no small wonder it s all ge stuff bottom of the switch is where the neutral and hot wire go mess this up and you re toast the top terminal go to the light on a regular switch it would not matter which wire went where a long a the switch break the circuit it s good for a 3 way switch circuit you must buy the compatible slave switch so open up your wall plate and see if your wiring will support these requirement these take up all the room in the box so you ll want to make sure there s at least a much room a a gfci would occupy if not a little more these are easy to link to the simon xt panel no issue there if you get one installed you ll soon want another and another
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: amazon sell returned used altered item a new jasco customer support is horrible
Review: when i opened the delivered product i found one side of the flange had been snipped off indicating that the it wa a returned item form a previous sale and altered by the previous buyer but i decided to accept it because i thought it would not practically hurt my use and installation of the item unfortunately i quickly discovered the switch would not respond to z wave communication i guessed it wa because the previous buyer had set it up for his her network but i didn t know how to reset the switch to the factory default i contacted customer support of jasco the manufacturer making the switch under ge brand a few day later i received an email from jasco saying due to the nature of this device and the step necessary to troubleshoot any issue it could be encountering it is necessary to contact our technical support line via phone contrary to my expectation that it would be a easy a a few line of operation instruction since troubleshooting usually requires my presence next to the product i had to stay home and call jasco early in the morning the jasco customer support answered me with very thick accent over very poor phone connection so that it wa hard for me to understand his explanation but i soon learned that he wa not willing to help me at all because although i believed it wa just to put the switch to the factory default state he insisted that my smartthings network take care of this and that he have no knowledge on smartthings after a few minute of this useless and disappointing conversation with jasco customer support i decided to return the product to amazon for replacement a few day after it wa actually really quick i received a replacement and it worked fine in second i recently had another similar incident of delivery of a returned altered z wave product from amazon but the product s customer support did a good job to fix the problem very quickly in this jasco case however amazon s carelessness and the horrible jasco customer support only wasted my time and left me a negative feeling
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: somewhat pricey for an add on switch
Review: i have several 3 way and 4 way switch in my home that i recently replaced with the ge z wave line of switch to integrate with my wink hub and amazon echo the design of the add on switch is simple enough and the build quality seems high be aware though that when used in conjunction with the ge z wave plus smart switch dimmer there is no blue indicator light on the add on switch the blue indicator light on the primary dimmer switch illuminates whenever the light is off easier to find in the dark and distinguish when the light is completely off versus a low dimmer setting the wire are easy to attach though one of the neutral wire popped out presumably due to lack of tension when i tightened the screw while installing
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have about a dozen of these installed now and i have to say i m very happy with them i have a veralite installed and use them to trigger scene a well a remote control of lighting for example when the switch at the top of my basement stair is turned on all the light in the basement turn on we also have two back door and when i turn on one light both turn on and off installation can be a pain if the box is small you re installing next to another large item like another one of these switch or a dimmer you have 12 gauge wire or your box aren t wired with neutral in them my house wa built in 1987 and the wiring hasn t been a problem but if you don t have a neutral you ll have to run one i have installed one without a ground and it s fine probably since ground and neutral are bridged in most residential installation the wire connector are similar to gfci where they are inserted and then screwed down i m not an electrician but do all my own work inside my house and these are no different or more difficult than installing a gfci or electronic dimmer also make sure to run a repair on the z wave network after installing them this allows them to discover each other and use the repeater capability your controller veralite thermostat whatever you use to turn them on and off should have instruction on how to do this
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i bought these switch along with the three way switch to automate the light in a work room my intention wa to turn off work light when path light were turned off i have a scene controller to connect the two these switch won t work for this application because they do not send status switched on off to the controller if you hold the paddle too long if you just tap the switch it sends the status but if you hold the switch it doe not in addition if you control the light from the three way switch it never sends status i am confident that my controller is working because i can get the intended operation if i am careful to tap the switch just right the jasco in wall wirless smart switch 45709 is identical to this ge switch and work just a poorly edited mar 7 2016 changed from 1 star to 3 after examination with a spectrum analyzer this switch does send status regardless of how long the paddle is held just different status if the paddle is held longer i wa using universal devices isy 994i zw pro a a diagnostic tool which misled me a to the operation of this switch i can confirm that this switch doe not work well with the udi isy 994i i have no information on how well it work with other z wave controller
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: purchased 3 of these switch to interface with my vivint home security system vivint s central panel ha a built in z wave controller now i can automatically turn on or off certain light a i arm or disarm the system i can even control how long the light stay on for example whenever i disarm the system my front exterior light turn on a well a some interior light as stated in other review this switch requires 4 wire a load line ground and a neutral in modern home more often than not the neutral wire will be passing through the box the switch is in looks for a bunch of white wire that are tied together with a wire nut remove the wirenut and add a pigtail to the bunch this will be you neutral for your switch replace the wirenut you may have to go with a larger size nut older home may not be compatible generally if your house ha three prong receptacle you should be ok the weak point of the switch are the terminal they can be easily stripped out some people feel more comfortable wrapping the wire around the terminal rather than using the clamping system these are not like the spring clip you find on standard switch you must insure that the wire is on the correct side of the clamping nut when you tighten down the screw otherwise the wire will fall back out

Header: tldr buy ge instead of linear
Review: my only complaint is that the tab that you are supposed to break off do not come off easily i tried various plier and cutter and ended up just using my dremel to make the pre cut cut deeper so that i could use plier depending on how good drunk you are with a dremel this can be a quick task or a longer one anyways i wa installing quite a few of these so once i had my system down it wa pretty easy but you just need to make sure you plan ahead and know where each switch will be and take off the edge before you install them if you re comparing these to the linears those tab come off really easy with plier so for the actual switch i will be comparing the ge 12722 12723 combo directly with the linear ws15z 1 wt00z 1 combo quick bit of knowledge i am not an electrician so some of this is probably obvious and possibly incorrect a 3 way setup involves two switch with a traveler going between the two a 4 way setup involves 3 or more switch with the 4 way terminology being that one switch in the setup ha two in and two out this switch is connected to two switch instead of just one so first off is price and price being the price a of writing this the 12722 is 40 the accessory switch 12723 are 20 for linear the main switch is 29 and the accessory switch are 34 50 in a 3 way setup ge would cost you 60 and the linear would cost you 63 50 in a 4 way setup with 3 switch ge would cost you 80 and linear would cost you 98 i made the mistake of reading the old review for the ge 45xxx switch which were rated pretty unfavorably so i initially went with linear and now i have a frankenstein combination of ge jasco and linear switch the linears will only save you money if you are replacing individual switch that are not in a multi switch set up the ges can do a true 3 way 4 way multi way setup meaning that if an emp wipe out your server and your z wave network dy you can still turn off the light to your dungeon from the switch on the false wall in the kitchen the linears are a virtual multi switch and do not have the ability to incorporate a traveler wire the ability to control one light from the other ha nothing to do with with the wiring the control of both device is dependent on your z wave controller as far a i know ge doesn t have a native virtual switch however at least in homeseer i can have the linear wt00z control any device on my network so if i did need to add a remote switch to control my ge light i could use one of those to do so color the switch in my house were standard white i believe they were levitons no idea if this is just the type of white i had for my switch but the ges match perfectly whereas the linears are a slightly different shade of white it s not really noticeable but when you have one linear between two ges you can tell if you look at them close enough leds ge blue linear green up to you installation ge hand down win here the ge switch use punch in terminal and the linears require wire nut the problem with wire nut is that it add more bulk to your gang box and i probably would have punched a hole in my wall before managing to cram three linears into a 3 way box the ges just use the existing wire save for a wire nut required for the neutral which you should just be able to take off from the existing bundle of neutral wire and add it to them reusing the wire nut that s already there as mentioned above it is way easier to remove the metal tab from the linears than it is for the ges on that note however the metal on the linears is much thinner than that of the ges the ges feel a robust a the mechanical switch i took out of the wall the linears feel cheap and the metal can bend if you re not careful all said and done both product work well but if i wa purchasing again i would have just done all ge the linears that i bought mostly went into single gang box so that i could use the wall plate they come with in order to have the color match i m hesitant to give much in the way of installation tip a i am far from a professional but if you re wondering what to do with the original line and load wire in a 3 way set up i wa told to tie them together with a wire nut since they re not being used in a 4 way set up you need find the 4 way device and wire nut the two traveler with a pig tail that will then plug into the accessory switch know that there are numerous method for multi switch setup and ge doesn t use any of them so you need to understand how your set up work in order to incorporate the ges i highly recommend getting a non contact voltage tester a wire tracer tone generator and if you live in a house built more than a few year ago make sure you have neutral wire hidding behind the wall switch so you don t waste your time
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i m just starting to set up a z wave network and this is the first remote switch i purchased controlling an outdoor porch light switches i ve bought in the past came with wiring already attached and stripped and ready to install out of the box this one doe not and so installation doesn t go a quickly a it could keep in mind this switch continually draw power to operate it electronics and so it requires a neutral wire also like a lot of fancy in wall switch it take up a lot of room in your electrical box i like how there are various option you can configure even for a basic on off switch like this you can reverse the operation of the switch and configure the behavior of the blue indicator led one negative point is there is noticeable delay of a quarter of a second or so from the time you push the switch to the time the light turn on or off it would be nice if it wa more immediate so it would feel more like a mechanical switch i don t know if this is typical of these remote switch or not also i wish the manufacturer would document the power draw of the switch while it s in a standby state
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great so far here s some installation pointer
Review: just installed this and it work great once i figured out the electrical installation detail it wa easily setup and working on my honeywell lynx 5200 a few pointer for installation to hopefully save you some time 1 this device requires a neutral typcially white wire connection i used the supplied jumper wire to connect the bundle of neutral wire in the junction box to the connection on the switch 2 this device must have line and load wire identified and connected correctly the location of these connection on a typical switch may not be the same a this smart switch therefore you should use a multimeter or voltage detector to identify the line wire hot when switch is off 3 finally this switch is very deep it wa challenging to fit it in the junction box 3 gang box with all the other wire and such the blue led on the front light when the switch is not on some reviewer have complained about this but i find give a high tech look to the switch overall very pleased so far

Review: one thing to note when working with zwave is it a very weak frequency what i mean by that is dont listen to the ad s that say you can turn a light on remotely and thats it unless your in 300 sqft studio this will not work when you jump into zwave plan on going all or nothing and replacing every switch zwave even if it a room that you dont use change it out anyways zwave hardwired device light switch s tstats etc act a repeater to each other and sheetrock wall or any wall for that matter will knock the signal down 10ft per wall and zwave device have a 30ft radius if you have room after room of zwave overlapping with hallway room downstairs upstairs etc the overkill will help you in the long run it will work if you follow the above ill spare you the nightmare

Header: does not have instant status reporting be careful
Review: if you want to control a scene with this then look out it s great for certain application but it doe not have instant status reporting capability this mean that the controller ha to poll the device periodically every 60 second to see the status which mean that if you are controlling a scene you flip the switch and have to wait up to a minute for the device being controlled to respond i tried all kind of thing including writing code to force it to poll more often it s complicated but you can get it to respond a little more quickly that way but it s still not great increasing the polling interval too much lock the thing up see below for my alternative that worked great also the switch just doesn t feel right it s not a true toggle switch and doesn t flip instead it sort of push up or down a little and then return to the center if you want your switch to feel like traditional wall switch this one is the closest i ve seen but still not there this solution fix both problem i bought the aeon labs dsc26103 zwus micro controller instead it s a small device that you install right behind your traditional wall switch inside the box since you are still using your original wall switch it feel right plus this device can be set to do instant status reporting by setting that variable 80 set it to 1 the main controller will get the status immediately and there is almost no delay when controlling scene or remote device
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this is a great device the quality seems very good installation is very quick and easy just like swapping out an outlet there are a couple thing you should know though first is that this only ha a single connection meaning you will lose functionality if you replace an outlet that is also switch some outlet have the bottom outlet always on and the top outlet is operated with a wall switch this isn t a flaw and it isn t implied anywhere that it would work for that application but i wish i would have realized that before i installed it i didn t lower my rating because of that installation is easy but functionality is not the direction are essentially install it the turn on your z wave device and pair it there is no direction to indicate how to put the device in pairing mode also i have a vivint system and they need a serial number which isn t available when it is installed additionally the instruction say that in some installation initial set up must be done within ten foot of the controller a big flaw for an outlet that could go anywhere in your house mine luckily wa within that distance so i didn t get the chance to test the ten foot distance issue once i got it set up with vivint it work flawlessly and look great my biggest complaint is the blue light that cant shut itself off it is always on when the z wave enabled signal ha shut the power off so either the outlet is on and the blue light is off or the outlet is off and the blue light is on more and more device are doing this which is not needed and add no functionality granted a small led doesn t use much power but it is ironic that a device that is marketed a a way to conserve electricity ha a light that you can t shut off and it is definitely bright enough that in a bedroom it would be very bothersome had i known that ahead of time i would not have bought this and will not but another edit to add faceplate information it is true there is no faceplate because there is no way to know which faceplate to include in the package this could be installed a a single outlet in a double outlet etc or a single outlet and a cable outlet the possibility are endless so it doesn t make sense to include an outlet cover no other outlet come with cover for this same reason however that isn t really common knowledge and most people assume that the outlet and the cover are the same product like a bottle and a lid so while ge doesn t imply this come with a faceplate and i don t think they are under any obligation to say that this doesn t come with a faceplate because that is the industry standard it would make people happier with the product because they wouldn t be expecting a faceplate and then have to run to the local hardware store and buy a faceplate the faceplate from the old outlet almost certainly won t work
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i replaced ge z wave wireless lighting control dimmer switch with the on off version i did not like the dimmer version a much since it go from dim to full brightness in a second or two when turning on and from full brightness to dim when turning off this switch is instant on or instant off from either the smartthings app or the wall switch i used this in a four way setup three wall switch and the light i have a review in the dimmer switch review about installation if interested and some more information below i would purchase again for this application details as i have been implementing my home automation set up i am faced with a few fundamental choice one option are smart bulb that communication with your automation system quirky bulb psb30 sw27 65w equivalent br30 connected led light bulb soft white philips 432278 hue personal wireless lighting br30 starter pack 3 pack and lifx edison screw wifi enabled multicolor dimmable led light bulb pearl white for me which can provide light by light automation through smartthings or the manufacturer apps the other option is to automate the wall switch and use dumb bulb in the socket but then individual light control is not possible either option can be linked to motion sensor programmed scene etc the biggest difference is can you control each light or just the bank of light controlled by the switch in my application i have used both method for my kitchen light there are six light bulb all controlled by wall switch there are other light in the area for accent lighting that i use smart bulb to dim and provide mood lighting i installed the dimmer master switch referenced above and two auxiliary switch ge 45610wb z wave add on auxiliary switch the dimmer master switch worked fine but it limited the bulb i could use must be dimmable bulb or the light will pulse on off and never turn on and i did not like the soft start when using the wall switch i swapped out the master for this switch and kept the same auxiliary switch initially wiring up the dimmer master and auxiliary switch wa difficult i put some info in my review of ge z wave wireless lighting control three way dimmer kit swapping out the dimmer master for the on off master wa easy i did not have to open the auxiliary switch box i just removed the dimmer master and installed the on off master in it place the dimmer switch did not require a connection to the neutral wiring but this switch doe i added the appropriate wire and it worked fine set up wa easy with smartthings it detected the switch right away and setup wa a easy a any other device in smartthings so not good not bad
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: work great i have them set up with a samsung
Review: work great i have them set up with a samsung smartthings hub and a google home and i m having a blast took me a while to figure out how to install them this wa my first time working with a light switch box and i spent the whole time worried i wa about to kill myself i kept checking the electrical panel to make sure the circuit wa off but boy wa it satisfying when i finished i like that they go back to neutral position after a satisfying click when you press them manually i wa worried about two fitting in one switch box but luckily they have removable tab on the side and they fit fine once removed some key learning 1 this model won t work until all four wire are connected ground neutral lead line 2 if you ve set them up properly by default they are off and the blue led is on when you turn the light on the blue led turn off 3 my home s wiring used the same color of wire for both the lead and line and unfortunately i mixed them up on my first attempt i m probably super lucky that i didn t blow something up but the ge switch did not turn on in this configuration it did start working properly after i swapped the wire and it seems that i did no permanent damage
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: these switch work flawlessly my house wa built in 2008 and the neutral were in the junction box pulled together and connected to a wire connector i bought about 10 foot of 14 gauge of insulated solid copper wire from home depot and cut them to 6 in length i then connected one end to the neutral connector on the switch and ran the other end to the junction of neutral at the wire connector works great i like the blue leds i think the brightness is just right not too bright also had no problem connecting to my micasa vera2 it connected by putting the vera2 in z wave listen mode pushing up on the switch waiting for the vera2 to blink rapidly then pushing down on the switch and waiting for the vera2 to blink rapidly for whatever reason if i only did one or the other and ended the session it wouldn t be recognized a a new device in the vera2 my only complaint about the switch is removing the 3 ear on each side of the switch to make it fit in a multi switch box it s a huge pain i m worried about flexing the switch too much while twisting the ear back and forth to get them off so far so good though i currently own 5 of these switch and will be buying a few more to complete my lighting automation
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: ge 45605 z wave module installed just in time
Review: we were committed to replacing several old analog timer controlling table lamp and security lighting around our home we experience 1 2 power outage each month most outage are le than an hour or two but each outage requires u to reset each of the timer our home security system us a honeywell 6280i tuxedo touch z wave keypad this model also support z wave so we re using it a our z wave controller we started replacing the analog timer last night installation took about five minute for each ge 45605 module if you do not have a copper ground wire or grounded box this module may not work verify this before opening the sealed ge 45605 package so you have an option to return the product once installed we pressed the activation button on each of the module the module immediately displayed on our keypad controller the blue led light on the module should now be on also indicating it linked to the controller we created z wave scenes and programmed the on off time for each module on the keypad and they worked perfectly we woke up this morning to yet another power outage just by habit family member began to reset the old analog timer the problem wa those old timer were gone since our keypad controller receives current time including daylight savings time from our security system no adjustment are required we will never need to reset timer again remember only the bottom outlet on this module is z wave enabled the top outlet power is always hot live we also installed a honeywell z wave thermostat module and also use our keypad to make change to our hvac system with this keypad controller also hardwired to our home network we can control all z wave module via any web enabled device including iphones ipads and pc s
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this product work well with my z wave system documentation included wa easy to read an follow be prepared the device s control box will take most of the depth of a standard electrical switch box my box had four switch and a large number of neutral wire inside of it so i had to move them a bit to make sure the switch sited inside properly the other issue wa the way my previous switch wa wire like i mentioned all the neutral were ganged into one connector so the switch i wa replacing did not have a neutral wire so i had to pay an electrician to install it not the product s fault but due to my individual circumstance if installed properly the switch doe have an arrow to indicate which side is up the switch wa an led light at the bottom which will light up the led turn off when the light is turned on and light up when the switch is turned off this nay be reversed if the switch is connected to a controlling system like the my casa verde controller while the switch look like a rocker switch it really doe not rock when you press the top portion it turn off and when you press the potton portion it turn off its more like clicking a mouse button so this feedback take a little getting used to the led light serf a a positive confirmation of the status of the switch specially useful if switch is turning light on and off what are not visible from the switch location in my case the switch control flood light outside my house which i don t get to see if that are on of off from the switch location my only objection to the switch is that the side break away tab do not break away very easily as a matter of fact i wa unable to break them off so i had to squeeze the switch between two switch leaving no room between them since the switch fitted even with the tab on i am still giving it good mark i hope durability is good botton line switch work a designed price is reasonable come with good documentation and is relatively easy to install the switch depth while not excessive is considerable and the breakaway tab don t so it get four star from me
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this is a great product but depending on your need you should be aware of a few thing the footprint for this dimmer is large and i mean slightly larger than any of the other paddle ge jasco levitron etc dimmer and switch i have what did this mean well i had to shave the wall box slightly to make room for the ground screw also this will not sit properly next to a belki wemo switch in a two or three gang box i don t think two of these would fit next to each other either i used it in a three gang and i had to put the smart switch on the side location to make room basically the three extenders on the side will push a wemo in such a way that the cover plate won t fit properly or if it doe go on the switch are clearly out of alignment the last thing is the toggle switch it is a little pointy and i can see why some people complain the good it work just like i planned even if you don t have a smart home hub this is a great dimmer for low watt led light be sure you have a white nuetral wire and you won t have problem with humming or flickering i can t find reliable dimmer that don t have zwave or zigbee technology included but i need them for my smartthings hub anyway we have a very expensive entry way light pottery barn or restoration hardware but the stupid thing would only take three 25 watt candle e12 light way way too dim now with the more reliable led light i can put in three 6w bulb and the light is super bright if you take this route i recommend a dimmer and dimmable bulb i use crlights brand i recommend the crlights 6w 2700k warm color i ve used the 3200k soft white equivilant from this brand and they are very bright i d rather use warm light of a higher watt on a dimmer it produce a great effect when dimmed but i can crank it i need be aware on light that the led brand are not all equivilant on the brightness rating one brand 3200k look like another s 4000k i hope this review help you with your purchase

Review: ok zwave dimmer 1 of 4 didn t include in the network correctly this caused me to have to exclude and disconnect lot of device to solve this same thing happened with 1 of the ge jasco decora dimmer i don t like that you can t double tap up on the toggle for full brightness given that you have to hold the switch to dim and on return to the previous dim level a double tap up for full brightness would be very useful a on some lutron dimmer finally and perhaps my biggest complaint given that the rest is overcome once you ve setup or gotten used to it when you set the dim level via zwave the device doesn t dim to the level it just jump to that brightness level instantly it s an electronically controlled dimmer there is no excuse for this behavior it dims smoothly when turned on and off it dims smoothly between brightness level when controlled from the dimmer switch itself but if you want to go from 80 to 50 via zwave that s instantaneous ge did themselves a disservice letting jasco license their name and produce these thing under it

Review: i installed two of these switch in the same box over this past weekend and will echo most of what ha been said previously with a couple of warning which is why it s only 4 star 1 with the little metal tab on either side of the switch it is tight further it wa basically impossible for me to break them off i hesitated resorting to a hack saw so left the tab in place hence why it wa such a tight fit in the box 2 a neutral wire is a must lucky i had neutral wire bundled in the box that were unused however simply taking one of those and plugging it into the neutral location wa not effective i needed to purchase another length of wire all of 3 5 inch and join that to the already existing neutral wire bundle in the box and connect the new wire to the switch basically kep the neutral wire bundled and run a wire off of them for the switch 3 i used the push in wire location rather than wrapping the wire around the post this wa easy and the post tightened down to clamp the wire in place except for one neutral it just would not budge i actually exchanged it and the new one worked just fine 4 did i mention putting two together in a box is tight 5 once these were in place they each paired with my vera3 in about 10 second no fuss no mus no hassle i had them set in automated scene within a couple of minute and working perfectly 6 the documentation provided doe not cover any of this the documentation is the one downfall on this product rely upon the internet review and others comment they are very helpful i would clearly recommend using these switch and plan to add several more to the house in the future now that i know the trick
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: a basic on off switch you can control with z wave
Review: i have a number of wall switch i wanted to sense and control from my z wave vera 3 system and the jasco seemed like one of the better option like most of the other switch of this type you need a white neutral wire running to the box in order to install the switch properly my understanding is that this is how the internal z wave radio is powered still if you don t have the neutral feed in your junction box it would take some creative wiring and maybe a professional electrician to install one of these if you have any doubt there are some good youtube installation video that help a lot i wa able to pair with my z wave controller at a distance of about 30 foot with no trouble just did a full power pairing and the device wa found with no trouble at all once installed this type of z wave switch act like a range extender to your z wave network so for the price of running an extra transmitter you get generally better communication every time you install another switch my only complaint about these switch is that the feel is a bit cheap instead of a nice solid thump when you switch it on and off it doe feel a bit flimsy otherwise they absolutely work perfectly were easy to pair with my system and even have a pleasant blue led to make finding the switch easy in a dark room or to tell at a glance whether the switch is on or not otherwise these switch function flawlessly and i have no reservation about using them in my home automation system definitely recommended
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works with alarm com or vivint home security systems 2gig ts1
Review: i bought this unit and installed it fairly simple 1 kill the power to the outlet you use from the breaker panel 2 confirm power is shut off via a tester or a simple power strip with a light or just a lamp turned on 3 replace the wall outlet with this one 4 power back on 5 test power with a simple power strip with nothing plugged in it and see if the light is red or green etc note if your light is half dim you may have the neutral and ground wire mistaken 6 once confirmed just link up with alarm com system i happen to have the 2gig ts1 2gig console for my alarm 7 once this is linked up you can login to your app for alarm com or vivint and automatically kill the power to say your tv receiver game system and other non essential product that you can turn off while you are not home to ensure they don t consume power sitting idle i plugged mine into a 8 outlet surge protector a only 1 side is controlled by the zwave with alarm com or vivint you can even schedule a power schedule for this also good for grounding kid who want to come home and watch tv and not do their homework only con i can think of is that it come with no wall plate a the one you replace will not just fit over it love this
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works great with samsung smarthing hub
Review: i use two of these in conjunction with my samsung smartthings hub v2 i did the replacement wiring myself which went well you just have to follow the direction carefully to make sure you wire in the white neutral wire i also had the two black hot wire reversed the first time i tried my first switch so look out a it s easy to do that also no big deal a you just swap the black wire if you get it wrong the first time but worth testing everything before you screw it all back into the outlet box i also had some challenge getting this to connect to my network for the first time but figured out through trial and error it wa some kind of networking issue with my hub once i deactivated wifi on my smartphone and connected to my hub via cellular i wa able to easily connect the first switch to my hub these are nice in that they also act a z wave repeater to effectively extend your range we have a large house and i have other z wave device in extreme distance outside so these have helped from a z wave network range perspective they have worked flawlessly so far and i ve had them installed for about a month now

Header: works perfectly but be sure you know what s necessary to wire it up or hire an electrician
Review: the switch work perfectly i connected it to my honeywell tuxedo within second there are just a few caveat with wiring that everyone should know of ahead of time as documented in the instruction this switch requires 4 wire be connected to it load black line black ground green or copper neutral white the switch you re replacing may only have 2 3 wire in use load black line black ground green or copper don t assume function by just color be sure you re using a volt meter or line tester to verify the wire and any voltage the neutral wire is required that will require a new wire be fished through for the neutral connection or a new pigtail piece of wire ran to the group of neutral wire you may have tucked away in the back of the box the wire hole in the back work well but you need to be sure to press the screw down so the wire sits above the connector and then tighten the screw you should not be able to just pull the wire back out afterwards i installed this for our front light and so far so good i also bought additional unit so i ll update after a few month with any additional info
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: remember white neutral wire must be connected
Review: this product work fine it took me several repeated installs to finally figure out a key fact the white neutral wire must be connected for this z wave switch to work the instruction mention this in small print very early on and there is a lot of other distracting information for a single pole 1 way normal wall switch only the black wire to the load and the hot wire from the breaker panel line are connected the instruction also mislead you by suggesting you wire this switch just like the existing manual switch the instruction do not mention clearly or at all that there is a short white neutral jumper provided to connect from the neutral wire twisted together with a pigtail wire nut to the neutral connector if you think through that this is an active relay which requires a c power for the z wave electronics to work it make sense but i wa trying to follow the instruction exactly this would be a 4 star product once they fix the instruction

Header: does not work with led low wattage bulb
Review: well this review is together with leviton vri06 1lz vizia rf i tried both and after many hour of testing and reading and back and forth i finally figured that these will not work with low wattage led light bulb i don t think these are bad product but some how they didn t recognize the current flowing through the bulb they are made for regular bulb or maybe higher wattage led bulb the bulb that i used were 2 bulb each at 3 watt and it failed to recognize them so i assume that the minimum wattage ha to be 13 watt although i never tested that so since we are all going to use led soon i would suggest that the manufacture need to take into consideration how to manage the product that can be compatible with them i hope it help and save some time for other people

Review: completely disagree with the other reviewer granted this could have been more clearly labeled and explained which is why i m only giving 4 star but it doe say auxiliary in the product title this switch sku 12728 is meant for circuit where you have more than one switch example a foyer light that ha three switch one of these three switch need to be the main unit sku 12727 and the two others are auxiliary this 12728 if your circuit only ha a single switch that single switch must be the main unit 12727 not the auxiliary unit it is not a good idea to mix z wave with non z wave dumb switch on the same circuit it s the main switch 12727 not the auxiliary 12728 that pair with the z wave network and that get programmed i have three of these circuit in my house all professionally installed and they work like a charm can be programmed into scene can be monitored and turned on off with my smartphone and can be tied to event one of these circuit is illuminating the view for security camera yes they integrate very well into adt pulse

Header: a good switch but not great and certainly not awesome
Review: this is a good switch but it not deserving of four or five star here s why 1 it is very deep i had to go get an old work box just so that the existing wiring could fit changing that box out took me hour 2 it doe not allow reversing the hot line wire plenty of other smart switch allow it guess they detect it somehow this one doesn t 3 it required me to run my white wire neutral into the box but never clearly stated it while it seems obvious to anyone who ha installed smart switch before this wa my first and it wasn t obvious what i should do dumb switch usually have hot in line out and that s it so it not intuitive to add the white wire they should make that clear 4 its white wire requirement cost even more space that i didn t have because i had to add another white wire to the mix 4 it click when it turn off or on 5 that blue light is slightly absurd 6 it had little tab i had to tear off to make two fit next to each other 7 it is not a specialist switch the documentation contained information for 3 or 4 switch and dozen of mode and i had to wade through some nonsense to find information for my use case some might see this a an advantage instead of a drawback but not me i ordered the switch based on my use case if i had need of a different switch i would have ordered it even though my critique may seem a bit harsh i am still happy with the purchase i did not send the product back or shelf it in my shed i used it and smiled when it started working however in my eye a product should be perfect to get five star and at least have zero undocumented surprise to get four most of the switch in my home cost 3 this one cost 50 so i think it should be held to a higher standard one could argue against any one of my bullet point but each is an actual drawback sure the clicking is inherent in smart switch and it deep nature is because of it control board etc etc but in my view those thing are for the manufacturer to figure out not me and when they do they ll get five star

Review: i use this with my z wave system to control my ac when i m not at home to ensure my pet don t over heat the ac turn back to the same state after power loss my only issue is that for the cost you would think you d get to choose which outlet is controlled by the z wave relay but unfortunately only the buttom outlet is controllable this mean i had to use a power strip to plugin my ac because my ac plug would otherwise obstruct the entire outlet my other gripe is the cost they aren t any cheaper than movable plug adapter like belkin s wemo and when you consider the cost of the part the markup doesn t make much sense i likely won t buy another until they are 20 or le a i find the wall plug to be more a better value a you can re purpose them

Header: works great but wire per instruction
Review: i ordered 3 of these switch based on other review i wa a bit worried about the reliability since many reviewer note receiving defective switch however all the one i received worked flawlessly one word of advice you must wire the switch according to the label specifically you cannot interchange the load and line wire a you can with most dumb switch i ran into this myself when i wired in one of the switch exactly like the old switch wa wired with the addition of the neutral when the new switch didn t work i got worried after mapping out the wiring diagram in the switch box i realized what the problem wa the line and load wire were reversed which wa just fine for the old switch because these switch have powered component they will not work without following the exact wiring instruction one other note about the wiring most existing switch you ll encounter do not wire into the neutral in my case these were all bundled together inside the box with a wire connector cap to connect the neutral with the z wave switch you ll need to provide your own wire that go from the switch to the bundle i went to home depot and got some extra wire in addition to a larger wire bundle connector to accommodate the extra gauge of wire

Header: great addition to a home automation setup
Review: i bought three of these with three of the add on switch 12728 to do a couple room in my house and they have worked flawlessly so far the picture in the instruction do a pretty good job of helping translate from a usual 3 way setup to these switch the wiring in my house ha always been a mess but with a little testing of the wire i ended up getting them to work fine note that these are fairly bulky so if you have gang box and you re patient enough it may help to take everything out and shorten the length of wire that are unneeded it took some pushing and using the screw to pull them all the way into the box due to everything behind them i also had to break some piece of plastic off my switch plate because they didn t want to sit close to the large metal face important note when attaching the switch plate you may be tempted to use the screw that were already in it assumin you are replacing existing switch the package includes screw for a good reason the standard one are usually too long you ll find that if you tighten a regular screw all the way in the light will suddenly turn off i don t know if this is some sort of safety feature or if it is shorting the internal circuit but i found that backing the screw out and cycling the air gap switch fixed it the default behavior is to slowly fade on and off but this can be changed through your home automation gateway we d prefer that they turn on off instantly and that requires changing some setting i have the veralite and although i couldn t find any documentation there is some on different style of ge z wave dimmer and that ended up working in device option set parameter 9 number of step valid values 1 99 to 99 and parameter 10 timing of the step valid values 1 255 to 1 this affect the setting when using the physical switch if you want to change how they behave with z wave control use the same logic on parameter 7 and 8 respectively
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works very well and is reliable but not trivial to install
Review: i have nothing but good thing to say about this switch mine s been turning our porch light on and off automatically controlled by an alarm com security system for many month without a hitch beyond doing what it s supposed to and looking like a normal switch there s not terribly much more than can be said most people won t use any of the advanced feature of the switch like the ability to turn off the blue light because to do so requires an advanced controller which i don t have either update it s now been turning on and off our porch light every day without fail for about a year and a half now perhaps the most useful thing i can say in this review is to warn people that installing it is easy but not trivial it s not just another switch which you can wire by just copying the wiring from the switch it replaces with this z wave switch you need to wire both the load and hot wire in the correct place but you ll also need to wire in a neutral wire so one problem is that if you have an older house or a poorly wired one you may not have a neutral in the box at all you won t be able to use this switch safely if this is the case please don t try using ground a a neutral it may work but it not safe if you don t have a neutral or don t know how to figure that out you can always get the ge 45612 z wave wireless lighting control in wall dimmer the dimmer does install just like a regular switch and can always replace any existing switch if you aren t confident you can figure out which are the hot neutral and load wire in your box you should hire an electrician to install this or just get the dimmer i mention above it s often not a simple a just going by color because thing aren t always wired the way they should be you ll need to know how to use a voltage tester to truly determine which is which and that mean getting near live wire normal switch couldn t care le if you swap load and hot but this switch need all the wire to be exactly correct this fact is probably why there are a smattering of negative review from people who think they have a bad unit certainly some are right but i suspect many of them were trusting the color coding of the wire in their box and just wired the unit with the wrong polarity good luck and have fun
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i purchased one of these receptacle along with a ge 45601 controller to allow me to remotely control a recirculation pump unfortunately the range wasn t sufficient so i bought a few more and scattered them around the house each work a a relay station for the controller s signal so it greatly extended the controller s range and allows me to control the aforementioned pump a well a any of the other z wave receptacle when using the controller anywhere in the house great as noted in description one of the outlet the upper in normal installation is powered all the time the lower is controlled by the z wave controller or can be manually turned on and off by a small switch in the center of the outlet also regarding the blue led that some have complained about yes it is bright yes a delivered it is on when the lower outlet is not powered and not illuminated when the outlet is powered counter intuitive perhaps but it is user changeable using the 45601 lastly installation wa a snap although larger than a standard outlet it fit easily into the junction box be aware that although the picture show it with a cover plate it doe not come with one

Header: a fantastic addition to my smartthings google home smart home
Review: i ve replaced 7 of my dumb switch at home with the ge z wave plus wireless smart lighting dimmer control switch pros the installation process is simple however be aware that a pre existing neutral wire is required yes required don t attempt any workarounds at the cost of your safety or the safety of your family integrates seamlessly into my smartthings google home alexa smart home signal range is adequate my smartthings base is installed on the first floor and my switch are all over the house on the first and second level of a 3000 sq ft home dimming control is intelligent it remembers the last level of brightness you set so if you turn on the switch it return to it last brightness setting handy to set at night and use in the morning when baby duty call this is a cost effective alternative to replacing an entire series of bulb with wi fi enabled smart bulb this is a great option for those who have a handicap or are disabled and need more accessibility to switch in the home through smart connectivity cons cost of entry seems a little high right now but the convenience is well worth it for many people
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this a single switch on off simple does not rock it only click slightly for on or off no cover plate included it must be wired with 4 wire load line neutral and ground a wall switch is usually just two wire since all it doe is break the circuit if your lucky the neutral white wire wa brought in the same box a where your wall switch is at then there is the regular green ground wire the wire connection are simple the unit come with the pre set screw open get your wire ready to push in with your screw driver push down on the screw first for each connection then push your wire into the hole this let the inside pressure plate open up while you got the screw driver ready to tighten now slowly tighten down you should only twist about 5 7 time the wire should be tight now don t over tighten a this will crack the housing once it s wired up and powered up go back to your controller to add then press the bottom of the switch to learn it with your controller if it doesn t work with your controller delete then add it back i had to do it twice for the controller to start controlling it i thought it wa broke but that wa my fix for it the unit ha a slight clicking noise which is normal from the relay
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: the echo wa a breeze to setup and is working flawlessly great purchase the wink hub connected to the amazon
Review: after reading a lot of product review here on amazon and checking the question to see if i would be running into any problem i ordered 3 of these switch the amazon prime order wa promptly filled and delivered on time i also purchased a wink hub from home depot cheaper price than amazon prime and an amazon echo my intent wa to create a voice control for my patio and office light the echo wa a breeze to setup and is working flawlessly great purchase the wink hub connected to the amazon echo without a problem and now i wa set to install the smart switch a little background on my house it wa built in 1946 and therefore did not include a ground wire in any of the switch box no problem the ge switch install paperwork the ge switch box and all that i could find on the web said that i only need have a neutral white wire and black wire available no problemo installed the switch they all worked in manual mode but try a i might they would not go into pairing mode when attempting to join them to the wink hub according to the ge pamphlet all i needed to do wa touch the top or the bottom of the switch after setting the wink hub to pairing mode and presto it should work son a it would not pair after a long hold on the line i wa able to get to the ge tech support department bad experience the woman who wa helping me had a very bad attitude from the get go after explaining how i hooked up the wire to the switch and hearing her typing feverously in the background she came back with the obvious conclusion that i did not have a ground wire attached this is required she boasted well i responded if wa so damned required why doe it not say so anywhere in the literature included with the product or on the out side of the box it clearly say a neutral wire is required it doe not say a ground wire is required it also say it work with any type of switch wiring wow was i pissed after a couple of beer i got to thinking that there must be a way to get these working light bulb above my head turn on here i cut a piece of wire and attached it to the ground terminal on the switch about 4 inch long as the switch box i wa trying to connect to is made of plastic there wa nowhere to ground it to so i just left it dangle i set the wink hub back to pairing mode and a instructed by the switch install guide i pressed and released the bottom or top of the switch after about 4 or 5 second the switch paired with the hub i then wa able to get alexa to discover my new device and i now have a working voice activated light on my patio i did the same for the switch to my front porch light and to my office and they too paired without complaint the only thing i can think of for the ground wire needing to be attached is to provide an antenna for the pairing it doe not seem to have any other function a i removed them before closing the switch plate and everything still work normally so the moral of this story is two fold 1 never believe a tech support person who ha to type your question into a computer to get an answer that is still wrong 2 american ingenuity is still alive and well p s i mentioned to her that i had read the review and question here on amazon before purchasing and wa promptly told by her we don t pay any attention to amazon review nice to know ge care about it customer opinion of their product and service p s s the two star are not for the product itself but for the install guide and product requirement a listed in their own literature and on the outside of the box and for the lousy tech support i received the product get 5 star it is working very well thank you
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: there is not much one can say about a device that either work a intended or it doesn t but i will try in case there are those who like me a few month ago are interested in modifying their house to keep up with the modern age i had installed and set up the schlage home link system beginning with a front door deadbolt lock a light module and the bridge included in the starter package i bought slowly i added device i bought wall switch and the trane hvac control it wa all relatively simple to integrate i believe the simplest device i added wa this z wave outlet the wiring wa very simple and enrolling it a an addition to my smart home network wa a breeze it work a intended and ha not failed yet product detail it doe not come with a wall plate one of the two plug in the outlet is z wave enabled while the other is always hot this mean if you plug something in to this particular plug it will work a any other household plug the z wave enabled plug will be active if it is set to active through your z wave interface i use my computer a well a a cell phone application i leave the light plugged into it on and activate it through the interface you can also activate it with the button located between the two plug next to a blue led described next one issue some might not like about the outlet is that it put out a pretty powerful light from the blue led this doe not bother me in the least and therefore have not looked into whether or not it can be disabled a bonus to this is that it is useful if attempting to plug something in while the room is dark or a previously mentioned you need to activate the plug when no computer or cell phone app is handy i will update this if i discover that the led can be disabled for those not interested in computer or cell phone control there are handheld interface that will control all your installed z wave device
