Header: top value z wave plus dimmer on the market
Review: amazon lump nearly all of the ge z wave item under the same review this review is specifically for the z wave plus paddle wall dimmer bought a number of these and their jasco equivalent to connect to my smarththings hub to control the light via app and alexa on echo dot evaluating these a a manual dimmer these are very very good when compared to some feit and leviton led dimmer i ve tried the feit dimmer from costco wa the worst it suffered from an ill fitting wall plate that left gap to the wall ever so slight buzzing even with feit led s and it had power issue dim it too low and you induce flicker or the light wont turn back on because the initial power draw is too low using it required dimming to a level that is satisfactory from both a output and power draw standpoint to make sure one can turn the light on and off the leviton unit addressed all these shortcoming but at 20 30 wa rather expensive even without z wave some model are cheaper but none of them are what i would call cheap this ge or really jasco unit strike an excellent compromise on all front a a mechanical dimmer no buzzing with cree or feit led retrofit dims smoothly with no power on off issue the only drawback a a mechanical dimmer is that there is no dedicated slider you hold he up down paddle a needed to get to desired light level the inclusion of z wave is where this shine and the value proposition increase when compared to a 20 30 mechanical dimmer with a smartthings hub it s now a dimmer a timed switch alarm signal etc i have 3 generation of these in the house early gen with no neutral wire z wave with neutral wire and now z wave plus the latest gen support scene better but i haven t quite explored in that direction yet so the only notable difference to me are in installation and dimming performance the latter two have about equivalent performance while the early gen wa easier to install due to one le wire it also doesn t dim a low given minimal cost difference it make sense to buy the latest gen for future functionality upgrade from an install perspective these are quite big and bulky but manageable the contact point are clearly labeled neutral line load ground remote and make me wish regular switch were labeled too but ala that is often not the case since there are a myriad of way to wire them with a voltage meter in hand it should be easy to figure out the wire color are usually white is neutral bare is ground and black can be line or load the voltage meter make it easy to figure out and worth the 20 a part of your general toolbox turn off breaker pull switch out to expose wire turn on breaker set meter to detect 200v ac and touch one lead to ground and the other to either black line withe power on and whichever show 120v is the line wire aka hot turn off the breaker and proceed to install safely you ll have quite a bit of wire and switch to cram back in so the flexible neutral white wire they pack in take at least some of the pain out all the contact are push in screw type so no need to break out plier to bend wire around the screw terminal once i got the hang of identifying wire it became easy to upgrade throughout the house and i m onto 9 switch already so buyer beware these get addictive
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i purchased 5 of these 2 way on off switch to remotely control the light in my house replacing the existing switch with these z wave one were relatively straightforward my old switch only used 2 wire line hot and load while these switch use 4 wire line load neutral and ground like most electrician would suggest i also recommend using the screw terminal instead of the push terminal on one switch i wa lazy and used the push terminal and the wire kept popping out even if i tightened the screw which made no difference note that the z wave switch is pretty bulky and will take up about 75 80 of the work box space so if you re installing into a work box that ha multiple switch make sure there s enough room depth wise adding the switch to my mi casa verde vera 2 wa painless and these switch are detected right away just press up and then down to sync the blue led is nice and not overpowering you can easily find the switch in the dark the relay in the switch make a clicking noise when you turn it on off but it s pretty quiet no complaint here switches work great and i would give them a 5 star rating if the depth wa half the size
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: first of all i m not an electrician but i understand the basic concept of electricity since i deal with electricity with my job i decided to replace a pair of basic light switch with these z wave light switch the one i wa replacing only had line load and ground on them with all of the neutral wire bundled in the back of the switch box these z wave switch require a neutral to turn on i beat my head against a wall for about 30 minute trying to figure out how to get the neutral wire to work with this switch i tried the neutral wire on the line side and the neutral from the load side it wouldn t work with either one the instruction weren t the best so i went to the trusty internet to find a solution turns out if you run an additional neutral wire from the z wave switch and bundle it with the other neutral wire in the switch box it work perfectly i wa able to connect it to my house alarm and am able to operate the light via my cell phone or computer they turn on and off my porch and entry light so if i m away for a vacation or something like that i can turn them on and off to give the appearance of the house being occupied also if i forget to turn the light off when i leave i can turn them off remotely also if you are putting 2 of these side by side you may have to trim off the aluminum tab that are on the side i bought the lutron cw 2 wh 2 gang claro wall plate white face plate to go over the top of my switch and had to trim the tab to get the switch to line up with the face plate some of my problem may be common sense to an electrician who ha installed some of these switch before but a i said i m not an electrician so i gave my layman review i only gave 4 star because i had to do some leg work to figure out how to install them but really if there were some better instruction it would have easily been 5 star
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: easy to set up work great with smartthings and alexa echo dot
Review: i started with two of the toggle style switch to get my outdoor light connected to my smartthings hub after installation it took mere second to get them paired with smartthings where i gave a descriptive name to each switch i already had the smartthings skill for alexa installed so i just said alexa turn on the front porch light and about half a second later the light wa on installation is only marginally more involved than a dumb toggle switch replacement be careful following the diagram in ge s instruction because the label change e g wire b in one diagram may be wire a in another however if you pay close attention and are comfortable working with power in your home setup is a breeze it took some working with old wire to get the switch to fit in a smaller 50 year old gang box but wa still only 15 or 20 minute for two switch an obligatory caution for those who haven t done basic electrical work before amperage is unforgiving you can only mess up once all in all i couldn t be happier with this foire into the world of smart home automation i look forward to the next sale so i can buy a bunch more

Review: i recently bought two 12722 in wall paddle switch and one 12723 add on switch for use in a 3 way setup i use them with a wink hub 2 and alexa there wa a little trial and error involved but that wa more first time diy than any of the switch fault that said once i got past my minor error it wa a cinch it help to have a multimeter in case you are unsure which black wire are load and line i swapped them on the first try and didn t think to check with my multimeter until well after doh tips it help to have a multimeter on hand in case you need to verify thing if you re wiring a 3 way you will need a spare wire nut to complete the job the back of these switch are pretty bulky adjust and move wire in the box a much a possible because these switch make the wiring in the box extra crowded i recommend placing some electrical tape over all your screw terminal especially if your ground wire in the box are just bare copper those spacer tab on the switch are ridiculous and you ll almost definitely need to remove them if it s not the only switch in the box do so before you start don t forget to use the jumper wire that come with these switch to connect to neutral the metal plate that frame the switch wa thicker than on my old switch that were staying in the box with them i had to carve a slight recess so that the new switch and old switch would line up flush once the faceplate wa on i had one electrical box that wa installed too deeply into the wall and the screw that come with the switch didn t quite reach due to the extra thickness of the metal plate i bought some longer screw at the hardware store 6 32 is the screw type you want if you find yourself in the same boat i wired one room with a single 12722 and it is pretty straight forward assuming you don t mix them up like i did connect your load black usually or red depending on what wa in the switch you re replacing and line wire 120v common black to the corresponding terminal it s all labeled on the back of the switch you ll have to connect a ground wire a well a the white neutral wire do not remove a neutral from the bundled wire nut in the box you ll end up with an open neutral and the switch won t work if you connect it that way use the white jumper wire that come with the switch and add it to the bundle of neutral wire that s it switch wired next i did a 3 way with a 12722 and the 12723 add on this is a little different from wiring regular 3 way switch i recommend first identifying where your primary zwave switch is going with your trusty multimeter because it will determine how much work you will have to do the way my existing 3 way switch were wired i had 120v on one side only primary if i d wanted to move my primary to the auxiliary side i would have had to cut and combine wire placing another wire nut in the box with multiple wire coming out of it i opted not to do that since space is at a premium basically you just wire the the 12722 zwave switch up like a stand alone on the primary side but also add the traveler wire red in my case on the auxiliary side the 12723 add on switch is only going to need neutral jumper ground and the traveler match the color from the primary side the add on doe not use the load or line wire that were plugged into the old auxiliary switch at all instead you need a spare wire nut so you can combine these two together and then shove them into the back of the box basically this mean that only the primary zwave switch will be switching power to the load the add on switch is only there to tell the primary via the traveler that it button wa pressed which cause the primary to switch on off
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great product a little tough for installation without the best instruction
Review: okay first the product doe exactly what it is supposed to it work a a 3 way or 4 way switch on a circuit in your house a long a you have the ge primary switch in that circuit one cool feature is that up is always on down is always off and if your primary switch is a summer then this one will also dim the light so instead of a single dimmer on a multi switch circuit you have dimmer capability on every switch now the bad part the wiring if you are an electrician don t worry everyone else keep reading the ge primary switch is the only switch in the circuit that ha 110v in it once you go this route the other switch have only the low voltage signal provided from the extra terminal on the back of the primary what this mean is if your 3 or 4 way wiring ha power on one end and the light on the other you need to wire it up to pas the power all the way to the switch with the light directly and then wire up the low voltage communication wire to reach the switch in the other direction before you start you need to figure out which switch are 3 way and which are 4 way the four way will have two set of two wire called traveler you will find two three way switch they have one le wire you need to know which is connected to power and which is connected to the light the simple way to do this is to disconnect the wire and carefully measure the voltage when you turn the circuit on be careful on this step so i will talk about a 4 way since 3 way is the same without the middle switch on 4 way you will have two wire coming into the switch and two going out called traveler these are used to switch the four way circuit on 3 way installation there is a single set of traveler use them a i describe below for the two end switch on 4 way you usually you ll have a red and black traveler coming in and the same going out so for all the 4 way switching in your circuit connect the red in to red out with a screw cap then black to black i chose to use the black for power and red for low voltage signal so connect ground to the white ground bundle in the outlet connect the red wire to your only other terminal low voltage signal in your add on switch and you re done with this switch on the end with the light you will put your master switch connect the incoming black traveler to the 110v terminal white bundle ground to ground connect the wire to the light to the light terminal and the incoming red traveler to the low voltage signal terminal after you remove the tape this is done finally the other end you will use an add on switch here and connect the red traveller to the low voltage terminal you will connect the power into the outgoing black traveller you connect the ground to the white bundle in the socket you are now good to go all the box have the red traveller connected to the low voltage connector the black traveller connects from one end to 110v hot down to the other into the primary switch hot connector the light connects to the primary switch light connector they all have ground now turn on the power and you re good to go
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i paired it with a samsung smartthings hub and after 2 month it still work without a hiccup it s wired to 6 envirolite ev612941wh40 led recessed light the light emit a buzz when they are dimmed even at 90 but no buzz if the light run at 100 brightness install wa simple but beware that the dimmer requires some depth inside the electrical box i also use alexa to turn on and off the light the dimmer return to the last setting if the light are dimmed to 70 one click down and the light are turned off one click up and the light return to 70 push and hold the dimmer and the light will go from 70 to 100 i would like to give 5 star because it work doe what it s supposed but there is the buzz and i don t know if it s the light or the dimmer the light are dimmable

Header: better than a traditional 3 way switch
Review: i recently wired about 22 z wave switch into my home for automation through the wink hub in doing so i experimented with a number of configuration including this ge 12723 paired with a ge12722 switch for a 3 way configuration most of my 3 way used lutron caseta dimmer with remote control since they were actually a little cheaper than the pair of ge switch and the lutron s provided dimming capability however this particular switch wa connected to my outdoor security light and i definitely didn t want them on a dimmer the way my house wa wired the hot wire for the 3 way wa in the garage box while the load wire wa by the front door i wanted the hot wire to be at the front door so i could see the on off indicator led on the switch from inside i changed the recommended wiring provided by ge to use one of the original traveler wire to send hot to the front door ge 12722 switch the second traveler wire became the traveler for the connection between the ge 12722 and ge 12723 all in all it worked like a charm why is it better than a traditional 3 way switch since the traveler connecting the switch sends on off signal between the switch the off position is always off on both switch and the on position is always on you don t have to worry about the switch position changing every time you turn the switch on or off at a different location the ge 12722 connects into the wink hub a a generic z wave switch the current version of software ha no problem reading the on off state of the ge switch the ge 12723 doesn t have to be paired with the hub since the ge 12722 doe all the z wave communication
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: we came close to installing control 4 until it wa explained to u we would have to use a vendor every time we wanted to reprogram a device something that would become very expensive this is when we started to explore other solution we ended up going with wink and a such looked at several zwave device to prototype we tried two other switch made by other company but ended up buying many many more of these ge switch a we continue to automate the whole house the automation is just incredible and these switch work perfectly with the wink system though i am sure they work with any wave system we have the house programed with these switch for multiple mode throughout the day wakeup for running breakfast midday evening and nighttime mood of course wink robot take care of all that then we use the switch a part of if then scenario if somebody walk up to the front door the z wave motion sends a signal to wink that confirms this switch is on so our porch foyer and living room light are on automatically and this switch responds perfectly everytime you pay a little more but all i can say is they work every time given how frustrating electronics can be it is nice to get something that work a advertised everytime i also liked how this switch us slot in the back much like the push in slot on regular receptacle except on these they use a screw to tighten them to ensure they are snug makes attaching the wire very easy and quick to install leaving a lot of space to install the larger space taken up by the switch size itself a downfall of all the zwave switch resembles a gfi switch in size so you can appreciate not needing to use the extra wire nut don t leave many review but these switch earned my recommendation if i could improve one thing it would be nice if they used a full led line under or around the entire paddle to act a a night light or simple to highlight where the switch wa at night
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i wa going to give this 4 star because of how difficult it wa to link up to my wink hub but i decided that wouldn t be fair because the issue wa with the wink app hub not this device the device wa easy to install and it only actually took about 10 minute to install in place of my existing fan switch they include an extra white wire in the box so you can run the required neutral connection to the device if you aren t comfortable or knowledgeable with electrical wiring get someone who is to install this a it doe require some electrical skill once the unit wa installed i wa able to test it manually tap the top of the switch to turn the fan on tap the bottom to turn it off press and hold the top to increase the fan speed press and hold the bottom to decrease the speed linking to my wink controller wasn t a straight forward a i d hoped wink includes a bar code scan option to scan the device bar code you re installing and wink will automatically load up the configuration option for you i scanned the bar code and wink told me this wa an unsupported device it s not really it s just not automatic out of the box so i went the manual route now when selecting the device to install i picked a ge in wall smart switch from the utilities and climate because that section show ceiling fan tried several time and it kept failing with the this is taking too long error i finally called wink support they were very helpful btw and got it straightened out pretty quick they told me i needed to install it a a lighting dimmer module i wish there wa something in the documentation that mentioned this even the wink support page for this device just say follow the manufacturer direction to install but the included instruction just say to follow the z wave controllers instructions to add the device kind of a catch 22 anyway with wink support on the phone we tried adding it a a lighting dimmer module and that didn t work still so the tech had me put the hub in z wave exclusion mode if you re not familiar with this there s online information to remove the device from the hub then put the hub in z wave inclusion mode to add the device kind of back dooring it well this worked fine and the device showed up a a ge lamp in my device list i wa able to edit the device and correctly show it a a fan controller by picking a custom icon the thing work great it say on the box you can set high medium and low speed you have to figure out what level in wink trigger each speed a wink will allow you to set any percent level 0 100 to the module just like a dimmer but the unit will only drive the fan in 3 speed i believe 20 35 is low 36 80 is medium 81 100 is high at least on mine
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have tried caseta lutron which look really good but need a hub customer support wa helpful but could not solve my issue so i sent it back leviton decora which seems okay but one led flicker also the paddle look kind of cheap so it is going back i picked up this ge dimmer at a local store and it installed so easily the wire hookup did not require wire nut so it took up lee room in the box also it is easy to use hold down the bottom paddle and the light dim hold down the upper paddle and the light bright hooked it up to smart things with no problem just add a thing and tap the up paddle in smart things the dimmer behaved exactly like i thought it would what wa cool is that i slid the dimmer in smart things to 0 and the light turned off when i turned them back on it went to the dim setting it had before i pulled the dimmer to 0 also no lag time i press the switch and the light come on i press the switch off in smart things and the light fade off maybe a second or two looks really cool totally happy and glad to buy an american product i am ordering switch for the rest of the house so i can be totally smart things controlled
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: wonderful but need some finishing touch
Review: this is a general review for all of the ge jasco smart switch these are great little switch i am very impressed with them and will continue buying them i got one from lowes that apparently had a bad radio in it but upon further inspection this appeared to be a unit that had already been returned and placed back on the shelf i have a few issue with these though 1 if setting up a multi switch circuit many electrician today only run the two traveler wire to the second box this save money however these box require a neutral wire not the earth ground using the earth ground will result in a back flow of electricity that may cause your light to turn on even when the switch are off in addition using the earth ground is unsafe with that said ge need to come up with a way to make a switch pair that will work without a neutral at the second switch all of the other vendor i have found are the same way and i would rate them down for that short coming a well 2 the unit ship with two screw to screw the faceplate that you provide to the switch i didn t use mine instead i just used the one i already had however on the dimmer switch there is a air gap switch that allows you to turn off the switch completely rather than just dim to 0 apparently if you use a full size screw to attach the faceplate it press against something that engages the airgap switch 3 for multi switch circuit installs the add on switch do not have a z wave radio in them this mean that they cannot be used to extend your zwave network yes it would cost a little more but especially in home that have not embraced smart switch and z wave device the way i have ever z wave repeater help
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: awsome product slightly annoying delay problem
Review: this review is for the light switch i already had a different smart light switch but it connected directly to my wifi which i really liked seeing a i didn t have a zwave hub at the time however when it came time to install two of these switch in a single box i ran into a problem because it used wire nut and extra wire and there wasn t any room for it all in the box at that point i decided to try these ge light switch it didn t connect the wire via wire nut and instead the wire connected directly into the light switch saving a lot of room it wa still a tight fit considering how much larger these smart switch are but at least it fit another pro for this light switch is the rocker remains in a neutral position and you touch the top part to turn the light on and the bottom part to turn the light off intuitive since this is how all light switch work the one i replaced had the rocker always in the traditional on position and you pushed the bottom part of the rocker to toggle between off and on people were confused a to how to work the light switch the first time they used it the other pro about these light switch is they come ready to be used in a 3 way switch seeing a i have about six 3 way switch in my house i also thought it would be good to have all switch be the same rather than have some switch be one kind of switch and the 3 way be a different kind so this wa a major plus too also these switch have a blue light on them that you can control to have the light always on when the switch is on or always on when the switch is off or never on it s a nice feature to put this in your control the only drawback and the reason this is only getting 4 star instead of 5 is there is a delay between turning the switch on off and the light actually turning on off it s not a huge delay i ve timed it and it s about 4 second but it s still pretty annoying considering every switch i have ever used in my entire life ha been instant and this includes the smart switch i wa using prior to this ge model this delay is present when manually operating the switch itself using my smart things app and when using amazon alexa i ve timed it with alexa and it take about 3 second for the light to turn on via alexa whereas my old smart switch took about 1 5 second via the smart things app it s really about the same delay a manually touching the switch about 4 second again not the end of the world but slightly annoying i m sure i ll get used to it eventually just kind of weird that they would design this with a delay seeing a apparently it s possible to create a smart switch that doe not have a delay
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: work with wink app and alexa with an addon swtich for 3 way
Review: work perfect with the wink app and then with alexa too we ahve a 3way so we also got the add on switch your switch will control the light and take power but hte addon only need the traveler and the ground the two switch communicate from zigbee and essentially the main switch is the only one that will control the light the only issue we had wa figuring out our wire we got the addon for the second swtich and that wa the complicated part our wiring wa ridiculous in the dining room we had 3 black wire one red copper white so we know the neutral is white and the copper is ground red should be the traveler to communicate between switch what were the 3 black one wa a second traveler we found out and second wa power and the third for some reason wa the wall circuit in the living room we had the kitchen light on what this wa for but the tv in the living room stopped working ugh haha and the dining room connection did not have a wire to the light this proved difficult a this is where this swtich ha to go and the addon switch go in the living room but the addon switch only ha a port for the ground and traveler it ha no power or load port ended up having to double hook up the wall circuit one with the power in this one ha two port for each connection so yay and put the second blakc traveler on the load port the red traveler on the travler port make sure you hook up the neutral and ground or it wont work then on the addon switch we took the red traveler into the traveler port and connected teh grond these are the only two port available then we had the wire to the light hanging there and the second blakc traveler we twisted those together and bam finally worked now alexa turn on the kitchen light work love it
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: you might need a wire nut
Review: if you ve already installed one of the master switch one of these is super easy it doesn t even take load line wire just neutral traveler and ground on that note it s not obviously clear in the instruction that you do need to connect the line and load wire back together in the box i guess it s obvious when you actually think about how electricity work but at least in my box there wa no wire nut on either the load or line wire fortunately i had an extra wire nut i could use to connect them together and i wa good to go otherwise easy install great result highly addictive update amazon ha since consolidated this with the main switch so i can only add image to this review i m adding a basic diagram of what i did to wire up 4 switch in the same gangbox update 2 i ve recently discovered you can actually daisy chain these switch because each one ha two connector port for each wire type that mean you can have a neutral wire coming in and then another coming out that you can route to the next ge switch no need to route them both individually to a big wire nut in the back

Header: great addition to a home automation setup
Review: the main thing to start out with is that this is an add on switch and will not control light on it s own it can t switch 120v itself but is meant to be used with something such a the ge 12729 dimmer i purchased 3 pair of the 12729 and 12728 to set up three room of my house setup definitely read the instruction and consult an electrician if you need but i ll describe it in my own word the easiest wa to think of this switch is a a remote that control the main z wave enabled one where a normal 3 or 4 way setup will run one power wire line to the first switch then through two wire usually black and red until the last switch and one load to the light in this case the power line go to the ge 12729 and right on to the light because you run the main switch right to the light where the in between old switch had a black in and black out just wire nut these together so power is uninterrupted to the light then where the old one had a red in and red out these are what you hook up to this item you can daisy chain a many a you want back to the control switch the wiring in my house ha always been a mess but with a little testing of the wire i ended up getting them to work fine note that these are fairly bulky so if you have gang box and you re patient enough it may help to take everything out and shorten the length of wire that are unneeded it took some pushing and using the screw to pull them all the way into the box due to everything behind them i also had to break some piece of plastic off my switch plate because they didn t want to sit close to the large metal face important note when attaching the switch plate you may be tempted to use the screw that were already in it assuming you are replacing existing switch the package includes screw for a good reason the standard one are usually too long you ll find that if you tighten a regular screw all the way in the light will suddenly turn off i don t know if this is some sort of safety feature or if it is shorting the internal circuit but i found that backing the screw out and cycling the air gap switch fixed it these have worked flawlessly for month now on a veralite so i would highly recommend see my review on ge 12729 for some tip on z wave control setting
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works reliably well once installed and programmed you forget it s there
Review: switch work reliably well this switch 12727 is the main unit in any z wave controlled light circuit this is the device that pair with your z wave router and that doe get programmed if your circuit ha more than one switch the other switch need to be auxiliary sku 12728 example a foyer light that ha three switch one of these three switch need to be the main unit sku 12727 and the two others are auxiliary if your circuit only ha a single switch that single switch must be the main unit 12727 not the auxiliary unit it is not a good idea to mix z wave with non z wave dumb switch on the same circuit i have three of these circuit in my house all professionally installed and they work like a charm can be programmed into scene can be monitored and turned on off with my smartphone and can be tied to event one of these circuit is illuminating the view for security camera yes they integrate very well into adt pulse
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works great with alexa and google home
Review: finally found a fan switch that i can control the speed of the fan with voice command this work great with smartthings and controlling the fan with the smartthings app alexa or google home it doe get recognized a a dimmer with smartthings but it is just using the 3 speed and not infinite setting like someone mentioned when you tell alexa to set the speed at a range between 1and 32 it us the low setting between 33 and 66 it us the medium setting and above that it us the high setting so for example if i say alex set the fan to 50 the fan speed will be set to the medium speed setting one quirk with google home is that she will return a response something like setting the fan brightness to 50 because of smartthings recognizing the switch a a dimmer all in all i am very satisfied with the switch

Header: good but some info i wish i had at the beginning
Review: i dont normally write review but i thought i would since there is some conflicting information here and some info i wish i had when i started first the unit operates a expected and the paring with my hub wa no problem a couple of note on the install first the infamous neutral wire i ve seen comment answer saying you do and you do not need one i m experience you absolutely need it also this is not the ground wire it s different i wa initially confused because my existing switch didnt have a neutral wire but my house is fairly new also it didnt help i didnt know what a neutral wire wa after some research and pulling everything out of the electrical box i found the house had a neutral wire it just wasnt used needed for the switch i had so it wa just twisted into the back of the electrical box i expect this may be the case for many others also the instruction with the switch dont actually show the neutral connected to the switch in the diagram it s just mentioned briefly the second thing to note is that if you are doing this for a 3 way switch install you have to also buy the add on switch s a 3 way switch is when you have one light controlled by more than one switch so one switch ha to be this one and all others for that light need to be replaced with the add on switch this may be obvious to an electrician or networking type person but wasnt to me ultimately i m happy with the finished product i just wish some of the instruction were presented a little more obviously
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: end of line switch user beware two update
Review: update added at end of initial review i want to write this review because i hope it save someone from having a wasted two day like i just had after buying this yesterday bottom line up front if you have an end of line switch which can be determined by looking at the switch once removed from the box if it ha one line of wire coming in and within that wire it contains a white black and a ground wire that s an end of line what that mean is that the electricity is coming from the light fixture to the switch vice the opposite now many reviewer will tell you that you don t need a common usually white wire the reviewer and many expert will tell you that the solution is to determine the load and line and simply install them to their corresponding place on the switch well here s some problem with all that first end of line wiring involves for reason only real electrician know that the white wire that ultimately appear in your box is wired to a black wire and thus becomes hot the black wire go from the light to the receptacle is used to essentially relay the switch command to the light now if that black wire is going to do that how doe it also perform the function of a common wire which involves transmitting low level electricity to the switch and guess what without it a doc brown would say this damned thing doesn t work now to say i had an adventure would be a great understatement i ve installed a wemo switch installed about ten wireless device ranging from myq to rainman to arlo to 110 outlet with usb outlet to tpc lighting to nest thermostats three including the most complex duel fuel that said i don t claim to be an electrician and i am smart enough to know that it will kill you or burn your house down or both but i am capable of reading research and watching some pretty good video that are out there i spent much of the last two day trying the find the answer to my issue copy and paste this link this is the only reference and i looked at thousand of page that discus this issue i tried various trick and made many mistake first mistake wa assuming the black wa the line and the white the load that s not right for the reason outlined previously i tried the white wire which keep in mind is hot into the common position and wa lucky to notice the switch wa getting warm not right i tried a many will tell you hot wire to line and other wire to load it won t even power on in that mode i tried hot wire to line and black wire common to common it wa then that i got the blue led power indicator and smart things detected the switch in a few second flat here wa the problem no way to turn the light off i wa actually using this on a ceiling fan light that i new when i installed it 15 year ago that i d be largely reliant on largely pull chain but when i hooked the switch up hot to line and black wire to common in addition to not being able to turn the light off when i put more than one blub in they went into a blinking mode the fan also would not respond so after a score two of tripping to the basement two floor below where my main breaker box is located i found this no common wire at the end of the line equal this switch being worthless i do have two other candidate location in my house so i m going to give those a try there as bad a i hate to add about the fourth brand name of wireless device but i m going to have to shop for one that requires no common wire my first thought when reflecting on my adventure is that i m really not only disappointed at ge and the maker for not having this little tidbit in their description or at least more detail about this potential issue but in the end i ll just chalk up this adventure a being beneficial for future electrical experience update i moved this device down to my foyer where there is a double gang that control the foyer light and the outside porch light i decided to relocate the switch there because i thought it might be easier than placing it in a three gang box that control my flood light another location that i ll add a wireless switch when i got the switch cover off and the screw out to see what wa in the box i saw the bundled white wire and then something i hadn t previously noticed i had changed out to paddle switch throughout the house a couple of year ago so i have some familiarity with the wiring in the house but i unexpectedly found one black wire on the switch that control the foyer light wa wrapped around one of the screw on the paddle i m sure it wa wired this way when the house wa built and i d simple moved it when installing the paddle switch that threw me back a bit a far a determining the load and line then it hit me that the wrapped around wire would be the line wire and the other the load so i wired those accordingly to the ge wireless switch and then ran the jumper wire from the white bundle to the common connector i did have to get a larger connector to work with the expanded wiring i turned the power on and turned the light on and immediately had control manually over the light and got the led when i turned it off and i went to smart things and the app almost immediately recognized the switch and the setup wa easy i programmed the light to come on for about an hour when i normally walk my pup i turned off the electricity again because i knew it wa going to be a challenge to get the larger ge switch to fit in along side the paddle switch first step is to break off the three tab on each side doing it with needle nose plier wa a challenge so i switch to larger regular plier i had success just securing each tab with the plier then moving the switch back and forth until each one broke off my load wire kept jumping out even when tightened a tight a i could get it i removed about another 1 8 inch of insulation on the wire to allow it to go deeper into the switch and once i did that no more problem like i said a challenge to get the wireless switch seated properly in the gang box but when i did all worked a intended please allow me to say this this is where ge go wrong their marketing is designed to show how simple the switch is to install and suggest anyone can do the installation what they miss is that rarely will you find an outlet that is a easy to wire a the scenario they pick in their promos to make it look easy chances are you will not find too many situation like that and you are more apt to be challenged with the end of line scenario i first described and then the challenge with the pigtail wiring or whatever it s called that i encountered at the second location so about 15 hour of work research and a lot of trial and error i now have the switch installed and working properly update on second install i wanted to add a switch for my flood light and purchased a second one of these from amazon this wa quite a bit different install a it wa in a three gang box that contained two different circuit with one having the third red wire for switching if that wasn t enough i d had a real electrician run a 110 outlet a few foot below and centered on the wall he had tied into one of the circuit in the switch box to run that line i noticed that when i turned of the circuit breaker at the main box and then came back up stair that my kitchen light had no power but my dining area s light were still on so i brought out the reliable circuit tester powered by fresh battery and sure enough the line i wa going to work on had no power but one of the switch wa still hot since the hot switch wa at one end and the switch i wanted to trade out wa at the other end i thought i could make the swap without turning off more power however when i got the flood light switch removed from the gang box i could see all three switch were going to have to be loosened and moved out to do the wiring and arrang several bundle of wire the trick is to get those bundle behind the two smaller switch where all space is left open to receive the ge switch i wa further advantaged in that i wa working on an older gang box that may be somewhat smaller than today s model the ge furnished common wire turned out to be far too short since i had to run the wire from the white bundle that would be located at opposite end of the gang box i had some extra wire laying around and cut a piece about 5 or 6 inch and it turned out i needed every bit of that length after several minute of wrangling i managed to get everything in place hardest part wa just getting everything lined up and i ended up getting two longer screw than those provided to seat the switch on the gang when i powered up i used the smart things app and it detected the new switch in five second flat i assigned a room and programmed to come on when i walk the pup worked like a charm last night overall the wiring on this wa a cinch after my experience with wiring first one all the challenge on this one wa just getting it to fit the dude that wired four of these switch in a four gang box you got to admire that
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this is a review of the ge 12722 z wave on off switch i have the adt pulse system and this switch ha installed and worked perfectly the physical install is a breeze if you have at least a minimal knowledge of installing switch or outlet the included instruction are pretty thorough so if you take your time and follow them you should be fine the primary issue i encountered wa the pairing of the switch to my adt system i tried at least 10 time before finally getting it to work 2 thing to remember 1 you do not need to have the switch near the base for pairing 2 push the switch button and release quickly do not hold i found i wa making a fairly common mistake based on other review i finally found on here it seems that most people like me have a desire to push and hold the switch button when the adt system is in learning mode but that doesn t work do this 1 log in to your adt pulse portal 2 select system 3 select manage devices 4 click in the box showing switch door thermostat etc 5 click add 6 read instruction click continue walk to switch push and release quickly when you go back to your computer you should see the switch ha been discovered with a screen displaying all of the device information some others have said they had to try up to 3 4 time but all have had success with this method that i have found my particular install is approximately 18 foot from the adt base
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721
