Header: good switch some diy installation tip
Review: identical to ge switch in every way like all zwave switch install is tricky due to space constraint includes perfectly with my vera lite in earlier firmware version a well a the latest ui7 and is detected correctly a an on off switch to include just press the switch with the zwave controller very close by these are wide switch but they fit just side by side with standard building quality light switch in multi switch box i would not recommend installing 2 of these in the same wall box but feel free to try i like the blue led which make it easy to see at night as they have a neutral they work with led and cfl which turn 100 off when locally or remotely switched to off unlike the dimmer version where the led light are still at 50 and cfl s flicker a they have no neutral install requires a neutral wire so make sure you have wire nut and some extra 20 gauge jumper wire handy i like the way these switch install a they have actual contact rather than silly 22 gauge braided wire pigtail the contact support both push in wiring or you can make a loop and hook around the screw terminal a well this make it far easier to retrofit and you do not need extra wire nut for line load with the added benefit of requiring le space in an already crowded electrical box its likely you will need both jumper wire and 2 x wire nut for neutral and earth though the easiest install method for single pole is to cut a 7 long white jumper wire for neutral and a 7 bare copper wire for ground from some 3 core wire stripping around 3 4 from each end connect the white neutral to the existing bunch of neutral wire in the box by removing the existing wire nut adding in your new jumper wire then replacing the wire nut you may need to use a larger wire nut connect the ground the same way to the existing ground wire s you should now have the 2 original black wire from the standard builder switch line load a well a 6 long jumper for neutral white and ground bare copper for a total of 4 wire coming out of your wall box connect all four wire to your new jasco ge switch a per the instruction on line load neutral ground and it will work every time install for 2 way switch is the same extra work with the neutral wire but you need 2 different model of jasco ge switch and they must be wired in a very specific order model 45609 is the main switch and the second switch is a special auxiliary model 45610 connected to each other via a traveler wire the newbie mistake on these ge jasco zwave switch and i see a ton of them in opened package at lowest after being returned is to miss the neutral wire a the original builder switch don t have these the neutral wire is needed to power the zwave radio and the blue led when the switch is in the off position
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i use two of these with my smartthings 2 hub i have them programmed to automatically turn on off at sunset and sunrise respectively i am no electrician but the instruction are so easy to follow that even a caveman can do it just remember to turn off the power from your breaker box before you decide to open the outlet up and start messing with wire product requires a neutral line white wire be sure you have this in your wall electric box before disconnecting your old light switch most newer house should have 12 3 or 14 3 romex black white bare copper for ground if you do not have or see at minimum these 3 color in your outlet box this product will not work for you
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: this does not work directly with alexa or apple homekit
Review: warning this does not work directly with alexa or apple homekit here s what i found out from z wave customer support there are several z wave hub that will work with echo alexa but currently there aren t any that will work with homekit z wave is working with apple on getting integration to work but it is not available yet the smartthings wink and some of the homeseer hub will work with alexa nexia ha a hub that doe in other words you have to buy more equipment in order to make this switch work with your iphone or alexa they certainly don t make that clear from their sale ad
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: a few hours later it work my 3 way wiring wa witchcraft and it took multiple try to figure out what the heck wa going on instructions in the box were worthless so dr google wa there to save they day a always i successfully set up a 3 way switch using the toggle dimmer switch paired with the add on toggle switch only problem i currently have is that my led retrofit from feit buzz when dimmed any amount the switch is silent so i m not sure what to do aside from swapping out recessed retrofit light until i find one that work but i hear some switched work better than others when it come to this issue however i typically find that a switch will buzz and not the fixture words of advice 1 use the provided short screw for the face plate mount the original one from my old switch were longer and when full screwed in they somehow turn the bottom left right toggle built in in off odd behavior for sure but that s what it is so there s a reason they give you them and they are suspiciously shorter 2 3 way switch setup will require one wire screw nut to tie together the black wire at the add on switch since that switch doesn t need them something i didn t anticipate and they didn t include on in the box they should 3 buy a 10 contactless voltage tester 4 remove the metal wing right off the get go these switched are large
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: the future is here well a very short pairing distance future
Review: i am using two of these in my garage attic to turn the light on automatically when you climb up the retractable stair they are connected to a smartthings hub and a samsung motion sensor tell them to turn on when you climb up very easy to install with the supplied wire nut the only quirky thing is they have a very short range to do the initial connection with the hub it even state that they have to be within 10 foot of the hub well that s easy for a device that is more mobile like a plug but something that is hardwired you can t really wire up by the hub then wire up in your junction box i had to bring an old wifi extender up to the attic of the garage along with my samsung hub connect the extender to the network and lan connect the hub then go through the z wave pairing on the smartphone it worked great once the hub wa within that short range so either you have to have these closer to a hub have a super long lan cable to bring your hub closer to the outlet or do a i did i love that the outlet ha one always live plug
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i purchased this switch to work with my smartthings hub this being the first smartthing it took a bit of research to install the product look great the led light at the bottom of the switch can be configured to always off on when light is on or on when light is off through the smartthings app it s nice to be able to turn the led to always off for use in a bedroom i have no experience wiring electrical outlet but i took this on after watching the installation video a few time it wa pretty straight forward i just copied the config from the old switch it is very important to have that neutral wire attached you cannot go without it the switch will not work there is a neutral wire included in the bottom of the box along with the extra ivory colored paddle after install i wa a bit confused with getting the switch connected to the hub but after a bit of research found that you begin your search with the smartthings hub and turn the switch on then off connected right up remember this it s not stated in the paper direction very clearly i found that fitting this switch into the box in the wall the screw mount catch on the neutral wire connection since i have another switch to replace with a smart switch for this 2 gang box in the future i m unsure if this will interfere with the installation of the face plate cover this switch can also be used a a 3 way switch and you do have to buy the the add on switch for the other end the switch are stationary they click when you press the on or off button they do not flip like traditional paddle switch the light switch ocd in me love that because there isn t one switch in the on position and the other switch in the off position in a 3 way configuration they all look the same i m looking very forward to completing my switch conversion and will be choosing this ge z wave switch for the entire project
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: intermediate installation knowledge required more advanced than typical switch replacement
Review: i would have rated this 4 star however installation wa a bear for me i m just a basic handyman around the house and have installed many a replacement switch however this one threw several curveballs a the marketing and product disclosure could have been more informative if being used on a 3 way switch i e 2 light switch then you must also buy the add on companion switch to replace the other switch that control the same light these should be sold a z wave control for one light switch circuit and z wave control for 2 light switch 3 way circuit if using on a light with two switch this system will only work if you replace both the primary z wave and the add on switch it s not a preference it s a requirement b next you have to figure out which switch box is the wired a the primary and which is the add on i m no electrician but after about 12 hour of youtube based learning resorted to using a multimeter i had initially tried a pen voltage detecter but it wa not able to differentiate between hot wire and cold wire which i guess technically have a volt or two for carious reason with the multimeter 1 hour of youtube learning i could easily see the hot wire v cold wire when check each of the 4 combination of on off possible on on on off off on off off among my two switch to determine which had a wire that wa always hot not matter what this is the primary switch directly connected to the fuse box i learned that my primary wa the opposite switch than i initially thought thank goodness it wa within range of my nexia router through additional test i verified which wire were trailer 1 and 2 also necessary to continue the installation perhaps this would have ben quicker if i were an electrician c i wa also thrown off by the neutral wire but that wa simple enough once i learned more about it simple enough d the add on switch requires the installer to use a wire nut not supplied to merge the t1 and the load wire the one that go out to the light i would say i spent 6 hour with the main switch until i learned i needed the add on after receiving that delivery a week later i spent another 6 hour learning the wiring knowledge described in b c and d above i would say this install is not for rookie who are not able to spend time learning the concept of 3 way wiring and establishing a comfort level with which wire doe what in their particular system my house is only a couple year old and ha fresh wiring and gang box that follow current city code yet most house don t come with documentation explaining the electrical wiring schema once connected i fired it up and shazaam it worked great and easily connected to the nexia yay
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: this ge unit is the second brand in my smart home the first wa the tp link switch in my experience with this ge unit i found the installation reasonably comparable to the tp link unit to install as a person with very little residential electrical knowledge the instruction are a bit confusing but luckily the wire are color coded i originally purchased the tp link smart switch because it doe not require a hub and it ha a nice premium look to it however i found the tp switch to be frustrating unreliable a other reviewer have experienced perhaps i have a bad unit but for my particular unit the connection often cut off and i m forced to reset the switch to reconnect this defeat the purpose of having a smart switch if it so unreliable that i have to walk to the switch to reset to remotely access it again for the ge unit a hub is required so i have paired it to a samsung smartthing so far i have found the connection to be reliable there have not been a single instance when the light doesn t do what i ask using alexa due to a bad connection another added benefit of being paired to smartthing is being able to control all the various light under different smart switch at once tp link is noticeably missing from being compatible from smartthings and therefore i cannot add it to a room or scene to control together despite the average design it look like any normal household light switch i would go with the ge switch for it reliability and compatibility
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: updated review i reached out to jasco about the ramp rate not working a intended i received a very informative response from the project managers apparently the device wa operating a designed however jasco ha since modified the existing firmware with a new parameter to allow you to adjust the behavior i tested it on my dimmer and it worked a stated very happy with the product and jasco customer service response from jasco thank you for contacting jasco products company here is the response from our product managers we apologize for the amount of information we need to provide to accurately answer your question but unfortunately there is some bad information being spread about what you are describing first and foremost the ge dimmer 12724 and 14294 do not require a patch or bug fix a there is not a problem or incorrect behavior both unit operate correctly a they were designed all of our previous dimmer including 12724 used to ramp slowly when being sent a level specific command 1 100 we then updated our 12724 product with enhancement that added additional routing option and to take advantage of the latest z wave technology when we did this we had to upgrade the behavior of the dimmer to the latest spec a defined for z wave certification this new specification requires that when receiving a level specific command 1 100 the device is required to immediately jump to that level any z wave classic dimmer including 12724 that ha ver 3 0d and earlier on the back of the product will ramp slowly to the specific level when issued a level specific command any z wave classic dimmer including 12724 that ha ver 3 0e this is the last version produced on our z wave classic product on the back carry this new behavior any z wave plus dimmer including 14294 will carry this new behavior because this is a requirement for z wave certification the product must ship with the newest behavior a default however understanding that our customer may want the previous behavior we developed a new configurable parameter into our latest ge 14294 and jasco 14321 in wall smart dimmer dim up down rate parameter number 6 size 1 byte valid values o 0 default new required behavior instantly move to level o 1 ramp up and down slowly 3 0d and previous version behavior you can determine if the ge 14294 jasco 14321 ha this feature by verifying the manufacturer date code on the front of the dimmer in the bottom right hand corner it will be a small white sticker with 4 number the first 2 number are the year it wa manufactured example 17 2017 the last 2 number are the week it wa manufactured example 07 7th week 2017 or 3rd week of february 2017 any ge 14294 manufactured on or after 1651 will contain this new parameter 6 any jasco 14321 manufactured on or after 1705 will contain this new parameter 6 original review so this device 14294 wa almost what i expected apparently the dimmer doe not ramp up correctly when the command is issued via zwave it jump immediately to the set level regardless of the parameter setting the only time the ramp rate work a designed is when going to 0 any other level jump straight there the ramp rate work correctly when issued from the switch itself however very disappointed i m still inside my return window and will likely send these back if i can t find out if a firmware update might correct this behavior
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: easy installation solid connection to wink hub good ergonomics
Review: i have 8 of these ge 12722 switch scattered throughout the house i bought them after comparing to the linear counterpart the linear wa a cheaper construction had side tab that were hard to remove and that bent the metal can while trying run enough quiescent power to stay warm continuously and doesn t give a tactile feedback when switched when compared to the ge this ge switch us connection to the neutral line to enable an internal power supply this mean you don t have to worry about the impedance of the load to provide grounding for the internal power supply or the need for a dummy load if the impedance is too high since the internal power supply run a relay the switch can power most any type of device incandescent light cfls leds fan etc all the switch paired easily with my wink hub with the wink s hub recent software update the switch reliably report their on off status i wired one in a 3 way configuration using the ge12723 companion auxiliary switch the instruction would have had me with the master switch in the garage and the auxiliary switch without a status light inside however i wanted the status light inside so i modified the suggested wiring using the spare traveler wire to route the hot line to the indoor box my only suggestion to ge would be to automatically dim the indicator light at night it can be a bit bright when all the light are off
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i installed this switch in about an hour i had two problem 1 the wiring in my house is unconventional or at least i think so 2 had issue pairing with the wink hub even though i had neutral they weren t being used on top of that the traveler wire wa connected i tried following the direction and simply connecting the neutral load line in the standard configuration but the light wouldn t work i had to connect the load and the line wire to the load connection and the traveler wire to the line neutral ground a usual i included picture 2 i tried using the scan bar code in the wink app in order to quickly pair the switch however i received the message this device is supported yet if it wasn t for the review and google i would ve thought i had made a bad purchase when i wa going through the pairing process i kept getting the message this taking longer than usual would you like to retry or cancel after several time i decided to go back to mr google for help as i wa searching i so happen to grab my phone when i did i looked at the wink app and noticed there wa a new light icon i tested the light and it worked a required so my biggest issue with the device is that it didn t signal me to that the device wa paired and the wink app never gave me a success or looked a if it completed the process however after these hurdle the device worked a expected oh a a few other ppl have stated after i installed it i wa no longer able to use the face trim plate the manual slide at th bottom of the toggle prevents the plate from going back on
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: unreliable and difficult to install but don t require a neutral wire
Review: i loathe and despise these switch unfortunately a far a i can tell i m stuck with them if i want a little bit of automation why because my house is old and ha a lot of switch loop wiring so unless i want to rewire my house nope these are the only z wave compatible switch available in beige that don t require a neutral my other option is the now defunct activehome system which i had and which worked perfectly for the past 15 year but are now starting to behave erratically barf why do i hate them let me count the way just two really 1 they are soooo difficult to install you insert the wire under the appropriate screw and then tighten it sounds easy right nope the screw kind of float until you tighten them this isn t uncommon and wouldn t be a problem except that ge decided to bury the screw in a freakin small trench there isn t enough clearance between the screw the plastic switch housing around it to just slip a wire around easily you have to thread it from the opening on the back which when gravity decides to do it s thang with the floaty screw becomes an amazing exercise in frustration especially when 2 the switch often don t work i have 2 light i need automated two i am now on switch number 5 6 these thing fail like dot com startup you fight through getting them wired up turn on the power and they don t work if you look at these thing wrong they ll fuse open or closed and then it s game over man they re apparently very sensitive little device and the slightest anything unusual just break them i have 3 of these piece of junk sitting on my table representing about 120 of wasted money
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: very unreliable when sending status back to the hub
Review: i have a large lutron caseta installation at home and i wanted to try some z wave switch in my network for simple on off load i bought eight of these switch to use with my wink hub 2 and installed two of them they were in the next room from the hub separated by perhaps ten foot of a drywall wood stud wall they paired fairly quickly with the wink hub 2 and could be controlled reasonably quickly when i pressed the icon on the wink app or used alexa however feedback from the switch would take about 30 second this would manifest in several way one of which wa the wink app not updating the change in status of the controlled light for that period of time and the other more troubling and what killed the deal for me a wink robot that i created that would sense when the switch wa turned on from the physical switch itself and then turn on another light would take 30 second for the other device to react you can imagine what a horrible user experience this is i tried several z wave network command such a rediscovering the network a few time and resetting the complete network so i had to re pair all my z wave device only the two switch so no big deal but nothing seemed to help i am uninstalling these two switch and returning all eight i have exceeded my tolerance for trying to get what should be simple technology to work a advertised i ordered four homeseer hs ws100 z wave plus scene capable wall switch works with amazon alexa switch and will try those when they arrive if i still get marginal bi directional z wave performance i m going to bail on z wave light control i ll still use it for sensor because the wink hub 2 work really well with z wave sensor and stick with lutron caseta switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: a tad more installation work but worth it
Review: pros connects to the neutral wire connect to switch instead of dangling wire out the back connects to z wave network easily work great cons connecting the neutral is more work but worth it deeper dimension than standard switch overall installation requires a little more work than the older version but it s worth it to avoid the downside they had and these switch work great i ve been using z wave switch for awhile and most of mine were the previous version of ge jasco switch this is definitely a step up here s why the older generation of switch were mainly designed for incandescent light in this system you really didn t need to connect the neutral wire to the switch the switch required a very low constant power supply to operate it s never 100 off this current would pas on to the light and it would take the return path via the light neutral wire the problem is that with cfl and especially led bulb this cause a flickering in dimmer switch when they brighten or dim and can can cause led bulb to glow when the switch is off because just enough current is going through the line to activate them it wasn t enough for incandescent bulb to light up by having a neutral connected to the switch though you don t have these problem since the low current isn t passed on to the light when off i also prefer the switch like this where you attach the wire directly to the switch and screw them tight instead of the type that ha wire hanging out the back i don t have to twist wire together and have wire nut taking up room in the box where i m usually pretty low on space anyway the downside is that you might have some unexpected work to do in the switch box if you start off with standard switch the electrician most likely took all the neutral wire twisted them together and capped them off in the box you ll have to run a jumper wire from the connected neutral over to your switch the box includes a jumper but it may not be long enough for what you need especially if you have a multi gang box and the neutral are twisted together on the opposite side of the box i just took some romex and cut out a length of white wire for the job and a others have noted these switch are a little deeper than normal one and you might have to do some wire cramming in the box to make everything fit as for the z wave i connected it to my smartthings hub with no problem and it work perfectly all in all i like these they re better than the older variety in several different way and they re a good price for z wave switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: edit i tried to review both the add on switch and the z wave switch but amazon keep lumping them together so here is another go at it first both these do exactly what they are supposed to i have a bunch of the switch and the add on switch and none have failed in the original review i took off a star because because the screw are philips head household switch are supposed to have robertson head screw but really no big deal the add on switch can be a bit hard to hook up at first but they are simple you just need a neutral wire white from anywhere and a traveller non current carrying wire usually red or black back to the main ge z wave switch for the traveller in a rewire one can just use any wire that go between the add on and the z wave switch providing there is no electricity in it the neat thing about the add ons is that one can have several of them all in parallel going back to the ge z wave switch so a single light or bank of light could be controlled from two three or more location providing you have or can install a traveller wire between all the additional add on switch on one re wiring i messed up and inadvertently had power on the traveller i wa sure i d blow the switch or the add on a the instruction are clear that there should be no power on that terminal so my surprise nothing blew up
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: perfect for adding voice control to minka aire ceiling fan using amazon echo veraplus and bws ha gateway
Review: our house ha two minka aire fan that had that company s wireless remote certain unnamed family member will leave these fan on 24x7 in the summer whether they are at home or not so i wanted a way to have them shut off automatically a well a voice control them with our amazon echo dots yes i am the grumpy put on a sweater thermostat nazi kind of guy after a little research confirmed that our minka aires were ac fan this turned into a fairly straightforward install the first step is to turn off the appropriate home breaker or course remove the cowling from the fan that is the piece next to the ceiling that contains the wireless receiver i could lower it to access the wiring where i bypassed the receiver by just jumping white to white black to black i left the receiver there just bypassed them i then replaced the minka aire wall switch with this ge fan control you need a neutral wire then you simply pair the switch with your home automation system in my case a veraplus which can pair z wave switch from a great distance although the vera now ha direct amazon echo control in beta i m personally using the bws systems free ha bridge a the interface between alexa and home automation which give you a lot of customization feature the ge fan control show up a dimmable lamp in home automation so after some experimentation i had an alexa on command map to the medium fan speed at a dimmer level of 55 if we want high speed we say alexa set family room fan to 100 or alexa set family room fan to 20 for low speed it work great using the pleg plugin for vera i now use an existing alarm system motion sensor to turn the fan off automatically if no motion is detected after a set period of time if there is a false negative because no one is moving in the room you just use your voice to turn the fan back on it will pay for itself in maybe a decade i would give the control 5 star but having it appear a a dimmable switch seems like a bit of a z wave compromise it work fine but i think could have been better implemented
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: outstanding end result with reliable performance
Review: works great with vera edge add it a generic z wave device great switch be aware that it is a bit larger than a common switch and will require use of a neutral wire it doe come with a neutral jumper so you can wire it into a neutral pigtail bundle with little effort also use the supplied switch plate screw and not the screw which come with the switch plate itself the supplied screw are shorter and essential i made a small extension cord used it to power the switch for pairing in close proximity to the vera controller during pairing i then disconnected the switch fro the short extension cord and installed them in their permanent location using vera vera app automated scene my echo my firetv s w voice alexa and the vera echo bridge application all of my exterior light turn on and off under multiple circumstance to include arriving home leaving home going to bed at midnight at sunrise whenever i want via my phone and when i ask alexa to toggle them on off outstanding end result with reliable performance
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: quality device difficult to pair extremely bright light
Review: i just installed this receptacle in my kitchen to control the window unit air conditioner we have in there to give a boost to the central air when cooking i am a master electrician so the swap of the old receptacle for the new wa a breeze i also have my bs in computer science but that early 90 s degree get me nowhere with today s computer and apps after twenty minute of trying to get this device to pair with my wink hub 2 and trying every device configuration in the power category in the wink app i retreated here to the review looking for someone who had tried to pair this device with a wink hub i found anastasia s review and she wa correct i paired with the outdoor ge plug in outdoor smart switch it said the paring failed i killed the app and restarted it and went to the lights power control group and it showed up there a switch with a light bulb icon we ll see if this switched controlled receptacle ha the fortitude to run an 8000 btu window unit a c as for the blue light on the front of the receptacle it on when the bottom controlled portion of the receptacle is off it go off when the receptacle is on i have mine installed low behind a cabinet and it isn t visible so the light doesn t bother u however if this were installed elsewhere and the receptacle wa not hidden the brightness of the light would be a problem especially in a bedroom where blue light while sleeping they are discovering is not a good thing this update come a month after the original install the receptacle is still working fine i have abandoned wink a my home automation controller and have switched to vera a it is more flexable and offer more option like geo fencing and energy metering his device un paired easily from wink and pared very easy with vera using a generic z wave device protocol in the device section of vera i knew when i purchased this device that it did not have a metering function i will be replacing it this week with an enerwave rm15r that had metering capability
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i found this product under a list of item compatible with the new echo plus smart home hub after 45 minute on the phone with amazon support we found out that this item is not compatible with the echo plus smart home hub it doe require a separate hub for use z wave product are not compatible with the echo plus smart home hub amazon need to remove z wave item from their list of supported product for the echo plus smart home hub
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: doesn t look the same a it mate
Review: this add on switch function a it should there s no question about it wiring wa straightforward and simple and it worked immediately and easily to control a hardwired light from a second location i knocked two star off it rating for two separate issue both of which would be an easy fix and grant a great deal more satisfaction with the product both of my negative criticism of this device are because of it design while you might think design is secondary to function it is after all just a switch whose function should be taken for granted a the very purpose of it existence therefore design is key the two issue i have are simple and i imagine would be easily remedied in the manufacturing process the problem is that this standalone switch is built to be compatible strictly with ge s smart dimmer switch ge z wave plus wireless smart lighting control smart switch on off in wall includes white light almond paddles works with amazon alexa 14291 but sadly it doe not match the design or look of the switch it compatible to i m disappointed that at this price point it doesn t appear identically to it mate the first and most obvious is that the ge s smart switch all have a blue led in the bottom right of the switch s frame to help you easily locate the switch in the dark this add on switch doe not have such an led therefore breaking up the continuity of a switch bank i have it installed with two other smart switch and causing a sort of asymmetry the second design flaw likely a result of the omitted led is that the switch frame is not the same width and therefore look like a totally different brand perhaps it would not bother some people but these subtle difference catch my eye from across the room and detract from it overall satisfaction
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: update coming near july 14th to wink hub will allow for device to work a expected as of 6 22 2017
Review: update 2 7 15 17 got a call from jasco support stating after this latest wink update it work a expected a little weary i installed the device easy enough now that this is attempt 4 it work connected it using inclusion mode on the wink hub and it recognized it on the first button press i am very happy and glad it finally work i want to thank jasco for their very good customer service they really did go above and beyond to get this resolved for me personally all in all i would highly recommend them now that they work update went from 1 star to 3 as stated below by the manufacturer i wa contacted and a very nice manager wa able to let me know the information i needed i am glad that jasco wa able to see the customer feedback and resolve the issue that truly go a long way for me a it is never a good time when you waste time installing something and have tech support send you in circle i will be re installing this switch near july 14th time frame and will try once more i will update here if it started to work currently i have 5 z wave standard switch installed and they work flawlessly with my wink hub 2 i needed 2 more and found these were replacing the older standard z wave version i thought that wa perfect a newer typically is faster and better after the typical mumble and grumble i tend to have when installing these switch into my triple gangbox setup i am relieved to find the blue light turn on on the switch and i am able to manually control the fan the hard part wa supposed to be over but after attempting to pair the switch with my wink hub 2 i found that nothing i did would work i tried exclusion mode inclusion mode restarting the wink hub 2 resetting the switch etc but nothing i did allowed for it to work my next step wa to call wink and figure out what may be happening the representative told me that the device wa pairing but coming up a an unknown device no matter what we did it stilled showed up a such basically the device wa useless i called jasco the creator of the switch and they informed me that it wa compatible with wink however the representative from wink informed me that they believed the wink logo wa put on there erroneously a he couldn t find any documentation on his end that would state the fan controller wa a supported device on top of that the jasco rep wa very unhelpful and basically told me i had 2 defective switch which wa wonderful because i believed him and uninstalled the 2 switch and went back to get more after installing only 1 of the 2 new one i found that again the device wasn t able to be paired the new jasco rep told me that it wa strange that it wasn t working and that wink wa a registered partner for these device he said i could talk to a product manager but they wouldn t be able to resolve my issue and it wa out of their hand such a waste of time tldr version the ge z wave plus fan controller doe not work with the wink hub 2 a of 6 22 2017 it will pair but a an unknown device and only the wink rep can see this if you want a z wave fan controller by ge that work buy the standard z wave version a denoted by the model number 12730 i can confirm this product currently work with wink hub and wink hub 2
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: and whoever thought it wa a good idea to put the ground screw right above the
Review: installation wa straightforward directions said to pair by pushing once i could not get it to pair until i read a review that said push the top and then the bottom it paired right away btw to un enroll push twice the screw were so tight i thought i wa going to strip them just getting them to loosen be sure you have wire nut a little larger than the original because the extra wire for neutral and ground are difficult to add with the original wire nut and whoever thought it wa a good idea to put the ground screw right above the mounting screw must not have ever installed a light switch the mounting screw wa definitely in the way other unit just use wire pigtail and honestly they are not that much harder to deal with in fact a pigtail give you extra wire to deal with though they do use a couple of extra wire nut once installed it ha been working well and my vera lite control it just fine

Header: 3 second delay with wink 2 bulky size but it work great
Review: i have a pair of these to control my porch light they work great with alexa and my wink 2 there is about a 3 second delay in comparison to my other product that are near instant but it s tolerable these do require a neutral so older wiring may be an issue they are quite bulky and that make installation a pain if the electrician wired thing up like a monkey with a huge rat nest of wire in the box i ran into a slight issue in a steel dual gang box due to width it barely fit but i wa not able to push the switch to the side to get the wall plate to line up properly it wasn t an issue with drywall overhang but with the width of the steel gang itself just being too narrow by about 2mm i managed to make it work but the wall plate screw ended up at a slight angle that being said i do like the device and will be getting more they aren t perfect but they do the job well enough

Header: works with smartthings no problem so far
Review: i bought a samsung smartthings hub and have been replacing switch throughout the house i bought this specifically to work with a celing fan with light along with their fan control for some reason no company had a combined fan light control installed in a 2 gang box it work with my smartthings hub seamlessly and if we move it will function a a normal switch for the next homeowner i knocked off 1 star the switch ha captive screw for the wire hookup that are intentionally loose if anyone ha wired up a normal switch the screw will stay put when backed out this make it a little harder to wire up but not impossible

Header: no problem with switch dimmer or ceiling fan all were found by vera edge immediately and easy to setup
Review: alright i really enjoy what these switch do but i am not a fan of installation the back of the item are rather bulky so ramming them back into the box get tough but what is really annoying is that there is either no tension or no spring loading on the screw so if you have to do a class wire wrap instead of inserting into the straight connector you re going to bang your head having to wrestle with the screw to get a wire loop in there other than the install they have all worked well i have dimmer which seem to go in 1 increment via my vera edge i have 8 or so on off switch and recently started using the ceiling fan switch all work really well functionalliy just 1 star for the install maybe the bulk is shielding or something but you would think in this day and age the device could have been a bit le bulky it s almost guaranteed you will want to break off the butterfly wing on both side if you have more than 1 switch per gang i d do that before wiring them in once i had enough of these scattered through the house i wa able to add more zwave device without having to move my vera edge around it is addicting to have these next step will be to incorporate motion sensor into scene
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: simple easy to use with smartthings
Review: great zwave switch here you will need a zwave controller to use the wireless feature at the 35 40 price point i won t be replacing many switch but i wanted one to control my outdoor lighting the outdoor lighting is fluorescent tube so one of the few fixture i don t have smart bulb for it wa very easy to install but just barely fit into the single gang box after i removed the old switch shut off your circuit breaker first of course i found a black and white wire only screwed those in i had connected the included small neutral wire to the switch but that s not connected to anything in the wall smartthings detected it quickly without any issue my wife didn t like the blue led indicator so i easily turned it off from the smart thing app there were also option to have the led indicator on when the switch wa either on or off it s really been great to set the light on my patio to come on automatically helps keep my dog from getting anxious in the dark and make it look like somebody is home the best part is if i hear a suspicious noise or something outside i can turn the light on from my phone or tablet lets me light up the backyard very quickly update after several month of use this switch is still working perfectly i have had absolutely no compatibility issue with smart thing i set the automatic timer in the smart thing app to turn this light on and off and it s worked brilliantly
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works like a champ with smartthings
Review: works like champ one caveat however this is easy to wire but if you are replacing a single pole switch going to a light you must still connect the neutral wire white to another white wire even if you are replacing a simple inline switch smart thing found it effortlessly nice feature is that through smartthings you can set the function of the blue led light on the switch on mean light is on so you know by looking if your outdoor light are on for example or on mean light is off so you can find switch in the dark or no light whatsoever which is not near a cool function basic rocker switch style switch stay in middle position push top and a solid click will turn on the light push bottom and a solid click will turn off the light when you release it go back to middle position

Header: nice with one note to be aware of
Review: it s a zwave enabled on off decora style switch and it work there are both dimmer and switch version of this unit the newer series 12xxx series work fine with dimmable leds i ve seen report that the older one do not there is one thing to be aware of these do not support the association command class which mean you cannot tell your controller to notify it if you locally change the switch with the paddle most gateway poll for state but there s a delay before the update is recognized leviton s switch for example do support this and a such you get instant notification for local change does this matter to you it might for most people it probably doesn t but if you wish to gang thing off local control e g you turn on the light using this switch your controller see that a a trigger and turn on three other thing then this limitation suddenly becomes a very material and impossible to solve problem as long a you re ok with this limitation i like these a lot they look and feel like standard decora switch where most others in the marketplace do not which is imho a big plus note config parameter 4 set whether pressing the top paddle a shown in the picture turn the load on or off default is zero and on setting it to 1 flip the paddle so the top paddle turn the load off and vice versa config value 3 set the led zero default set the led on when the load is off and vice versa while 1 set the led to follow the load on on off off
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: great when they work have had to replace many over the year they have been installed
Review: not really sure how to rate these they are great when they work however i ve had to replace 4 of them on occasion where we have had a power outage and they are getting expensive to replace once the power come back on they click on and off constantly and never work again have had them installed for about a year and every time we lose power it seems one switch go bad i figured the first one went bad because i didn t have a surge protector installed got one installed and have lost 2 more since then i installed them all over my entire house along with some of the dimmer when we remodeled our home also i don t think it the same thing but another switch still work manually but will not work anymore with smart thing smart thing detects that it on and off i just can t control it from the hub even after excluding it and adding it back so i m going to have to replace that one a well
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: details on alarm com finding the neutral wire
Review: there are two aspect of installing this system 1 configuring your z wave system and 2 basic switch wiring 1 z wave my alarm system includes an alarm com module that act a a z wave controller in advance of buying these light switch i called my alarm company and specifically requested that they enable light lock thermostat etc it did not cost any extra before starting the installation i logged into the alarm com web interface and made sure i saw a message like this your service plan includes light automation but it doesn t look like you have any light device that helped me realize that the system wa ready for the install 2 wiring i installed two z wave switch into a three gang wall plate the two z wave switch now control the exterior light turning them on at sunset i didn t want to bother paying extra to automate an interior light my modern house built in the last few year included three wire already attached to the old switch a copper ground wire a black line hot wire and a black load wire these were simple on and off switch not three way switch tucked away inside the three gang wall plate wa a bundle of white neutral wire inside a screw cap working with the neutral wire wa the hardest part of the installation for a non electrician i went to a big box store and bought 15 foot of romex 14 guage wire for around 7 buck the romex included a black and white wire plus a ground i just wanted two 8 inch length of the white wire i stripped the end of each 8 inch white wire to turn it into a pigtail lead that went to the big bundle of white neutral wire i also bought a larger wire nut at the big box store my non contact voltage tester helped me differentiate the line hot wire from the load wire in my installation both were black but the hot wire is the one that beep when you put a voltage tester near it also it provided some extra peace of mind if you turn off the circuit breaker you re pretty safe but i ran back and forth to the breaker box a bunch of time trying to figure out the wire if i placed the voltage tester near the wire and did not hear any beep i felt more comfortable reaching in there here s the voltage tester on amazon fluke 1ac a1 ii voltalert non contact voltage tester http www amazon com gp product b000ej332o
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: works perfectly with dimmer but requires some electrical rewiring in the box
Review: wiring this accessory switch wa weird because it is the opposite of the way a traditional three way switch is installed you usually have the traveller and the hot going through the switch and the neutral is just connected directly to the load but not this accessory switch it is actually the opposite you still connect the traveller through the switch but this is the neutral that you connect to the switch the hot go straight to the load because of that it mean that you have to identify which of the two switch is the one going to the load before you can replace them the main switch and the accessory are not interchangeable from an electrical point of view tldr if you are replacing an existing switch be ready to have some slight rewiring in the box to do nothing too difficult but need some attention also you have to make sure that you have disconnected the both existing switch before doing the installation or you might send hot into the accessory dimmer and that s not good the documentation is pretty good and easily to follow just make sure to read it before tackling the install
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: work 100 of the time with the wink hub you must have a neutral wire to use this most switch don t have a neutral hooked up but will have a bundle of 3 or 4 white wire in the back of your box typically these are all neutral and you just need to get a small piece of wire to tap into the neutral with a wire nut then run it into this switch very easy to install first one took around 15 min can do them in le then 5 now have used this with cfl and led light they work great because this switch doe not dim no humming or buzzing or anything like that there is a nice blue led light on the front of this switch that is on when the light is off it s nice so you can see the switch easily in the dark i hear this can be changed with different hub led off when light is on but not the wink hub fyi it s not a super bright led light anyway have several of these and will be buying more
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: annoying to pack into electrical box but work well and appears reliable

Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i took away one star because the blue light on this receptacle is so bright the only place i could use it wa to replace the receptacle for the freezer in my garage so that if for reason it go off or disconnect my homeseer will send me an email letting me know and the very bright blue light is also advantageous here since i will now certainly know if the receptacle is off because the garage will be blue outside of my type of use if you intend to use this in the house unless it need to be permanently on so that the blue light is off or it will be located in a place where the blue light will not matter like behind a wall mounted tv then you will find the blue light on this receptacle very bright like a flashlight and very disturbing outside of the above it work perfectly and it is very reliable

Header: once paired it worked fine about 4 month
Review: i had a difficult time pairing this switch with my veralite controller i tried various combination of button press and power cycle for about an hour until it finally paired once paired it worked fine about 4 month the thing i dislike the most is that the flange around the switch is very thick this cause it to protrude out of the outlet box further than a standard switch if you have a double gang box with another switch this one will stick out further and the wall plate will no longer fit correctly you ll need to either figure out a way to recess this switch removing about 0 125 of drywall or bring the standard switch forward with some spacers the later option may result in a gap between the back of the wall plate and the wall itself
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: pros good feel no buzz clear instruction comes with a jumper wire to bring neutral wire to the box simple re usable straight in connector on button restores to the last dim level with soft on ramp off button gradually dims to turn off blue led light can be programmed to be always off or best imho only on when the light is on default blue light is on when the light is off works well with the add on switch cons switch is deep can be hard to fit into the box with all the wiring metal tab on the side need to be broken off to fit next to others in the multi gang box manual doe allow for this you have to wiggle them off with plier no way to quickly reach 100 brightness at switch there is no double tap option for full on the metal face is a bit thicker than most older switch e g lutron which make the switch and mounting screw stick out a small bit 1mm compared to others in the same box barely noticeable and not a problem if you replace all the switch in the same box with these
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have these installed in the house for large appliance that use a lot of power i have receptacle for my tv s my computer monitor my workshop power tool etc the good i love the automation ability i have one of these on my workbench with a separate power strip for regular and one for z wave i can turn on the basement light which will activate this outlet and turn on my monitor my circuit board power my soldering iron and a few other odds and end then if i leave in the middle or forget to turn it off i have it programmed to turn off 20 minute after it turn on walah no more forgetting the soldering iron or leaving a circuit running all night i have my power tool set up with these so the kid can t hurt themselves by turning one on i have all the monitor and amplifier at my wife s venue set up on these so we can turn everything off at night with one switch the bad i ve had zero issue with these the verdict i keep buying them so i think that speaks for itself
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: finally a light switch that look and fit my old designer faceplate and actually work without having to install a module behind the light switch itself some people have said these are large and yes compared to a standard light switch they are but they re the same size a those large toggle switch and more convenient than those zwave module you have to try and cram behind a standard switch which is a herculean feat i bought two to replace a double gang light switch box and at first positioning them on the inside of the faceplate i wa using they did not fit the tab made them too wide the instruction clearly showed me how to bend and remove the little tab and after that they were golden after installing with pigtail so i could see if they would work before i closed it all up this is not my first rodeo so working with live circuit isn t something i d recommend for most people besides it freaking hurt and is the oddest feeling when your finger are pulsating under that momentary electrical contact it s a real wake me up anyways after connecting the load and traveler wire nothing worked so they had to be 3 way switch and jasco is very nice to include a white wire with each unit connected those and both were working great it s a tight fit back into that switch box but not impossible adding them to my veralite wa easy and they work perfectly there is an audible click when you toggle the light on and off and i didn t like that at first but i ve grown used to it now with my iphone and homewave i can control both light with my scene etc it s a real relief to know if i ve left my light on after leaving the house i can turn them off or if i m late coming back home i can turn them on to dissuade any would be burglar out there
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: so there appears to be a lot of miss understanding about the ge z wave dimmer product hope this help model 12725 1000 watt max doesn t require a neutral white wire but only work with the older incandescent light model 12724 600 watt requires a neutral wire but work with all bulb including the newer cfl leds ge ha ha only one type of add on switch 12723 3 4 way for all it s switces which doe require a neutral wire to provide power even when using with 12725 note this is a cheat that i did not totally proper i hooked up the master dimmer 12725 a per diagram but i used a extra wire from the ground to neutral post of the add on grounds and neutral go to the same place in breaker box i wouldn t recommend this for any master dimmer but the add on doesn t handle any high voltage and requires the low power flowing through the neutral ground to power it so far these have worked great i would have liked a little light scale down the side to know of brightness but then that would make them standard out more i really like the little blue light to help you find them in the dark i needed the 12725 because even though my house is newer and ha neutral everywhere they wire 3 4 way switch all crazy different way my kitchen happen to have the line load from the overhead light in the same two wire bundle small note the removable tab on the side are heat sink you can remove them to help fit multiple switch in a box but each time you do you lower the wattage rating remove one side and the 12725 go from 1000 watt to 800 watt remove both side and it drop to 600 watt i heard one person complain about having to wire dimmer master and add on together suggested a more remote type of add on i disagree i chose these ge switch for my 3 way kitchen light because they will continue to work independent of a hub or if the z wave part isn t working just like the great lightolear easysets switch i am replacing
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: first and foremost i have advise for those having installation issue i m not an electrician so more detail instruction would have been helpful i bought this light to replace an existing regular switch for our porch light so i knew the wire were all good my neutral white wire were bundled together and stuck in the back of the switch box i pulled out 1 neutral wire a is shown on the instruction and connected it to the switch turned on the breaker back on and the blue led on the switch lit up but i could not manually switch on the light i wa stumped after a few hour of research via google i finally found the solution you need to keep all the neutral wire in the switch box bundled together and simply add the neutral wire from the switch to the bundle now the light work like a charm i ve successfully paired and am using this switch with our honeywell lynx touch system with z wave module using the total connect app i wa able to program our porch light to come on at sunset and turn off a few hour later if necessary we can still manually switch the light on off a needed awesome switch that i highly recommend for anyone with a z wave controller
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: nice z wave switch for the price

Review: i find the rocker switch mechanism annoying to use additionally the switch doe not respond immediately like a normal switch even when you re pressing on it manually with your hand finally it take about 3 4x the tactile force of the usual wall switch to activate when pressing i prefer the lighter touch of normal switch one very major praise you don t have to recognize current switch state in order to flip it which is easier up is on down is off always both for normal operation and for when you have multiple switch controlling the same light i didn t think of this benefit until writing this review i ll think some more about it but the activation pressure is a significant design flaw

Review: these work well however there are range limitation even in our little home we need to keep our zwave controller within 40 ft of our switch or they can hang and stutter when commanded also if the distance is over 50 ft or so the status read back from the switch can take three to four time longer to be reported properly there is also a noticeable delay between the time you press the switch and when the light actually come on i perceive it to be around 1 3 of a second delay which is just long enough for you to wonder if you need to press it a second time but they have a nice positive feel the is a perceivable click even to the touch when they are pressed the tactile feedback is very welcome we used x10 switch for year although the x10 switch work reliably they had a very spongy cheap feel but these have a solid qualit feel to them

Header: works well very poorly constructed for the price
Review: i bought this from discount home automation a it wa significantly cheaper there am very disappointed with the quality of this switch i m using this with smartthings home automation and here s the plus and minus 1 compatibility 10 10 works perfectly paired out of the box push the switch up to start the pairing process 2 functionality 5 10 for the price it should have other feature which other switch support such a an indicator light which can be programmed via smartthings 3 quality design 2 10 very poor build quality design for the hefty price first of all this is a big switch and take up almost the whole box when using in conjunction with other switch in the same you may run out of space the switch button that stick out is very long much longer than the standard switch it look very odd a long narrowing piece of plastic sticking horizontally out of the plate it s doesn t angle and is perpendicular to the plate it just move 1 mm up down to switch on off also the screw hole for the face plate are poorly constructed a standard size screw didn t fit and got jammed and eventually it snapped off inside the switch while trying to tighten it i expected much better build quality for this price end result it work but i ll switch to another brand a soon other option are available it look very funny sticking out of my face plate link to picture no way to submit http www dropbox com s is55fa4nkvukgbb photo 20feb 2004 2c 209 2024 2015 20am jpg dl 0

Header: switch work and pair easily with smartthings
Review: great switch paired very easily with the hub once it wa within range of it only negative i will say and the reason for 4 star instead of 5 is that while i wa playing with the screw to tighten the grounding wire the screw broke off leaving half in the switch and half that wouldn t screw into anything anymore i managed to push the switch back into the box in a way that pressure wa holding the ground wire in it place but a bit bummed that it broke almost straight out of the box other than that the switch work beautifully and paired with no problem makes a bit of a loud click sound when you turn it on and off via the smartthings app but that is not a serious complaint and is easily overpowered by some background music or conversation will be buying more of these for sure
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: needs a little know how to set up
Review: i wanted to explain a couple of thing to those who plan on self installing i felt pretty confident having done some electrical work in the past i got a little stuck for a moment on this though it can operate a a regular 2 way switch just fine or 3 way or 4 way if desired someone said it cant do 2 way and thats not true it doe require a neutral i knew that going in my house wa wired with them so i purchased with confidence you can check by opening a switch box and checking to see if you find a bundle of white wire tied together if you do then thats your neutral when you go to install youll find black wire bundled together too those are your power wire or live or hot depending on who you ask when you replace a switch youll see that the hot bundle ha a wire going to your switch and another black wire that run out to the light fitting thats called the load remember which is which now when you go to install the new switch youll need to remember the live and the load and install into the new switch a labelled however youll also need to add a neutral and this is where i went wrong i assumed i should unbundle the white neutral from the load and use it when thing didnt work i realized that wa dumb because now my light had no neutral rather than try to figure out which neutral came from the power side and which one came from the light fitting i just added another piece of white wire from some spare romex and that way i knew it would work when plugged in to the switch so i guess a word of caution that youll need a faceplate use the one designed for the bigger switch they fit perfectly but if installing into a dual gang box if you have fan or other switch you could find it hard to identify the right wire to use so take your time use an extra piece of white wire into the neutral bundle if needed if you dont have neutral wire in your box then youll need to either use a different kind of z wave switch which wont work well with led or cfl bulb or youll need to fish some wire down to the wall with a neutral
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i do not actually own this product but be aware these device to not conform to the requirement of the 2017 national electric code section 406 3 3 nonlocking receptacle rated 125 volt 15 and 20 ampere that are controlled by an automatic control device like an energy management system a timer or an occupancy sensor must be marked with the symbol shown below switched receptacle that are controlled by a wall switch and provide one of the required room lighting outlet permitted by 210 70 are not required to have the marking

Header: really enjoy it but can t install in old construction box
Review: the switch work great and is very easy to install given your box are 3 wire i had an issue which i included photo of the box i originally wanted to install this in wa a 2 gang but older metal style the box wa two single box that linked together there wa an indent at top and bottom of the box where the two box come together it wa just enough in the way that the dimmer wouldn t slide in i moved it to another box fixture but i wa definitely disappointed i may get an aeon labs micro controller for the box i originally wanted to install it in i put the switch in a new construction 1 gang box and it fit with room to spare and work wonderfully the wink error out when trying to pair but it actually still pair in the background despite appearing like it failed and work great i use an amazon echo for voice control the dimmer is ever so slightly larger than a regular dimmer but the 3 wire set up with wire nut in the back can make it a little tight depending on the depth of your box

Header: 11 day for free shipping really hard to install at first once installed good switch forget tech support
Review: buy at lowes like i did why wait for 11 day for amazon free shipping please like my review really want people to know the switch work it is just all four wire are needed not three like the old switch and want people to know amazon free shipping is very very long i remember the day of free 3 or 4 day to get item the switch itself is a little confusing to install and ge doe not really explain the difference between the old on off switch and this one very simple and make sense is the unit need power to run the electronics so you need the extra neutral wire that is included and must be added that s the short white wire without that wire the switch ha no power and will not work so add the white wire to neutral the power black wire go to line and the red or black load wire to light go in load ground is always ground and you should be all set tech support to ask about pairing wa a waste of time a they said they don t help with that i guess tech support mean we answer the phone to tell you we can t help a recording would have been the same home depot wa funny too i asked where the z wave switch were and they did not know they carried z wave or what it wa at least the direct z wave support 800 number knew they sold z wave were no help but knew they had a job and it existed the home depot guy wa funnier it paired fine while i spoke to tech support about why they did not know how to pair on the plus side switch paired no problem veraplus controlled one floor away the wire fit perfect in the hole provided and tighten up very easy the ground wire screw is in a bad place a it just barely fit in the wall i did not file down the plastic but that wa an option if needed another reviewer commented the switch stick out not sure what they expect from an electronic switch it need to tootle up or down depending on it state make perfect sense as to the unit is larger than the simple on off switch well it is a power computer in there maybe one day they will be smaller but really what do you expect as to build quality it is fine except for the placement of the ground screw the quality is fine as to little blue light they are a plus or minus my old swich wa not lighted so not a big deal would like to have it and be able to turn it off my wife doe not light lighted switch it s a personal choice i lie them she doe not only on basement light ha a lighted switch it is my basement the rest of the house is hers so no lighted switch need one more switch and will but this again the second time should be a breeze might even try a three switch hall light well maybe next year after i rest up from the first one i ordered three z wave item got tired after five day that amazon did not ship yet so between home depot and lowes got an outlet and switch home depot outlet installed just like the non z wave outlet it replaced and worked right away next day i did the switch from lowes had a little trouble because of the wire that i did not understand the first day got it all figured out the second day so now two day of everything working tomorrow amazon will deliver my order 11 day after i ordered much easier to stop at home depot or lowes for z wave will order from amazon le and le a they streach free shipping to 7 day hold then ship trying to force prime on me between netflix comcast and fios not sure i need more channel the prime shipping is great but to try and stall shipping to force it is just driving me to other web site or to stop at a store
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: i have not yet used the z wave capability of these switch yet i will update this review after i have i had some concern about their operation prior to purchase so i would like to share information i wa unable to find elsewhere the switch give a satisfying click when pushed up or down a quick click up is on a quick click down is off they default to a fade in and out of around 1 2 second they turn on to the same dim level at which they were previously turned off holding the switch up from an off position will fade up from off until released the add on switch act just like the dimmer it is connected to the fade and dim is a little choppy there are noticable level on the way up and down but not enough to annoy me they dim my philips warm glow led bulb a19 b30 and wide base candelabra down to almost nothing they will not turn my light back on at a very low dim level and must be dimmed back up from off when at a low dim level overall so far very satisfied with these dimmer

Review: i love this z wave power receptacle there are two outlet but only one is z wave controlled the other is always on i have mostly purchased leviton but this one is way more cost effective and ha a nice button and blue light on it to let you manually turn on the one z wave controlled outlet there is a blue light that is on when the z wave outlet is off this light is quite bright it can almost be used a a night light i have taken to covering it up with a little white sticker to dim it since one of these are right next to my bed i have found it to be very easy to install and the most functional power receptacle on the market good job ge
