Header: great regular ui switch for your smarter home
Review: i had competing goal for my automation project 1 be able to control certain light from outside the house over the internet a well a automating certain process light on upon arrival etc 2 have an a near a possible old school experience for people using the physical switch inside the house this review deal only with the second goal since the first goal is accomplished with the brain of the system the hub smartthings in my case a far a a switch go this is great it work just a expected a a rocker switch except that it is actually a momentary switch meaning that it doe not stay in the position that you put it in but return to it neutral position at all time this is actually great for 3 way application a you always hit the upper paddle to turn it on and the lower one to turn it off unlike with a regular 3 way switch in which the paddle you have to hit depends on the status of the other switch this and the linear brand of switch are the only one i have found that appear to have this configuration and a this is the norm we re all used to this is great since i don t have to explain to my in law how to work the switch in my house the tactile click feedback is perfect it feel just like a regular decora style switch so no one should be confused by it there is almost no delay between hitting the light switch and having the light come on and this is with led bulb which are sometimes finicky to begin with there is a barely audible click of the relay when the switch is triggered either locally or remotely so if you are a light sleeper perhaps don t stick it near your bed if you expect it to be triggered on off remotely while you sleep installation wa a breeze that is assuming you can install a regular light switch it s actually easier to install in a 3 way configuration because you don t need to worry about common terminal just one traveler wire between the two switch installation doe require a neutral not ground wire inside your junction box but it is incredibly rare to have power through light configuration that do not send the neutral down to the switch from the light don t know what you d have to do in one of those case a i haven t run into it yet
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: the ge jasco zwave plus line of smart home product show why ge jasco is truly an industry leader this fan switch is an evolutionary product compared to the regular zwave option with improved speed range and processing power the fan switch act like a dimmer holding up or down to go to any of the 3 speed level we couldn t find a way to turn off blue led completely however with a quick google search tapping the on button 3 time then the off button once will do the trick to toggle on when off or off when on it would be great if the zwave command parameter 3 byte 1 value 3 would work but no luck and that s litterly the only thing we found an issue with that being said this is hand down the best option for zwave plus fan switch out there sleek and clean and additional available color in faceplate to match any decore style we tested with wink smarthings and vera and setup and use wa fun and easy see attached photo of how the interface work in samsung smartthings zwave plus is litterly so fast with this product that press on the app would turn on before your figure left the screen an important note this switch cannot control light on a fan like the unreleased zigbee remote and module from hunter bay can however since our fan didn t have light this wa truly a beautiful fit the ge jasco zwave plus line of decora style rocker dimmer and switch blend in to any home or business cleanly and simply we experienced no problem or issue with usability or operation in the below photo we used a lutron claro wall plate for extra clean line and simplicity if you just getting into smart home this is a great start any of the ge jasco zwave plus product or zigbee product work extremely well on all platform and standardize on a non proprietary industry wireless mesh standard works perfectly it s stylish functional and top quality all the way
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Review: quick review if you re converting your light switch to z wave controlled one but want to use fluorescent bulb this is the answer installation is easy a long a you know a little bit about electrical wiring otherwise it might be a little more difficult for you get them for around 40 here on amazon full review i decided to start switching over my home to use z wave for home automation and needed to find light switch to use around my house after reading some of the review for the dimmer version of this switch i opted to go for these to convert my home i already have fluorescent light bulb for almost every light fixture and being able to dim most of the light wa not a priority for me this product the same a the one included in the 3 way package ge 45614 z wave 3 way on off switch kit which includes an auxiliary switch ge 45610 so that you can have it control a 3 way or 4 way you ll need another aux switch circuit i used these instead of the ge 45606 z wave technology 2 way dimmer switch due to the fact almost every single light in my house is florescent to wire in the switch you need to have ground neutral line hot and load to the light in the electrical box now you should be able to check your wiring and verify you have all the needed wire before tearing everything apart for me all the neutral wire were bound together capped off and shoved to the back of the box i have installed a total of 5 of these now the first one took about 20min the next one went a lot faster and installed in about 10min or le quick hint mark the wire a you take them off the switch check and double check you re hooking up the correct wire to the correct spot on the switch you ll feel stupid having to undo it all when you mix up the line and load wire if you have 2 or more of these installed next to one another you ll need to break off the tab on the side so they can fit close enough together to put the decorative plate over them only break off the one you need to get them to fit for double and triple gang installation i just daisy chained the neutral same with the hot line because it wa just easier than pulling out the whole bundle for me no idea if this follows local wiring code but it s working just fine other thoughts the blue led isn t extremely bright and doesn t bother me by default it is on when the switch if off and off when the switch is on it can help someone unfamiliar with the light switch location to find it in the dark if you have an advanced remote you can switch it so the led is on when the switch is on you can also install the switch upside down and flip it to the correct way using an advanced remote i haven t tested either of these because the default is what i needed i have paired these switch to a couple different type of remote and it ha worked fine with all of them a go control panel one of the basic ge remote and a intermatic ha 07 remote hurray for interoperability you can hear the relay in the switch click when your turn it on and off not really a big deal because my old switch clicked when i flipped them on and off i think you might notice it a lot more if you use the remote to turn the light on and off i ve gotten used to it and barely even notice it anymore these take up a lot more space in the electrical box but i didn t have any issue with not being able to get them to fit properly
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: i wish i could put them in my whole house
Review: i recently added the ge z wave wireless lighting control switch dimmer to my smart home collection and they have both been a great addition to the system i first got the switch because i wanted to control my outside light every night before i went to bed i would always have to go down and make sure the light were such off most of the time i would forget and they were left on all night now i don t even think about it because they are set up on my smartthings system to automatically come on when the sun set and automatically shut off at a specific time then i got the dimmer switch to control my family room light sometimes when we watch movie we like to have a little bit of light but most of the time we like them off well now we can do both and what make it better is we can speak to alexa and say turn the family room light to 30 or turn the family room light off and we don t have to run over to the switch to do it the connection between smartthings and the echo allow u to use voice command to control them just in case the light get left on through smartthings i have them automatically shut off so they don t get left on i really like the switch and they have been a great addition to my smart home i decided to go with the ge version because 1 they could be mounted on my wall and look like all the other switch that i have in my house 2 they could be used by the smartthings system but i could also manually turn them on and off 3 because they were the cheapest i would love to put these in my whole house but the price isn t where in need to be to get widely adopted i hope that change soon with all the smart home stuff being so new the price point are still a little too high for the value it provides as for the installation it wa fairly easy i did run into some problem with the neutral wire that you need to connect because the instruction were not all that clear on it i watched a couple of the install video that i found online and then i wa able to quickly get them set up and working because the product is bulkier than a normal switch i do have a problem with getting the face plate flush with the wall i either need to adjust the box in the wall so it sits back a little more or find a faceplate that can cover the gap that the switch ha made not a big deal but just a pesky little thing that i think about every time i manually use the switch getting the switched paired to the smartthings system wa simple all you need to do is go the connect new device and they get instantly recognized and let you go through the setup process overall great product and would recommend it for any smart home user
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: can t use manual on off to wireslessly switch a lightbulb using wink hub installation issues
Review: i wanted to use this wall switch to wirelessly turn on off an led lightbulb located elsewhere in my house without running a lot of wire from the switch to the bulb the command chain should have been push wall switch switch sends signal via z wave to wink hub wink hub sends signal to ge link led bulb to turn on sounds easy right here s the issue the switch doe not send a signal to the wink hub when it is manually turned on or off the documentation doe not make this clear apparently the lutron caseta switch will do this so i m trying this next the second issue is that the wiring of this product without a neutral requires an incandescent bulb to be plugged in at all times what did you read that right yes you did here s why the switch draw a little bit of power if you have an old house like mine power go to your wall outlet then the hot 120 v wire of your outlet run to the switch the old manual switch simply connect and disconnect this hot wire however a new switch like the jasco requires a hot wire and a neutral so that current can flow from hot through the jasco to the neutral and power the z wave function of the switch if there s not neutral where doe the current flow well the people at jasco want the current to flow from the hot through the jasco switch through an incandescent bulb and into neutral probably not the greatest design this is a problem with all switch which require power there are several bad alternative to this wiring scheme so this remains an open problem to be solved
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Duplex Receptacle Outlet, On/Off, In-Wall, White, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12721

Header: false advertising zwave does not simulate x 10 function
Review: most material found on line implies that this socket is a better more advanced replacement for the x 10 group socket the reader of this material is left to infer that replacing the x 10 socket with a zwave socket and simultaneously replacing an x 10 wall switch with a zwave wall switch will allow the user to control the socket with the switch nothing could be further from the truth if you re considering updating your old x 10 system with a new zwave system and expect to obtain the same result please read all available material very carefully before proceeding

Review: honestly i can t speak to the z wave programming much since i use the most basic of aspect on off schedule but so far this wa the easiest one to include in my wink hub 2 first off i m far from an electrical expert i lucked out that the previous electrician labeled the cable in the old timer making swapping out a million time easier now your set up may vary but from the sprinkler pump came 2 cable only for me both are load since it is a 230 v motor this timer handle up to 240 v i m not sure if it matter which is load 1 or load 2 but they attach to terminal 5 and 6 when doing a single pole setup in other word only 1 item is being attached this timer supposedly can handle 2 thing being attached though this is where the one and only issue with this service came up the diagram show load 1 go to terminal 6 and load 2 to terminal 4 the 120 v setup also show the load going to terminal 6 this tell me that terminal 6 is the main load bearing terminal yet the written instruction for 240 v single pole have the load wire connecting in reverse load 1 to terminal 4 and load 2 to terminal 6 this confused me quite a deal but then i thought aren t sprinkler pump dc connection if so then it shouldn t matter which lot go to which since there is no positive note negative polarity long story short i test ran out before screwing the box to the wall and the pump turned on i followed the diagram so proof following diagram for sprinkler pump work the line cable attach to terminal 1 and 2 ground go to the ground screw on bottom center i did find this an odd location since the old mechanical timer ha the ground physically attached to the mechanism part of me doesn t fully believe the timer mechanism of this service is sufficiently grounded based on the design of the old one i m also slightly concerned about a lack of ground to the motor itself this isn t an issue with this item more like i m assuming the previous electrician may have cut it off now if you followed the terminal you ll notice i have used terminal 1 2 4 and 6 terminals 3 and 5 get connected using a jumper cable that isn t included i got lucky that i had some good electrical cable hanging around since we were remodeling if not i d have to buy a spool just for about 4 inch of wire it recommended to use the same type of wire used within wall i believe 16 gauge solid copper for the jumper i had some 16 gauge stranded copper wire but the package clearly state low voltage use only i d say a 240 v application is far from low voltage pairing depends on your z wave setup since i have wink there is no official compatibility for this device wink see it a a light switch i have emailed them a recommendation to add this device a a new category for heavy application either way it wa included faster than any of the other switch i have the day of writing this review wa also the second time the schedule ran i need to be out the door by the second zone being active i woke up to the motor running this is final proof that wink is communicating the schedule to this device and it turn on and off accordingly funny final note i feel this look like a very fat antique cell phone once you attach the antenna
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: works fine with z wave doesn t pair with z wave plus
Review: the switch work fine with a regular z wave controller such a the aeon labs zstick 2e it ha pretty good range and is the only module i could find that s enclosed for use outdoors while it s designed to be used outdoors you must use it in a location that s protected from the element it s not designed to be put on the ground and get rained on for example however when i upgraded to a zwave plus controller the aeon labs zstick plus the switch won t pair with z wave plus and neither will the other ge module i have a wall socket aeon labs tell me that it s using an old version of z wave but i can t upgrade the firmware so i m stuck having two network one regular and one plus if i want to use the ge module i ll be replacing the module with something that s compatible with z wave plus

Header: works like a champ integrated seamlessly with existing vivint alarm system
Review: first off this is cheaper than the standard indoor z wave small appliance outlet the only difference beyond the outdoor better seal characteristic is that this unit doesn t have a variable output dimming feature which is fine since we ve never utilized this function once unpackaged i plugged it into an open ac outlet and went to the alarm system control panel and told it i wanted to add a switch as soon a the link button on the module wa pressed the control panel immediately beeped and recognized the new device that wa it the remote outlet wa ready to be moved to it permanent location and because it s recognized by the alarm system it can be controlled and automated like any other device a if it were part of the original setup two of the great selling point of z wave device 1 i haven t found one that is incompatible with our existing network and 2 the z wave network is bidirectional a wireless 802 11a b g n network range is limited by the router s transmission radius but z wave us each component a a repeater the control panel is not a limiting factor because each device can relay communication from any other device a long a one of them in the chain is close enough to link with the control panel for the sake of full disclosure we re not using this outside and cannot attest to how it stand up to the element but since it work so well we may be getting a couple more for some project idea and i ll let you know how they work out if that come to be feel free to submit any question or comment and i ll definitely try to help cheers
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: the power cord connects to the complete opposite end of the unit creating a horizontal s of sort on your wall and a pretty seri
Review: things you should know before purchasing from the manual important this unit is suitable for outdoor use in damp location do not expose to rain or immerise sic in water install at least 3ft above ground level with the receptacle pointed down when used outdoors you should plug the unit into a gfci receptacle with a receptacle cover rated for outdoor use note plug switch directly into outlet do not use with extension cord the cord come straight down from the plug it is not at an angle and doe not rotate the power cord connects to the complete opposite end of the unit creating a horizontal s of sort on your wall and a pretty serious length limitation considering the unit ha to be at least 3ft above ground level and pointed down and you aren t supposed to use it with extension cord it s functional but not an exceptional design by any stretch 3 star to pair with wink hub from wink support launch the wink app android in my case go to home screen go to hubs click 3 dot in upper right corner click your hub click z wave controls click exclusion mode light on hub should blink blue press the switch light on hub should go to green then solid blue click inclusion mode light on hub should blink blue press the switch light on hub should go to green then solid blue it worked for me after that the wink rep wa very helpful and knew exactly what to do but a quick google and browse of their website and i still can t find these instruction if someone else find them please post a link wink seems to be deliberately steering towards partner product by deliberately burying the process to do manual addition of generic zwave product i home oomi doesn t follow the same path
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i just got started with home automation and this wa the first device that i purchased to test out if i wanted to invest in more device sure enough i m now hooked pros 1 it ha 2 outlet on the side of the device since the device measure 4 inch wide and 1 1 2 inch deep having the plug on the side of the device minimizes the depth of the device 2 it ha one outlet that is controlled by z wave and a separate outlet on the other side that is always on i e not controlled by z wave this always on outlet mean that you don t lose access to an outlet just because the device is plugged in very cleaver design 3 the device ha a button on the front of the device which is used to a pair the device with a controller and b turn the z wave outlet on off the on off function is handy when you are close to the device and not a controller and want to use the light appliance that is connected to the z wave outlet 4 the device pair well and easily with the ge controller which is very inexpensive through amazon and mi casa verde vera lite controller also available through amazon and other distributor when the device is paired with the vera lite it can be controlled by computer phone tablet etc items to consider i don t want to call these con because these item are not a problem for me but may be a concern to others 1 the device measure about 4 inch wide and 1 1 2 inch deep you should measure your space before purchasing if you think it will be problematic however from what i have read the size of the device help with the z wave mesh network and provides stronger signal boost compared to permanently installed receptacle outlet so the size is actually a benefit to the system 2 there is a noticeable click sound when the z wave outlet is activated on or off the sound is present when the outlet is activated with the button on the front of the device or through an app but it is only present when turning on off the outlet and not at any other time it isn t super loud but it is noticeable kind of like a soft finger snap sound
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: built well and work well w my z wave system
Review: my micasavera system wa very easy to add this unit in to i use it to control a bug zapper flowtron bk 15d electronic insect killer 1 2 acre coverage so it only go on at dusk and off in the am though it s certainly not cheap at around 50 it is something you can hold in your hand and recognize ok this is built well the grounded plug is able to be plugged into my in use covered gfci and not block the outlet or the reset button and the female receptacle seems well engineered in it slightly recessed location and the rubber flap to cover it when not using it though i don t know why you d have the z wave adapter plugged in is also well made there are strain relief built into the cord at both the male plug end and the z wave adapter end anecdotally however this thing is engineered it also rarely if ever trip the very sensitive gfci i have it plugged into whereas plugging in or turning on certain thing that are plugged into this outlet often trip it my outlet itself might be slowly failing but i thought it s worth mentioning that if you re reluctant to put a switch on an outdoor load plugged into a gfci thinking that adding more hard switch on off to that gfci in the form of a z wave adapter would be a bad idea it ha been smooth sailing for me with this one
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: worked perfectly with raspberry pi razberry
Review: i bought this to go with my raspberry pi and razberry the razberry allows easy control of z wave device via a raspberry pi this z wave device worked well straight out the box so far i m very pleased with this product note this is defined a a binary switch device command_class_switch_binary 0x25 so in order to say turn the device on off via razberry and assuming the node id of this is 2 type the following into your browser on http 192 168 1 7 8083 zwaveapi run device 2 instance 0 commandclasses 0x25 set 255 off http 192 168 1 7 8083 zwaveapi run device 2 instance 0 commandclasses 0x25 set 0 where http 192 168 1 7 is the url of my raspberry pi

Review: i got this to work with my revolv home automation hub and found that it doesn t work well because a the range on z wave device is quite bad and b they work better with mutiple z wave device this is outside on my patio one story and about 10 foot from my insteon hub and only work sporadically 1 out of 10 time at best revolv support say it is a known issue that the exterior wall of your home will diminish the z wave signal a lot based on the way those wall are typically constructed according to a chart included in one of ge s instruction manual the range can be a little a 21 foot if the exterior wall are constructed of brick tile or concrete since you already have a few insteon device in your home and insteon communicates both via radio and through your home s electrical wiring it may be best to pick up one of these for outdoor use insteon 2634 222 on off dual band outdoor module if you d like to stick with z wave device then i recommend adding at least 2 more z wave device to your system so that the signal can be repeated via multiple path to your outdoor module you ll also want to place one of those device within 20 to 30 ft of your outdoor module for best performance also make sure the z wave device are not battery powered or else they won t relay the signal so if you are looking to use this with revolv especially keep all this in mind
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: great if you have a smart home and need outside control
Review: last year at christmas i have a dusk dawn timer with hour to keep on it had a remote that i could turn on off from house if needed this year i added some more light and since i have a smartthings control and alexa i decided to try these ge z wave outdoor light i used two of them i started with one on each side of the house with the older dusk dawn time in middle my smartthings is located in the house near the right side the ge outlet on the right worked fine it also on the wall of my master bedroom where i have two zwave switch which help spread the z wave signal the one on the loft side of the house only turned off at night but wouldn t turn on the next day i figure the signal is weak but like listening to radio late at night the night signal carried no worry i switched the left ge zwave with the dumber dawn dusk outlet and everything worked i set up automation in the smartthings app for dusk 6 hour with match the dumer dawn dusk outlet i m not sure what the smartthings app us for dusk but it came on about half hour after the dawn dusk light with us a sensor overall i wa happy and didn t need worry about my light and they were always on when i came home which wa nice
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i bought three of the z wave wireless lighting controllers to be able to bind my porch pool and garden lighting into the wink hub available at amazon unfortunately there wa no description at all in the product manual on how to program the iphone wink hub app for it after trying several setting i found out that setting it up wa very easy on the wink app for the iphone follow these step 1 connect your ge controller near the wink hub to a power outlet 2 on your iphone bring up your wink app 3 select add device 4 scroll down on the device list to lights and tap on it 5 scroll down on the 2nd list to zwave switch and tap on it 6 tap 3 time next until you see a green connect now button 7 press the 1 small button on your ge controller 8 tap the green next and the wink hub go into find and install mode 9 about a few second after the wink hub went into device setup mode the new z wave switch should show up a new device on your iphone it really couldn t be much easier now all outdoor ge z wave wireless controllers are properly setup with a few step additional step you can program automatic on and off cycle in your wink app now my garden pool and porch are automatically lit every day
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i have tried other z wave module from a other source but this brand sure look like a winner i have had reliability problem with the other brand including infant mortality failure and failure after 1 2 year of operation this brand seems to be much more reliable important you have to delete all of the module from the network of the old controller remove the pairing before attempting to pair it with a new controller if you don t you will find that the module will not respond i have never seen anyone mention this critical requirement note after several year of trial and error testing i found that the intermatic or wayne dalton controller are the source of most of the cause of module failure use the ge 45601 controller

Header: flawless control for my outdoor greenhouse
Review: i picked up this module to add to my smartthings z wave network right now they are controlling the lighting and heating in my outdoor greenhouse the module easily paired with my hub and the integration with the smartapps and alexa wa easy i like that the button on the front turn the switched outlet on and off so i don t always have to have my phone with me while in the greenhouse to activate the light or heater as someone mentioned they are a bit beefy so that after plugging them on on a normal power strip you ll lose at least 2 3 outlet on that strip because the module s size will cover the nearby outlet i ve used both the smartthings outlet and now this one from ge and i prefer this because of the manual on off and dual outlet feature pros rapid response to hub command button for manual on off control easy integration with smartthings and alexa works a a z wave repeater and can be used to strengthen your z wave network connectivity two outlet one controllable via smart hub smartthings alexa iris etc and one always on can hear an slight audible click when switched on which give me a positive confirmation that my hub properly communicated with the module cons rather beefy when plugged into a wall outlet it shouldn t cover the bottom outlet but can block outlet on a crowded power strip

Header: finally how to add to your wink hub
Review: love these took me forever to figure out how to get this product to connect to our wink hub a this product is not recognized a a supported wink product if you need to connect to your wink hub do this 1 plug your ge z waze control into an outlet near your wink hub need to be within probably 6 foot of the hub this is just to connect it to your hub a you can move he control switch later to where you want to use it 2 go into your wink app on your phone 3 click on your wink hub in your list of product 4 click on the gear button at the top right hand corner to open setting 5 click on your wink hub under setting 6 scroll down until you see settings in the middle and click on z wave 7 click on z wave 8 click on the inclusion mode 9 look to see that your wink hub is flashing 10 double click on the center button on your ge z wave control switch until you hear it click don t hold down the switch keep clicking on it until you hear a slight pop sound 11 watch your wink hub a it flash green and then go back to solid blue light 12 you should be good to go and can now see your switch now in your wink hub app a lights power 13 unplug your switch and move it to the appliance lamp that you want to use 14 hold down on the lightbulb when you open up the lights power so that you can edit the name of your appliance for example we named one lamp living room couch lamp hope this help i invested many hour in figuring out how to do this through wink all of our control work great and are quick to click on and off even when far away from home love it

Header: this item would not pair with smartthings hub a claimed
Review: this item would not pair with smartthings hub a claimed on listing i tried multiple time and multiple way i even called ge tech support if you can call it that i could hear the rep typing in the question and then she dutifully regurgitated back the script on her screen told me to just push the button and then she pointed the finger at samsung now whenever tech support point finger they re only pointing it at their own incompetence this item wa returned just a note i replaced this order with a smartthings outlet which paired immediately and without issue guess it wasn t the hub eh have a household full of device all of which connected to this hub without issue just not this ge outlet there are numerous comment on this item not pairing with smartthings i thought i d give it a try anyway i just confirmed what many others have experienced evidently some others have made it work but i along with many could not the smartthings outlet cost a few buck more that s why i tried this ge outlet but the experience say the few buck more are worth it another entry in the you get what you pay for archive save yourself the opportunity for the inconvenience don t buy this outlet

Review: but saying that i have had some problem with these outdoor module i have 3 of them and two have exhibited problem one wa doa out of the package nothing worked including manually one quit after about a year can t turn it off wirelessly but everything else work i am using six ge plug in appliance and lamp module and they are all working fine so far about intermatic or wayne dalton unit i have experienced nearly a 50 failure rate on all of the intermatic and wayne dalton module after 2 year the failure have been total rf transceiver failure no communication at all will not turn off wirelessly or will not turn on wirelessly the one that manage to get past the initial 1 2 year of use usually keep working however i even installed a whole house surge suppressor no improvement naturally they quit after all warranty are long gone that s why i have been changing over to ge a the others die hoping for better reliability but now i am begining to wonder if all version of these module might have issue i have a couple of the light switch dimmer module the one that replace 2 or 3 way wall switch they are brand other than intermatic or wayne dalton and have had no issue what s interesting is that the intermatic controller appear to work fine i have one that s nearly 8 year old that still work great however the ge controller is easier to program and use addendum 11 23 2012 the second ge 45604 unit is now not usable i can t turn it on wirelessly only off note the addendum below addendum 3 31 2013 fortunately i did not toss any of the defective unit instead i used the ge 45601 remote control and all but one of the bad unit worked it would seem that 90 of my problem were the controller and not the module so i strongly recommend not using the intermatic controller but use the ge important you have to delete all of the module from the network of the old controller remove the pairing before attempting to pair it with a new controller if you don t you will find that the module will not respond i have never seen anyone mention this critical requirement note the ge instruction are not 100 perfect when setting the on off time for group make sure that when you select the correct group that you want to program since it default to group 1 they do not mention anything about this

Header: appliance module 2x aeon labs dsc06106 zwus z wave smart energy switch
Review: mi casa verde veralite 2x ge 45603 z wave technology wireless lighting control fluorescent light appliance module 2x aeon labs dsc06106 zwus z wave smart energy switch 12 12 14 first impressions and info that wasn t immediately obvious veralite 4 stars install instruction were poor unit required an update but then then ha worked well so far accompanying android vera u17 app seems a little flaky but an off on reset seems to resolve app permission appear to make sense within google s broad sweeping category aeon device set up easily a specifically listed in gui ge device not listed and were added a generic device options for blanket instruction based on being home away night vacation scenario such a turn on or off at give time day were easily set up energy monitoring option require sharing data with a 3rd party did not read or accept their privacy policy so that functionality is disabled guessing system requires contact with the mothership so is perhaps constantly reliant on mi casa verde company server if anyone can clarify detail on that point it would be helpful thanks would buy again ge 45603 4 stars works a described switches don t have an led indicator one controlled outlet and one pas through as set up they do not report current being used when switch is on but i didn t see that indicated a a feature if it s possible to set up within veralite software i d welcome some instruction thanks two year warranty which suggests they stand by the product assuming warranty procedure is reasonable and low cost process would buy again aeon labs dsc06106 zwus 2 star works a described switches have an led indicator built into toggle switch they report current load in the android app and veralite web interface when turned on this is a nice feature reporting that the switch is on and that the connected appliance is also functioning design improves accesibility relative to ge wall wart only 3 month warranty that doesn t suggest confidence in their build quality hence 2 star would not have bought had i known in advance with a more respectable warranty would have been 5 star will update with any device reliability issue
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: easy setup convenient pas thru outlet
Review: i got one of these with my adt alarm system and then decided to buy more so now i have 6 of them on several different thing in the past i had a leviton z wave system and it wa difficult to set up over the course of a few year one by one the lamp module all blew up literally as in spark smoke loud pop and an ever increasing dis trust of the system leviton customer support wa very quick to tell me that it wa too bad they had none left and they had long since stopped selling them to my interpretation that mean they knew there wa a problem and never did anything about it glad none of them caught fire so the appliance module the one that do not dim but rather just turn off and on with a physical relay those have all been fine and the original leviton one are still chugging away with no problem so i thought i ll get some more of those appliance one since they don t have the dimming circuit that explode the ge one are very nice because they have the added feature of an always on passthru outlet the right side plug is always on the left side outlet is controlled by the switch this serf a couple purpose first these device are bigger than a single outlet on the wall so they block the other outlet on the plate so the passthru is helpful to regain that lost outlet second both outlet face to the side so you don t get kinked cord third the manual activation learn button is recessed on the face so if you push furniture up against it it doesn t press the button it would however be nicer if the learn button wa on the top of the unit so that you could reach over the back of a couch or behind something and press it on the rare ocassion you might need to setup wa super easy it detected right away so far these unit seem reliable however it might take a year or 2 of use to determine if they are going to go the way of the leviton garbage one

Header: not the range i hoped for
Review: i use this with the intermatic ha07 remote control to turn the pool pump on and off at a given time of the day since they are the only two z wave device i have i don t know which is the culprit but i don t get anywhere the range i should with these two unit they are separated by 38 foot and the control is very unreliable i have the ge controller in a piece of plastic sewer pipe to keep it from getting rained on so the control is vertical the way it wa meant to be mounted i have noticed that when the pipe get knocked down and becomes horizontal that the control seems to improve leading me to believe there is an issue with the polarization of the antenna in each of the unit you can imagine the antenna in this controller is horizontal by laying that ge controller down it may be that the controller s antenna becomes horizontal putting them in the same plane

Header: awesome plug and play but outlet is turned and not usuable by some device
Review: these are smaller than i expected which is nice they are very easy to install as close to plug and play a a z wave device could ever be i like the easy push button on the front a well the only thing i ve found that i don t like about it so far is that the outlet s are turned inward to wall so any plug of size won t plug into the device i had to can appliance module and swap to wall outlet in some location which i didn t originally want to do i find it odd that they use this configuration for the outlet of course in america 99 of all outlet are installed upside down anyways the 3rd prong a we call it is supposed to be on the up side of the outlet this is so that if something isn t plugged all the way in and something fell on it it won t energize the item this could also be said for this module why is the 3 prong inward and not outward to reduce risk of shock

Header: great appliance module not a dimmer
Review: if you re looking for a z wave device that will help you improve the reliability of communication with a z wave lock such a the kwikset or schlage lock this is by far the best device to go with it work great in this capacity is very easy to install and connect to your network and ha a pretty smart design that keep you from losing use of an outlet a many plug in module tend to it support beaming unlike some older z wave device which is a must to interface with z wave lock however a another reviewer noted this is not a dimmer it s designed for fluorescent light motor appliance and other load that will be either on or off and won t be dimmed the device report itself a a z wave switch binary not z wave switch multilevel or z wave dimmer switch a it would if it wa a dimmer i ve used this to turn light on and off a well a to control the operation of an air filter whose motor didn t run well at all when plugged up to a dimmer module adding the module to your z wave network couldn t be easier put your controller in add mode and then tap the button on the front which also serf a a manual on off switch for the z wave controlled outlet this module includes 2 outlet one on each side one is always on and the other is controlled by z wave if you plug it into the top outlet in a 2 outlet block you can still easily plug in a lamp or other device on the other outlet underneath it so this module can actually give you 3 outlet where you previously had 2 unlike other module that turn your 2 outlet block into basically just 1 usable outlet

Header: epic fail in le than a year
Review: update january 2014 the original unit failed after le than a year i will test the 2 year warranty by sending it back so i bought another last week because the review still are so good for this device fail the new unit wa doa i am done with this brand of z wave almost all of the original intermatic homesettings module i installed 7 year ago are still going strong so this performance is not the norm for z wave original review i gave it 4 star i ve added this controller to my homeseer 3 z wave system and it is working great i had used intermatic homesettings module but they are hard to find now the deduction of a star is because of the shape and configuration of this module the manual on off button is not reachable when the unit is located behind a piece of furniture and the wider size mean it stick out more beyond the faceplate of the receptacle the intermatic unit were exactly the size of a faceplate and the button on top is more accessible for manual operation despite the limitation this module is a good value and work very well but consider the location you will use it in before buying

Review: excellent pool pump switch i ve got mine programmed with samsung smartthings hub and it work great i also really like that the pump can be manually switched without having to open the case just push the big grey button there are no programming instruction provided so i had to figure that out on my own i used the smart lighting app that is included with the samsung smartthings hub to program go to automation then smartapps tap add a smartapp then tap lights switches then tap smart lights and follow the instruction i ve posted a couple picture that show the setting i ve used this switch wa also helpful in determining what ha causing huge electric bill in our house surprisingly it s not the pool pump the energy monitoring feature of this switch is mostly a novelty but interesting none the le i bought initially because i thought it d be a fun novelty to be able to turn the pump on with alexa but it really much more useful than that i can control and or reprogram the run time of the pump from anywhere perfect example is that i recently had to run the pump for 24 hour after adding chemical i manually started the pump on a thursday evening and went out of town the following morning but forgot to turn off the timer so the pump shut off a scheduled at noon friday 6 hour shy of 24 hour i wa able to turn the pump back on 200 mile away and complete the 24 hour cycle i never would have been able to do this without this switch the only issue i initially had wa signal range due to the placement of my hub and pump approximately 50 foot apart with several interior wall a brick fireplace and two stone wall the way i imagine this isn t a common issue but if it happens to you i solved the problem by buying a z wave dimmer to control my patio light mid way between my hub and this switch and that solved the problem all z wave product act a a signal repeater so the patio dimmer bridged the gap between my hub and pool pump and i got really cool patio lighting
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i bought the intermatic ha04c and the ge45604 z wave outdoor module because they were the same price and i needed two to reach the pump i wanted to control my intention wa to use one halfway to relay the signal to the other one controlling the pump the ge unit ha a well built rubber cap that completely protects the outlet when nothing is plugged in if your intention is to leave this unit outside all year when nothing is plugged in then this ge is the hand down best choice the intermatic ha an exposed outlet with no cover the nice feature on the intermatic though is a light to indicate power to the outlet the ge module ha no such indication both module have a button on the face to manually turn the outlet on and off the button on the ge is slightly recessed and and a little harder to press i tested the range on both unit using an extension cord measuring the distance that the z wave signal worked reliably with no retries the intermatic s range wa 64 and the ge s range wa 74 or 90 depending on orientation the ge module range is 16 further if the power cord on the unit is facing the z wave signal source which in my case is a vera lite i also have the aeon labs indoor smart energy switch which i brought outside and established it range wa 95 all three of these switch were very easy to pair with the vera and work well in my home automation application i subtract one star from the ge 45604 otherwise flawless performance due to it not having a light to indicate power to the outlet a power button that is slightly difficult to work manually and concern of rain shorting the circuit while an appliance is plugged into it i have to believe there is a boot that could water proof the outlet when the appliance is in use otherwise the ge work well ha superior range and seal up nicely when nothing is plugged in making it ideal for an outside signal relay at this point i am inclined to stick with ge outdoor module on my future purchase
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: great addition to the adt pulse
Review: this product is great it wa very easy to add to my adt pulse and is very versatile i bought two of them when they were a little cheaper i keep one programmed to turn on a table lamp every night just around sunset i have them both programmed to randomly turn on off light when i travel and turn on light in the event of a general alarm or a fire alarm the unit ha two outlet on it and it only cover one outlet on the wall plate when plugging it in one outlet is the programmed side and the other is a constant open so plugging it in to your wall give you three available outlet all programming is done through the adt pulse website and there are a variety of option for day time and event for the unit to turn on off i can turn the unit on off through the website my phone or the push button finally the programming doe not just toggle the switch it recognizes if the unit is on or off so if you turn it on manually at 6 45 and it is set to turn on 7 00 the pulse will not send a toggle command it recognizes it is on and there is no change nice feature great product far more reliable than the store bought power timer
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: fantastic pool switch for any smart home
Review: what this device offer a clean simple box to control multiple 120v or 240v device an interface with your smart home device which can allow remote control from anywhere i have it connected with wink which allows me to turn the pool on or off with my voice and ha a schedule that will turn the system on and off automatically every day peace of mind knowing your pool isn t using electricity when it doesn t have to this device is worth every penny it took me about 4 hour including a couple trip to the hardware store to get some wiring part i forgot to set it up including taking down the electrical box it replaced but now i can fully automate my outdoor pool pump and salt chlorination system with one device i found this looking for a better outdoor switch for my 240v hayward sp pump and new salt chlorinator which turn on and off together before this there wa a two gang box attached to the house which had a covered switch and an electrical outlet that wa taped over so this is a major improvement wiring could not be more simple the four punch out hole are well placed although i wish there wa one on the top of the box i know that wouldn t work without making the box bigger and it may interfere with the wifi antenna so i understand where there isn t one i have it mounted directly to brick and it look very clean and professional the screw terminal for the wiring are very robust and are easy to get to and identify with the clear plastic cover i have two circuit come in on the left side box right with the 240v controlled by the box and the 120 for the pool light passing through to another switch by the pool which i plan on replacing with a smart switch a well connecting it to wink took a bit of trial and error a the product isn t listed verbatim in the wink app but by selecting a generic ge z wave switch i think it is the same a the other ge outdoor switch i wa able to have it connected in le than five minute wireless range seems good my next closest z wave device is a few room and about 50 away so it s nothing crazy but have had no connectivity issue for two week i have also set the wink app to turn the pump on and off with a schedule making it a very robust pool timer the override button is also super convenient a short travel tactile button turn the pump on or off when you need to clear the basket of debris or change the filter etc the two light are also a very clean and clear way to identify if the system work
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: almost perfect need additional piece of equipment
Review: the product itself is easy to install and wire it look very good next to the rest of my pool control the issue is connecting it to your wireless network be warned the instruction say to download an app and connect to the unit wireless network that really isn t the case what they need to say is make sure you already have a smartthings hub connected to your wireless network and within 20 foot of this device yes i had to purchase an additional controller hub good news is that hub work with so many other home automation device including the amazon echo that wa already controlling most of our house now we can just ask echo to turn on or off the pool light and or pump of our in ground pool bottom line this device work great once you figure out you need one additional piece of equipment to connect it to your network for that reason they only get 4 star

Header: loses connection and need resetting too often
Review: see update below while made well and encased in a hard plastic shell a advertised this device continuously hang and loses connection with the zwave wink network rendering it s remote on off capability and the scheduled on off operation useless mine is used to schedule on and off time for my small outdoor pond pump after a reset it work great for a 12 hour period without fail but it seems to lose connection if not used within 12 hour very disappointing updated review after a month with this device i have figured out the issue and solved it i had this device at the end of a long extension cord with my pond pump plugged into it until i can get my underground line in by moving the device to the outlet and plugging the extension cord into it that go to the pump the problem is solved this device doesnt play well with the voltage drop from the long extension cord 50 i havent had an issue with disconnect in 9 day changed my rating to 4 star

Review: this review is regarding model 12726 the 40a 240 277v split phase model purchased july 30 2017 installed on august 3 on pool waterfall pump switching worked fine kw and kw hr readout worked intermittently the breaker at my electrical box tripped on september 10 2017 and would not reset disconnected the switch from all wiring multimeter show 0 resistance between input and output terminal there is an internal short it lasted 38 day in operation and le than 100 switching event can t return to amazon because the return period is only 30 day called jasco waited on hold for 20 minute before being dumped into a voicemail box update 2017 nov 6 i eventually did reach jassco and they proved an rma number emailed jassco 4 week after the return wa delivered to them they said that the item wa not in stock at that time 2 week go by and i emailed them again no response to that email will update if i ever receive a response update 2017 nov 11 i finally got a response from jassco that a replacement wa on it way received but not installed yet if it fails again i am going to put the pool waterfall back to it original configuration intermatic mechanical timer and 240v manual switch

Header: what a great light with easy setup
Review: this is an awesome way to add a zwave bulb if you just can t figure out the light switch i wasn t going to add a bulb that can potentially die out in a couple of year however this should last quite sometime my tenant is annoying with leaving the light on all night so i added a zwave bulb and connected to vera within 3 minute pretty easy now i can turn it on a dusk and turn it off well whenever i want the bulb come with everything needed they even added a little plastic clip that slide over the switch to keep it from being accident entry turned off manually they truly were thinking when packaging this for the consumer i m thinking of buying more only time will tell if they last 22 yr like it state i don t need full 100 illumination so it should get closed to 10 anything le is a disappointment although these bulb will probably be way cheaper in 10 yr i just don t want to keep shelling out 25 buck every yr for a light this need some kind of hub like vera just in case anyone is wondering if this fails for any reason in the near future i will be sure to update my rating i have not been paid nor do i work for the company that sell or manufacturer this product i take pride in my review and understand that many people use these review in making their buying decision if this ha helped you with that decision in anyway please hit the helpful button thank you very much
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i purchased the ge z wave outdoor plug to control my patio string light via smartthings control unfortunately two factor forced me to return the unit the main deal breaker wa a straight plug v the 90 degree plug a depicted in the amazon product picture the plug wa to be placed in an enclosed outlet box that required a 90 degree prong to fit and allow for closing of the box gotta keep that water out i made sure to check the product picture on amazon to make sure it wa angled which is what the current picture show see my uploaded photo unfortunately there must be two different version of the smart switch with either the straight or 90 degree plug and i got the former since it wouldn t work where i had initially planned i had another spot in my yard for some other light that i decided to try rather than returning the product this is where i encountered the second issue poor range the new location for the switch wa about 40 foot away from my smartthings hub going through two wall the switch wouldn t connect function at that distance i tried it on an outlet about 15 foot closer still outdoors and it picked up just fine so that extra open air distance must be too much for the unit you would think a product intended to be used outdoors would have a strong range but that doesn t seem to be the case i will be checking into the other option for an outdoor smart plug offered through amazon
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: this work well once i wa able to connect it to my smartthings hub but getting it into a pairing mode wa tricky there is only 1 button but you have to push it just hard and quick enough to turn on pairing push the button wrong and the device doe nothing you may think to yourself how can you push a button wrong i wa there with you and it took me quite a while of trial and error and head scratching before i finally got the first controlled to enter a pairing mode the other 2 were a bit quicker but still took a minute or more to just push the button right and have it turn on and pair it would be better if they kept the manual override button and added a dedicated pen push pairing button
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: ge z wave wireless controller doesn t live up to it advertising
Review: i got the ge z wave controller to control light in my office it wa very expensive 100 total for the remote control and the device that plug into an outlet from one side of my office to the other is approximately 25 foot the device is plugged in at a wall which is about 25 from the office door opening if i stand outside the door and attempt to control the light it fails almost 100 of the time and mutiple attempt are required to turn light off or on sometimes i have to walk into the office and stretch my arm out to make it work contrast this with three remote controller i got from home depot for 15 at christmas to control outside christmas light they work just fine no problem at all turning the light on off with any one of them the ge z wave advertises that it can control multiple device at a distance of up to 100 foot in my experience that is a lie originally i thought that i could control my office light from downstairs office is on the second floor that didn t work at all even though the distance wa only about 50 foot max then i thought that i could leave the controller on a shelf outside of the office and turn off everything a i left the office or turn on everything when entering the office that ha not work either i gave it one star for the excessive cost of a device that doesn t work a advertised the cost isn t just the remote control but also the device that plug into the wall socket both were expensive when i found that simple inexpensive christmas light remote control worked fine for 15 of the cost i felt taken by ge a company with a big name that just doesn t live up to it reputation in this case i highly recommend skipping this product and looking for something else
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i got it to plug outside on my patio to control a string of led light out there it s ok when it work but it appears to constantly lose connection with the rest of my zwave mesh network my smartthings app is always showing that this device is not available same thing with alexa she tell me it s currently not available there s only the one button for manual on off and to pair with your hub but it s confusing a each time i press it it will just turn on and off a third press to pair would just turn it back on again i m going to try adding a zwave plus smart outlet somewhere nearby to see if that will improve the range i will update my review later
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720
