Header: 1 year in and this never stop great for christmas light
Review: i have been using this with a smartthings hub for over a year now and it ha worked 100 of the time it wa first set up on some out door christmas decoration but after the holiday i took it inside and hooked it to a string of christmas light i left up in my house a nice evening lighting connecting to the hub wa easy and i have a schedule set to have it come on at sundown and off at 10 30pm this ha worked every night with no missed time this plug is kind of large so and they put the screw hole in a strange spot but it wa working even in the real cold and snowy weather where i have had some switch plug fail when it is too cold if you have an outdoor application for automation and a smartthings hub this will work good i do wish the plug wa more protected or flush with the end but it good for my use
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: nice product but not an angle plug a pictured
Review: the outdoor z wave timer from ge is a solid product it feel like it is well made and ready to withstand rain snow sleet ice heat and kid i use them to control outdoor lighting like christmas light and deck light i also use them inside since they have a cord v the interior one which plug directly into the outlet i bought it so i could use centralized timing from my smartthings hub and ditch a series of manual digital photoelectric and astrological timer that i had been using my only beef is that the item pictured ha a nema 90 plug on it right angle plug but the item actually doesn t i ve ordered a few of these and none of them are angled all straight not sure what the deal is a everything else look identical having a straight plug is a hassle since it make it challenging to plug it into an outdoor continuous use outlet cover which are required by code for this use case
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: i got another device using the same technology but not a waterproof and it work fine i enclosed it in a plastic box to
Review: i wound up returning this because it kept dropping connection it wasn t very far from my zwave controller smart thing but it would constantly drop off the network i got another device using the same technology but not a waterproof and it work fine i enclosed it in a plastic box to prevent any issue i had to bring this right next to the hub to pair it and even with a repeater between it and the main hub which shouldn t have been required it would keep dropping i have other zwave product much further out than this wa and they worked fine don t know if i got a dud or what but i returned and didn t ask for a replacement i got something different that had worked for me before
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: ge z wave wireless smart lighting control
Review: picked up this to control a living room table lamp with a switch led bulb using it with the smartthings hub it set up very easy and work pretty well since the bulb is dimmable it is nice to finally be able to use that feature of it using it with the samsung app and alexa it control consistently and dims the light very well my only complaint is a feature of this is to be able to cycle power on the lamp switch itself and have the light turn on instead of using the z wave to control it but that doe not work the feature is disabled by default and you need a controller to enable it which make no sense would be 5 star if not for that but otherwise i am happy with it
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: good zwave controller for my pool pump but sometimes ha problem with wireless operation
Review: i am using this product to control my pool pump while connected to my z wave network it is located not far away and almost line of sight from the zwave controller so i know it not the signal strength that cause issue pros solid and waterproof enclosure big button on front for easy manual operation nice indicator light on the front nice terminal and and lot of space for easy wiring cons not reliable operation with zwave network command i send for on of are sometimes not always executed i d say 90 of the time it work perfect by remote but the few time it doe not place doubt so i have to double check now to make sure the pool pump truly turned on at time it is not being able to be seen by the network for no apparent reason
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i bought this to replace a intermatic p1121 heavy duty outdoor timer that wa used to run an aeration pump for a pond having recently installed a smartthings hub it wa nice to find a power outlet made for being outdoors that work with it no problem with setup the initial setup wa done close to the smartthings hub once acknowledged and in the system it wa moved outside about 70 foot away the signal only ha to go through one wall and it s a straight shot between hub and outlet works good within the smarthings app wa able to schedule on off time i m expecting this to last longer than the intermatic hope i m not disappointed
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i m using this with a smartthings hub alexa and it work great by mounting it in the lower receptacle i actually gain a receptacle the top one is not blocked and this unit contains a z wave outlet pas through outlet the outlet are conveniently located on the end of the unit so you plug in from the side when the unit is plugged into the wall that work well in my application since i have it behind a nightstand which i want a close to the wall a possible i m using it for my wall mounted bedside lamp which is just barely out of reach from bed when i m done reading i now just ask alexa to turn it off the button on the front add manual control to the outlet the only gotcha is if someone doesn t understand the setup and turn the lamp off at the lamp switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: the switch work and pair fine with z wave i want to use it with christmas light that have an adapter wall wart at the end of the cord but the socket of this ge light control is recessed and i can t plug the adapter in directly i need another short extension cord it ha a large rubber cover for the end which i guess will help keep out water if nothing is plugged in but they could have made that a cap and still had the socket flush lots of thing you d want to plug into this will have adapter and you should look for another controller if that s your application
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: this is a z wave module meaning it requires a home automation system such a homeseer samsung smartthings hub or vera and then can be used to turn device on off remotely this review is of the appliance module it switch on and off but doesn t dim ideal for heater tvs etc the main alternative to this would be the leviton dzpa1 1lw or something from aeon there are several clone of this unit by go and linear that i presume are the same item relabeled so why get this rather than the others after all it s uglier and slightly larger but it is cheaper it s reliable and ha two fantastic feature it ha a pas through it plug in of course providing a switched outlet on one side and an always on outlet on the other side so you may not need that power strip to provide another plug for another device and it is sized shaped to take le space in some layout the leviton requires including device cord probably twice a much vertical space really these are commodity but the odd layout give some nice feature that the main competitor lack
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: plan on getting these for all the lamp control light and appliance repeat the z wave signal for enhanced coverage
Review: in my household someone is always leaving a lamp on in every room of our home ge ha come to the rescue with this nifty module someone also occasionally forgets to lock up before leaving our home i now have these module on the most used lamp in our home i configured our nexia account with a scene called lock up lights out now at scheduled time the program run the scene which then lock up our home and switch the selected lamp to off i also created a scene called movie time which is very similar allowing the room to darken while we are watching tv so nifty each of these powered module also act a a repeater rebroadcasting the z wave command from device to device to enhance the overall z wave network to be solidly reliable since installing and configuring a number of these lamp module our trane tzemt400bb3nx n n sl home energy management thermostat with nexia home intelligence white z wave ha remained in perfect contact with the bridge control module thereby resolving the communication issue we previously encountered only having a single repeater on our system i will definitely buy more of these lamp module a the budget allows to further resolve a few marital stress
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: works great with amazon echo and smartthings hub to automate an outlet
Review: i use this to control a 1700 watt dual boiler espresso machine with my smartthings and alexa device as stated there are 2 outlet on this unit only one of them is smart and the other is always active the button on the front allows you to manually turn the managed outlet on off so you don t need to use your smart home solution to turn on whatever is plugged into it unless you want to it wa very easy to setup with smartthings and alexa i just tell alexa to turn on espresso and she take care of heating up my machine so that when i get downstairs in the morning the device is warm and ready to brew my machine a quickmill vetrano 2b take a good 15 minute to heat up both boiler so this smart controller ensures my machine is ready to brew when i finally get downstairs the unit is rated to 1800 watt and i ve never had any issue with it thus far i highly recommend it if you need to automate anything from a lamp to a small appliance
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: this is one of those product that just work at least for me i use it with a smartthings hub to control some outdoor light the pairing wa easy and i had it working in le than a minute it is only about 6 foot from my hub so i haven t had to contend with any distance issue i am able to use the smartthings turn on at sunset feature to have the on time automatically adjust a the sunset time change
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i really liked this switch at first very convenient paired with my system easily really went a expected fast forward 1 year it s dead sigh i guess that s the quality we can expect these day still i m giving it 1 star
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: great for smartthings control of christmas lights
Review: over the past few year i ve been working to turn our home into a smart home the one area i have not tackled until now ha been outside all of our indoor light are controlled via our smartthings hub and various z wave outlet and zigbee lightbulb so this year when we put up our christmas light and our solar powered outdoor plug died on u i had to come up with a solution the ge z wave outdoor control module wa my choice i purchased one for the front and back of our home and hoped for the best pairing wa very simple the smartthings hub found them a a new device a soon a i plugged the module in after that it wa just a matter of working them into our lighting scheme and our christmas light are now fully controlled from inside our home it s great being able to set a very precise schedule for turning the light on and off based on our need and having the flexibility and access without needing to physically be in contact with the light the construction of these module seems pretty substantial there s just one outlet on each and a plug to cover that outlet if it s not in use the material were a bit confusing a they state that these should not be used outside in very in climate weather yet they re outdoor module shouldn t they be able to withstand a good rain storm blizzard i am going to take the chance and use them all holiday season regardless of the weather situation and see what happens the module out back is not protected from the element in any way but the front one is under our porch cover if i have any issue with them i will be sure to update this review to reflect them
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i have a self install security system but one that is actively managed by a third party company like adt i purchased the lighting control a it connects with a number of system control panel and third party software that us z wave technology my intent wa to use this device to allow me to remotely control light while we re away to give the appearance that someone is home the installation wa quite simple i plugged it in called the third party security company and they provided instruction for how to sync the control panel with the lighting control from there it showed up on the app alarm com and worked great you should know however that if you re thinking this will work without some sort of receiver control panel believe you may be mistaken in the beginning i thought this would work just fine with some third party app but i believe you must also use their receiver box in the event it doesn t sync with your security system control panel i believe it s referred to a a gateway a number of company offer them overall i m pleased and amazon had the best price i could find for this item
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: excellent high current ge z wave industrial control and power measurement switch
Review: i purchased this ge z wave industrial control to be able to turn on off the 220vac power to my hot water heater in my home this product work great i mounted it in my utility closet near my hot water heater and the samsung smarthings hub is located about 20 foot away from the unit when i installed the unit and went through the process to connect it to my z wave network it showed up immediately on my android smartthings app and just worked the unit provides you both power watts and kilowatt hour and also ha external status light so you can immediately tell if ac power is flowing into unit and if power is flowing to the load hot water heater as i stated i installed it using 220 vac with 10 awg wire unit came with very clear instruction and had no issue at all instructions show multiple connection for 120vac 220vac single load and dual load the case is solid metal and look very well made it is also weather resistant this unit give me peace of mind that i can turn on off the hot water heater to either save money or control it when i m away on vacation
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: great budget switch to add to non essential room
Review: for it current pricing it is a great addition to any z wave enabled smart home it doe use the older z wave technology but pair seamlessly with my wink hub 2 this device ha an always on side and a controllable side so you are only able to turn on and off the device plugged into the controllable this isn t terrible a there are many application that can require an always on non controllable port however in my house i would prefer to have both controlled another great feature is the fact that it can extender your z wave signal with some strategic placing of this device you can get a good signal all throughout your home if you are looking for the newer version i would highly suggest you look into the ge 28177 or the ge 28175 dimmable both of these come with two controllable side usb charging port and z wave plus technology all in all for a budget this is a great product especially for guest room and non essential room
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: works a expected and pair with adt pulse
Review: i installed this unit a a water heater timer for my home i followed the instruction and the install went a expected i paired the unit with the adt pulse system and it paired instantly since it ha the ability to monitor energy use adt pulse now provides a graph of my water heater s energy use per hour in the history section of the adt portal now i can turn off the heater when we set the alarm to away or vacation mode i calculated this unit will pay for itself in about 7 month in energy saving i like the external button a that make it easy for other family member eg wife to turn on the water heater if they need to use the unit on a off period also the led light are a nice touch to tell my family member if the water heater is on i will probably buy 2 more of these unit to replace a couple manual timer we use for outdoor lighting
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: goes offline with every power flicker and must be reset
Review: endlessly go off line and must be reset with wink hub 2 it enters reset mode by applying and removing power to the bulb that s a problem because if you live in an area where storm or other issue cause power to flicker in storm or when the electric utility preforms maintenance all of these light will turn on then go off line to place them back in service the need to be removed from what ever fixture there in and plug them in next to the wink hub them begin a process of reprogramming that work about 60 of the time then you need to clean up the wink network google home or alexia by removing the old entry for the bulb what wa needed is a button on the bulb to enter programming mode by relying on the power on off method to enter the programming mode they made a high maintenance monster that sooner or later you ll come to the conclusion is just not worth the trouble of resetting again so it can rejoin the network
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: died in 5 months but jasco sent new one
Review: update sept 21 2016 well it worked great for almost five month went to turn off my lamp this week and heard a loud pop thought the bulb burned out this morning turn out the wireless outlet on this device died however manufacturer jasco sent replacement after 15 minute phone wait hoping it wa just a fluke may 2016 bought a couple of these and connected to 2 lamp in the house so that we could control and program to automatically turn on during vacation works great only thing to know is that the fixture plugged in to this device must be on in order to control it remotely duh tip if you turn the lamp on and off during regular use you have to remember to turn it on before you leave for vacation mode use works similarly to the led light bulb but you can use this device for more than one item at a time and for different type of fixture
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: this thing work a a contactor only expensive for that purpose but with zwave capability then it s worth it only if i can get to connect with nexia this thing doesn t connect at all been trying multiple time with no success even got a replacement from amazon but same problem i went to home depot and bought a smartthings hub to see if it is the switch still no connection so not sure now my nexia is working fine and the smartthings hub working fine will be returning it to get a cheaper switch that simply turn on off functionality

Header: lights are still powered when the switch is off current leak is unacceptable
Review: the device connected fine to my z wave hub and wa responded appropriately most of the time i have noticed a response time of a few second sometimes which may be due to the distance between the switch and the hub what i found unacceptable is the fact that when the switch is off there is still some current delivered about 2 2v i have noticed it at night when my led were showing a faint light i guess many user may not notice but this is a waste of money and energy i like the concept of home automation but draining energy when switch are off is not appealing i have tested two of these item and they both have this issue
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i ve purchased four or five of these thing to complement my 90 zwave device throughout my house and property they work well and seem to have good range fwiw the latest one purchased is now plugged in line with my garage door opener power cord because i found that potential crook have been driving around the neighborhood during the day with device that try all 10 000 garage door opener code to see whose garage they can open up to mark for a subsequent theft this way i can completely disable the opener it s now a three step process all automated via a micasavera scene to turn on this device to power the motor two second later press the unlock garage button which is a garagedoorlock device that control another zwave relay on the garage door button coordinated with a zwave garage door open close sensor and finally15 minute later turn off this device again to remove power the 15 minute is plenty of time for me to get in my car back it out of the garage then use the normal garage door opener remote control button on my visor to close the door again when coming home i have to open the garage using my cellphone with the home buddy app to trigger the garage door open scene again the power is left on for 15 minute so that i can close the door with the regular garage push button before entering the house ok that s a lot more information than anyone really needed to know suffice it to say that this ge z wave controller work well even way out on the garage ceiling
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: with a name brand product like ge i had expected a product with adequately simple setup instruction ease of use and a basic level of customer support i found none of these it came packaged well with a single page instruction sheet three page total but only a page for each language first i bought this to use with the wink hub and on the package it ha the wink app ready symbol so i expected it to work and be supported the wink app doesn t support this product so the easy setup isn t so easy it can be added a a generic zwave switch but the information and feedback from the app on how to do it and when is very limited which is understandable since wink doesn t support it they don t have specific instruction and troubleshooting in the app like they do for setup of most of their supported product generic instruction for generic switch ok however the instruction with the switch are virtually non existent so a supposedly simple setup failed after dozen of attempt long press single press reset the hub etc i asked wink they said to factory reset the switch it should say how in the instruction nope the instruction contain little information about the process of pairing resetting turn out you can t or troubleshooting jasco the maker of the product under contract for ge i guess took 2 day to respond to a support request and then only to say what amounted to it s not our problem talk to wink in the end after 3 day of attempt i wa able to pair it to the wink hub thanks to wink for figuring out someone else s product and helping me make it work this product wa intended to be used to control an automatic chicken coop door on a schedule with the option of manually switching a necessary the push button doesn t feel very sturdy and time will tell but given the overall experience with the company this switch and the interaction with my controller i don t feel it to be a reliable solution so i may ultimately move to a different product in all i would avoid this product in the future given the seeming lack of reliability poor customer service poor instruction lack of troubleshooting and difficulty in pairing update after a couple of week of use after finally successfully pairing the switch intermittently fails to function i don t think the issue is with the wink server a the app show the properly scheduled change of state but the switch hasn t actuated given this is used to control the chicken door to let them out each morning and close them in at night particularly if we are away intermittent failure is not acceptable it may be an issue with distance to hub and environmental condition roughly 30ft through one wall and the low relative power of zigbee v zwave in any case it doesn t meet basic expectation that an automated switch can work reliably automatically i d try troubleshooting but the maker a described above clearly doesn t feel accountable to the end user so i ll be returning it and looking for alternative
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i bought two these module are my 7th type of zwave device since i began installing them in july 2016 smartthings v2 if you don t want to install an in wall device maybe just need a temporary solution or are just adding a zwave repeater to a difficult area this device should be on your list one feature which i didn t notice when initially researching these but did find before i bought any is that only one outlet is zwave and one is normal i wasn t sure if this wa what i wanted preferred or not but that s the way they are and i ve had no issue after having these installed for 2 month now they ve worked flawlessly set up pairing wa straightforward a well one thing i like to mention in my zwave device review is this i m sure some people have unique situation but for the most part i believe that most problem encountered with zwave connectivity is the range i ve made sure that i have at least one device no further than 15 foot from the next device more of then and closer a much a possible keep your mesh network nice and tight and build out from your hub i have had zero issue now after 6 month with approx 20 device covering socket switch water sensor garage door opener sensor up next for me are thermostat more water sensor door lock and switch
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: in what sense is this an outdoor plug
Review: bought this to remotely control an outdoor water fountain knew i wa going to return it the instant i read the instruction although it state that the unit is suitable for outdoor use in damp location it then say do not expose to rain it also state that it should be installed at least 3 ft above the ground this might be ok if it had a cord longer than 6 but it doesn t and 3 ft off the ground is not exactly standard placement for electrical conduit at least not in my backyard a further annoyance is that it requires a hub to work i knew it required a hub to interface with alexa but i didn t realize it need a hub to work with my iphone most smart plug like tp link connect to my iphone instantly without a hub for half the price
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Review: i easily paired this to my samsung smart things hub and plugged in one set of string light i set up routine for automatic on and off time and wa able to turn the light on and off with the app after that the routine worked very sporadically but mostly the app said the device wa unavailable i ll note that the one other device i have on my smart things hub is always available and it is always dependable a smart plug for a fan that s actually true for all of my other smart home product nest hue august ecobee echo i exchanged the first one i had because i thought it wa defective but this one doe the same thing sometimes it work sometimes it doesn t but i can t depend on it to work and basically it mostly doesn t work unless i go outside and push the button to reset it but then it might or might not fail again before the time that the light are set to go on or off again i m returning this one and trying an idevice which is more expensive but it ha 2 plug and it is compatible with apple home kit yay i am really disappointed that ge is producing this inferior product but i wa getting ready to order a more complicated ge device to run our pool equipment etc so i m glad i got the warning that ge isn t up to smart home yet with this little device
Product: GE Z-Wave Wireless Smart Lighting Control Outdoor Module, On/Off, Plug-In, Black, Works with Amazon Alexa, 12720

Header: it works but it s a little difficult to set up with a wink 2 hub
Review: it work but a little difficult to set up with a wink2 solution exclude the controller before you add it i know what i tried like 100 time to pair to the wink but only after i excluded it did it pair how to exclude 0 have your controller plugged in ready plug a lamp in to it i read that wa necessary to pair cannot confirm if that is true 1 open the wink app on your phone 2 select hubs 3 select the gear in the upper right corner 4 select your hub if you have more than one 5 scroll down to z wave and select 6 select exclusion mode the wink will flash blue 7 press the button on the controller one time only the wink will go solid green 8 go back and try to pair the controller again do not put the z wave back into inclusion mode at least i didn t and only press the controller button once when asked mine paired first time after doing this i m sure the original wink would work the same way good luck

Review: its a really nice and heavy unit the biggest you can get with out upgraded wiring i believe in over kill when it come to electrical power i never like to get near the maximum load rating i try to keep load around 50 to 60 of rating but it arrived damaged the front panel wa broken in transit amazon is sending out a replacement but until the replacement arrives i can t add much more so far all i can say is it loos 2 star for aggravation delay in setup and packaging when i called cyberpower about the damage the rep with attitude said that the pancaking meet or exceeds the standard obviously those standard are inadequate and do not take ups driver in to account the cyberpower rep also warned that if it took that strong an impact the unit might also have internal damage making it unsafe to use i will update when i receive the replacement with the recent storm both i and my parent have taken power hit and had some damage a a result i also ordered a second unit sent to my parent i am hoping when i go to set it up this weekend it will have arrived in good condition they need it to protect the computer equipment router and most importantly the cable voip phone modem and phone attached to it for safety they must have at least 1 working phone when the power go out gone are the day of the old pots land line phone now everything need power to work update 11 05 12 the second unit i order arrived in good condition the package containing the rack mount rail kit had burst open but no damage to the ups better yet no scratch from the rail bouncing around in the box the ups is to heavy for the high shelf i have the equipment on so i have it temporarily setup until i can do some rearranging and cable management i have the network switch nas etc plugged in to the critical outlet i have the router and cable modem plugged in to the noncritical outlet that way i can use the installed rmcard202 network card and web interface to cycle the noncritical outlet to reset the router and cable modem when needed with out running all the way down to the basement back closet the web interface ha it limitation but will do what i need it to the drawback is with the router and modem on the noncritical outlet i can not set up priority and shut that bank down to conserve battery during an outage i have yet to play with the included software i have only explored the embedded web interface so far i have tested wit a simulated unplugged a power outage the qnap t 659 proii nas shutdown a configured with a usb connection the nas must be rebooted once the usb cable is connected for the nas to recognize the ups the ups is reporting a nas only load of between 5 and 7 the display is rotatable a mentioned in other review take care with the ribbon cable i had difficulty rotating the display no slack at all i found the cable wa kinked and pinched under the front panel i loosened the 6 screw holding the front panel on remove it and had all the slack needed to easily rotate the display the power button safety cover is very difficult to open with my sausage finger update 11 15 12 the replacement arrived the other day in good condition witch is amazing considering the large gash and boot print in the box so far i just have them temporally situated with the critical device they are heavy and the rat nest of cable is going to be a challenge and an all day task to retie and make look pretty again but so far so good the real test will be the next time there is a power event
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Review: this thing is a beast it s big it s heavy it s sort of ugly oddly enough they delivered a other brand 1500 va ups to me at work today that one is maybe 1 5 the weight of this one it look a lot nicer it cost about a much if you want pretty and small look at other model this one is rated to hold up a full load for a while the little guy at work might last a minute at 1500 va there s 5x the battery in this one i can t imagine what else you would want in a ups other than a built in ethernet control rather than an optional one there is every other form of alarm and i o you would ever want already on this it ll handle cable and ethernet suppression along with ups duty it come with a full set of rack mount rail and handle if you want to mount it that way there s some interesting chat about the watt rating on this beast if you go to the manufacturer s web site it s rated at 1500 va and 1500 w when running on battery more or le if it doesn t blow the fuse you can depend on this ups to handle your load power factor doe not matter since most stuff these day is power factor corrected it s the watt rating rather than the va rating that matter one other note the nice looking foot in the picture are not the foot that come with the unit what you get is a metal plate assembly and some tiny screw on rubber foot very sturdy not very pretty

Header: nice ups good price noisy inverter
Review: the chinese made see photo cyberpower pr1500lcdrtxl2u smart app sinewave green ups 1500va 1125w avr lcd snmp http xl black arrived in a solid well engineered box see photo the gross weight of the box is 42 kg 92 5 lb see photo on the whole the unit appears attractive and well made a there were no noticeable blemish and flaw on the finish and surface of the unit in short the product project the appearance of having been assembled in a factory with well define process and quality control measure on the electrical rating of the unit itself i find the manufacture claim of 1125 watt of net output power a bit disingenuous according to the affixed manufacturer electrical label the device is ul rated to draw 12 amps at 125 vac or 1500 va for a net output of 1125 watts see photo with 75 efficiency that work out to a total of 1440 va at the wall plug and 1080 watt for a typical 120 vac house and only 1320 va and 990 watt for a house running on 110 vac maybe they exist but i don t know of any house that is operating at 125 vac hence presuming normal load and source condition it would be more forthright to advertise this device with a maximum output rating of 990 1080 watts at 110 120 vac the cyberpower pr1500 though called a ups by name is in fact not a true ups and uninterrupted this product by electrical design is not a double conversion device and therefore ha a transfer time up to 6 milli second a true ups with double conversion circuitry ac dc ac ha zero transfer time and truly uninterrupted with ac line lost but because of noise level electrical efficiency issue and popular perception cyberpower apc and other manufacture include device such a this under the heading of ups the set up and configuration instruction are incomplete and us very small hard to read type also no hard copy of the manual is supplied the only manual available is one that can be down loaded or obtain from the supplied cdrom not all of my power backup application are near a computer s and to presume so or to disregard other application is a bit near sighted as for tech support twice this week i called the phone number listed on the company web site during normal working hour 1 30pm cst and the phone rang for several minute with no one answering although not mentioned in the instruction the front led display block can be removed and rotated see photo to accommodate horizontal and vertical placement to rotate the led display block one ha to insert a flat tip standard screw driver into a small slot see photo and gently and carefully lift and extract the display block the display block is attached in the rear with a ribbon cable to the face panel so be careful not to extend this part too far somewhat disappointing given today s technology and ease to set but the displayed input voltage is off by 2 vac a per a fluke 187 dvm the on off switch ha a plastic protective flip cover see photo to prevent accidental cycling of the ac source this is a nice hardware feature and one that i feel other manufacture would do well to adopt the unit come with a 10 foot power cord with the ac prong set in a protective plastic sheath see photo batteries were fully charged on arrival as an observation during the power cycle transfer test and yet to be quantified i noticed that the cyberpower pr1500 produce more inverter cooling fan noise and vibration than the combined effect produced by an apc su1400rm2u and su2200rm2u sine wave unit i have protecting an audio system that s because the inverter fan in the cyberpower pr1500 is not a variable speed fan and operates at full speed at all time the inverter is functioning though minor at the rear of the unit the space between the ether cable line out and the ac power cord grommet see photo is too tight even though i have small hand i still found it necessary to use a flat tip device to depress the plastic ether cable release tab to disconnect the ether cable this clearance problem could be alleviated if the chassis designer were to rotated the ether port in their mount by 180 degree placing the ether cable depression release tab opposite to that of the power cord grommet included is a set of rack mount ear see photo pseudo dovetail sliding rail kit see photo and shoe chock see photo for freestanding the steel rail and slide are of the non roller bearing type but still very functional the two supplied plastic shoe for setting up the ups in the vertical orientation can be separated see photo into four separate chock for setting up the device in a horizontal non rack mount placement for a heavy product not having to be flush with the resting surface can be very helpful such that one can get their finger underneath the unit for easer lifting the cyberpower pr1500 came supplied with a full complement of cable see photo two 9 pin serial cable one usb 2 0 cable one rj 11 telephone cable one rj 45 cat5 ether cable along with a cdrom containing the management software last a three display workstation 23 24 22 with an intel i7 860 cpu 8gb ddr3 xtc memory cooler radeon 5850 nec usb3 0 sata6 pcie aver hdtv pcie 2tb raid 01 1 5 tb esata hd scythe fan controller 3x 120mm fan 3x 100mm fan ultra 600w ps bt gb ether hub speaker bar drawing a total of 304ws a per the ups report having an estimated run time of 44 minute with fully charged battery minus 0 25 for how the ups output is electrically rated minus 0 25 for high noise level of the ac inverter sub system minus 0 25 for incomplete and too small a print used on the instruction minus 0 25 for not supplying a hard copy of the user manual
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Review: i have owned around 10 battery backup system this one put them all to shame love how this come with the hardware in the box that allows you to setup it up for a rack or on the floor setting on it edge with foot the lcd can rotate to match your install so you can few the setting properly i also picked up the cyberpower rmcard202 remote management card this will allow me to remote in form anywhere and reset my network if need be wished the card came with the unit but for how this ups is priced it a great deal and value and the extra 130 still make this one of the best deal loved using my prime to get free shipping on a heavy ups though they don t allow two day on this i have 5 dell powerconnect 24 port switch a 5 drive nas comcast and dsl modems a router a firewall and a cisco aoronet access point this unit will provide over an hour of battery power for all of those device allowing our office generator to kick on and take over at that point in reality i only need 10 15 min also is the largest unit you can use on a 15 amp plug ordering 2 more soon to replace the single unit powering my different server
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Review: i maintain a small rack of gear along with my workstation and wa getting tired of the limitation the smaller ups unit have wattage wise this thing is able to handle everything i throw at it without choking we had a few power interruption recently and the unit didn t even blink it screamed like a bloody demon when doing it thing but that is to be expected the best part about these is the direct expansion path provided by the extension battery tray well worth the price

Review: received my pr1500lcdrtxl2u and it s defective when i plug it into ac power and turn it on i get a quick beep and a long beep the ups stay on for a few minute in those minute i determined that the ups wa incorrectly detecting an under voltage condition here s a paste from the powerpanel page input status under voltage voltage 76 0 v frequency 60 10 hz model pr1500lcdrtxl2u firmware version 4 3 5 ups type sinewave line interactive power rating 1500 va 1500 w current rating 12 0 amp voltage rating 120 v frequency rating 47 53 57 63 hz just for fun i tried several outlet including my washing machine outlet which is on it own 30a circuit same result obviously if my electrical service wa only providing 76v a indicated by the ups status nothing would be working in my apartment but this isn t the case the ups is wrong just to verify this i measured the voltage with my multimeter see picture i put in a support request with cyberpower with all the detail but so far haven t heard back from them i m hoping that it can be repaired and that i won t have to return it since the thing and accessory in it box is 90lbs and would be a big pain to haul down to a shipping facility awaiting response from cyberpower note that the picture show the multimeter plugged into a power strip which i used just for convenience the ups wa plugged directly into a wall socket
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Review: cyberpower pr1500lcdrtxl2u i bought this item and installed on oct 1 2010 for my home entertainment system the item we had connected to the critical outlet were the hd television dishnetwork receiver and a yamaha receiver the hd tv ha a fan that run on the bulb for 2 minute after it is shut off sony to cool it down and if the power is disconnect from the dishnetwork receiver it go through a reboot program that last from a few minute to 10 minute even if the power go off for a second so if your watching tv and there is a power loss you are going to miss a large part or if you are recording you will lose everything after the power go off even for a split second first i would like to say this item appears to work a described when the power went off or we had a brown out it would kick right in but i don t see how anyone could watch television or listen to music with the sound level of the cooling fan my wife ha an 1800 watt hair dryer that make le noise this cyberpower system is really loud we would turn it off or leave the room when it came on ok here is the really bad part like another user giving a review here this unit kicked on last monday morning at 3 am the loud fans and beeping woke me up so i went in the living room and turned it off the next morning i tried to turn it on with no luck i left it plugged in with nothing on for about 10 hour and tried to turn it on again with no luck i took the top cover off and checked the voltage to the circuit board and it wa 120 volt i pulled the battery pack out and checked voltage of all 4 battery i disconnected battery one at a time while checking and each battery had 13 4 volt fully charged i checked the switch and it wa ok from these test and others i did indicates a bad circuit board i called tech support at cyberpower and the first thing the guy said wa the battery are bad after i explained that i had checked the battery and what the result wa he basically said i have a 600 00 paper weight so i called back today and got a different guy with the same result i ask if i could buy the circuit board from them or somewhere else and he said no every thing check out good but the small 6 x 6 circuit board i think this is the worst review i have posted at amazon i would not buy again my background i use to teach a specialized electronics class for general motors i have worked on computer since 1992 i have installed a partial solar system at my home used to charge our home phone system cell phone rechargeable aa aaa battery and every other item that is rechargeable it also basically run out video security system too one other thing all the review posted here about this cyberpower pr1500lcdrtxl2u are not for this model number so look carefully at the model number
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Header: excellent ups and a value price point in it class with benefit of safe modular enclosure fan noise beep requires wire snip
Review: bought this in sep 2013 it is now dec 2013 we just had an ice storm a lot of power fluctuation and today we had a second outage for about an hour and forty minute last night i operated this from the simple software downloadable from the cyberpower site onto my windows 7 laptop i put the unit into a test mode i have one ebm hooked up i have disabled the alarm from the s w you cannot do it from the front panel a i had hoped however there is still an alarm that go beep beep every few minute while the fan whir the trade off is you do have real power last night i had to abort the test it indicated i had 10 hour and 52 minute of runtime the load wa about 80 watt this includes a robust desk set up with most appliance off just like i would do in an outage however i left the laptop powered up after hour of the annoying beep which i probably will open the unit and snip the wire in time to get rid of that sound i recommend that anyone not familiar with electricity not to fool around inside these unit there is high voltage and current present and i am sure you could get injured if you do not know what you are doing never open it with it plugged into the wall and know that if you intend to do what i am contemplating that you cannot touch capacitor etc and should have one hand behind your back and likely use an insulating glove for electrical work goggles are also recommended even sealed lead acid batteries may leak some acid or hydrogen i do not endorse fooling around inside the unit i am a ee and may do this however but the noise is mostly annoying to the woman i share the house with when i first hooked it up i put the hp 4 laserjet hog on it honestly it wa within specification but i thought momentary peak current draw would cause a problem nothing ran fine without a glitch they do tell you not to hook laser printer up but i am going to tell you that there is a good chance you could be fine the main reason not to do it is that you are going to burn through your run time now i decided to get greedy and see what would happen if i connected the microwave to it we did have power out the microwave started clearly power starved struggled and the cyberpower ups unit took itself offline obviously due to an overload condition the microwave draw 1500 watts and sure it would have been gravy if that actually ran it did not and that is within spec you are not supposed to use motor with these however i have a work around i am going to experiment with and will let you know there is a box intended for audio video and live performance it is the most economical box that furman sell that doe power factor correction which is impedance matching to maximize power transfer to the equipment from the wall socket i intend to put this between the output of this type of unit and momentary high current peak power draw device the unit is call the furman p 1800 and run about 400 usd or le now on amazon i have one on order the unit benefit is in it instantaneous current resorvoir internal capacitor to in this application prevent surge from overloading the cyber power ups unit by responding to these instantaneous current draw with capcitative stored energy it will not take care of an rms overload condition in other word this will not solve connecting a microwave to this but you are not supposed to connect a microwave or a refrigerator to even the unit that is above this i e the cyberpower pr2200lcdrtxl2u smart app sinewave ups 2150va 1650w snmp http rack tower i mention all of this because i am going to explore that next i am looking to build up another stronger batter ups for some kitchen appliance with the current draw supply circuit of the p 1800 in between right now this is a future experiment i will try to write later to see if that work out but if you don t mind protecting this unit it can be used for this also and while the p 1800 ha not arrived yet it is likely that you could used this with an amplifier to at least bring the sound in to a range of normal the jury is out it is a big complaint for a v type folk that using ups kill the sound because of the need for this instantaneous current i am proposing a possible solution i am exploring back to this unit and my home office this exceeded my expectation runs like a champ i do a lot of telework and i am never going to be off line even if this dropped off the laptop have battery in them and i have a small cyberpower 1500 pflcd whose only purpose in life is to back up the router 5 watts so when the ups dy which would take considerable time beyond a work day everything is still humming power grids are becoming increasingly unreliable i made the decision to go big or bigger on an ups based on a situation of being at home and working and simply not being able to afford to have down time during a work day in addition i realized that in spite of the fact that the refrigerator will keep your food cold for hour if you leave it closed that is not much use to me if i am in the middle of an outage and need to eat to keep going that is the motivation for getting the 2200 with a 15 amp adapter cord make sure you know the total max draw including charging if you pursue this i mention above i will be ordering that soon i just ordered two more ebms the one i ordered with this did show up with a brown exotic spider living inside of it it looked poisonous and wa rather large i am a wimp and i killed it so just be advised when you open these that they are shipped from somewhere don t ask me where somewhere is found the desert no idea the office set up is in a bed room and others have mentioned that the blue led engaged unit light is bright and always on it is true unless you sleep with light on it is going to annoy you just do what someone on here did and put a piece of tape over it to dull it with a piece of paper over the light portion do not get to carried away you may need to access the switch the ups can be turned off this will cut the power to everything hooked up but if it is the middle of the night the whirring fan and the beeping could ruin your relationship or alienate your pet you doubtfully will be getting any sleep this will turn off the blue on led light also now if your power is intermittent all the time you are going to need to think about the above and get realistic the ups can be placed in a closet and it ha excellent vertical bracing support bracket you can save money on the cost of a fancy rack and simply place it in a vertical position these vertical bracket are like book end that snap into place underneath they are made of reasonably sturdy plastic also each extra ebm will come with two plastic extenders that allow these footer type bracket to be expanded so that you can sandwich them in tightly like book end they snap into place lock and are secure ups ebm s in an upright position together i suggest you consider a solution some a v installers do where they put this kind of unit concealed in an actual closet you like me are going to have to consider how and where you will route cord without creating a dangerous kludge not only to avoid electrocution but imagine what the fire marshall might say if you have wire strung around your house not to code and you have a fire that could be a liability issue also all module have fan the fan are located on each far side of the ebms thus in the vertical position that would mean you can find them on the top and bottom every additional fan is going to add 3db more noise referenced to a single fan so yes every time you add an ebm the baseline of two fan is going to increase the noise by 3db referenced to each unit ebm thus you can add the dbs to the basic unit to plan ahead and calculate the loudness of the unit or i can just tell you it will sound like you are in a server room take your pick some noise and reliable power or no noise and no power the solution for the kitchen if i do it and i probably will will wrap into a close on the floor at the base with the sound beep one lead pulled off after opening and safely terminated in insulation to prevent conduction to any surface inside the unit if i ever were to sell the unit i would reconnect the wire we are talking about a single internal speaker wire removal here if this plan doe not work i will then flow the equipment to an audio system or first try it on a freezer another pending purchase the freezer is le likely you just leave them shut many of the people posting here are telling you about multiple system around their house yes the cost doe add up since again unless you have constant power problem we are generally talking about occasional outage this is where you ass your extension cord situation in an ice storm for instance a bright extension cord that is 50 or 100 and appropriately rated for the power it will carry to match or exceed your ups can be a valuable cost saving measure to get power around the house on a temporary basis during a short storm there are advantage to having the stand alone system people are describing no or few extension cord local power station type set up this is all very valuable one for your office and after tested and i can confirm it probably within the next six month something for some very basic but moderately extended outage also know that these modular battery back ups are a superior solution to big car battery and inverter with dangerous wire strung about to cobble together a diy solution i contemplated doing that instead because you can pick everything you want the inverter the batteries etc but in the end this wa the safest and most eloquent solution it wa not the least expensive that said these are very reasonably priced for what you get oversize if you are considering doing this you need to oversize and read the run time chart based on your load if you do not know the total wattage you need it is time to get out a piece of paper and a pen and start looking on the back of your appliance and adding it up another and better way to do this is to use a kill o watt 4460 type meter also something you can find here on amazon and to use the office example buy a nice solid tripplite pdu i recommend the pdumh15 these are here on amazon and are like a safe extension cord with many outlet if you have the money for a rack system then you are going to be able to mount them in a rack otherwise plug the kill o watt meter into the wall then plug your chosen pdu into it then plug your office led lighting into it and your laptop s your printer everything and start to see how all of this add up and what you can unplug if you can afford it i use two pdus in the office one prior to the ups this ha the laser printer photo copier hog connected to it and anything else that i could care a le about taking care of in a power outage then take your other pdu and put this after the ups now connect everything to this you wish to be ups protected your critical stuff if you do not have money for the pdus then work with the outlet on the back of the unit there are two bank one is for critical equipment and the other is for non critical and at a set time which i believe is software configurable those outlet will drop off to conserve runtime in a true power emergency i recommend you are more involved you do not know when the power will be back so only run your critical stuff and a needed turn the hog on the one you have tested to assure that they will not cause your ups to shut off until you reboot it with these no longer connected the software is a little kludegy if your laptop go to sleep the ups loses the bead on the communication with your laptop or stand alone computer and when you wake the computer back up you will be greeted with a couple of message telling you the obvious the connection wa lost it is obviously down your computer is sleeping not processing update12 13 2013 today during another real outage the message will show up on the scree that the upss is on rather obvious it is loud and beeping later when the ups shuts off and power is restored you will get another message to that effect the beep is annoying but these are really serious server ups for a professional environment that mean in a true mission critical operation like a workplace your it network team is going to be manning the situation and want to know about what unit have activated the unit monitor and report their internal operating temperature and run cool in my application the waste heat around 100 watts is very minimal should you buy this well these are a big step up you are buying this because you are serious you are not fooling around with power outages whether you are a small company a large organization or a modest person with a home office and realize that this is an investment in your valuable time if you rely on energy power like i do then this come highly recommended it is the solution for it range it is a value in that range yes you can build whole generator your money is the limit but this is the step you take if you are getting out of dinky ups that damage your equipment and do not do much but give you enough time to shut down smoothly those are valuable and that is what i had until now but imho this is what you step up to a the next level let s say you live in a condo and you have not back up generator for the building then these are really good to keep you up an running if you work at home ever now i can lose power all day and keep working frankly that is amazing and this recent ice storm is what it took for me to know it wa now time to order two more ebms i buy and build a i go unless you are gushing with money or have a specific preplanned application thought through just buy this unit then order the ebms for some people even the basic unit can be enough the first ebm will really take you to a whole other level of back up also strategize to maximize your run time during an outage to keep the load just to what you need also a mentioned these are not built to run reactive load like motor it is possible that inserting the p1800 in between might just allow you to do this it will present a big power draw a more of a steady rms draw looking back at the ups but you will be using up your run time these are not intended for hospital or safety of life do not buy this to back up medical equipment you may have at home or in a doctor s office i highly recommend these unit you can also buy a small honda or some other generator from amazon home depot or your local hardware store and set that outside and run a cord directly to supply power to your ups during a snowstorm and at least have power if you care to around the clock the ups take on the duty when the generator is not running and vice versa i live in a small house and will possibly store a small amount of diesel in the laundry room in the proper container for a small protable diesel generator in a more distant future to back up the ups do not buy an ups to run heater you need a different plan look into propane kerosine and other solution and make sure you always crack a window iaw direction and place these on a safe surface and install batter backed up carbon monoxide detector if these alarm that mean you need to leave the house so keep the air moving be safe our power and weather are not what they use to be cheers it is my hope that this information ha been helpful to all of you in considering this leap good luck

Header: pro three year warranty con very heavy junk if there is any issue after that
Review: unit ha a great price to feature ratio especially when comparing to apc or other higher end business level similar equipment couple of thing learned from the first and last cyberpower product we installed the warranty is three year after that they offer no repair service technical support noted they were not aware of any 3rd party repair center either our unit started turning itself off not the finest quality for a ups until it simply would not power on again cyberpower support indicated 95 likely a bad battery i didn t realize at the time before ordering a replacement that wa the only service option available our problem must have been something in the other 5 of possibility total junk 6 month out of warranty oddly while this is intended to be used in a rack cabinet a plus it included the necessary hardware and 4 point rail the model number and serial number are on the side of the unit so should you need to contact support have the model and serial number written down before you install the unit or you ll find yourself pulling a 70 pound box out of the cabinet to read something that should have been on the front or rear of the unit nice looking great feature for price but while the other apc ups rack unit we have cost signifantly more they have all lasted twice to three time longer then the cyberpower unit
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Header: item failed in 4th year of service
Review: this ups had worked well for me since i purchased it around june 2010 several day ago i powered it down overnight and then tried to power it up the next morning the unit wouldn t power on simply beeping twice and then appearing to reset it kept repeating this cycle every few second even after trying the power button multiple time i also tried pressing the reset button on the back and i even unplugged the unit from the wall and let it sit for several hour i then checked the voltage level of the battery at the main connector and it measured 52 volt which is normal the unit would not turn on to provide battery backup power and would not even pas through power from the electrical outlet it wa is completely dead since nothing i d checked had helped i called cyber power technical support who told me to check the battery voltage after i said that i d already done this the tech support agent simply said that since the unit wa out of warranty it would be best to purchase a new unit according to him there is no repair available for such an expensive product i m amazed that a 700 device is simply treated a a disposable item i ll be going back to an apc product after this adventure even though their product tend to cost a bit more than similar cyber power unit unfortunately i cannot recommend cyber power product over the long term
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Header: finally found a ups that work
Review: we live in the santa cruz mountain and have bad power sag spike and outage we have burned up at least ten upss no exaggeration from various manufacturer apc belkin tripplite etc ranging all the way up to 1100 watt and costing up to 250 per device nothing worked then we saw very positive review for cyberpower liked the spec true sine wave very long backup time etc and bought two of these unit what a difference installation involved plugging them in no battery to connect it arrived connected configuration involved installing the software which took about 60 second and that wa it we ve had lot of rain and wind already this winter and these upss have kept our two big computer two laptop router firewall switch wireless and multiple 1600x1200 flat panel running perfectly most amazingly we had an outage this morning for an hour and when the power came back on our computer were still running email wa still up nothing had shut down at all because there wa so much power in reserve and because we have amazon prime shipping for these heavy beast wa free these may seem expensive but not nearly a expensive a throwing away a couple thousand dollar worth of burned up upss that didn t work
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Header: it worked great not impressed at all now
Review: do not buy purchased this unit for server backup in our data center to replace a 6 year old competitive brand with dead battery it failed after 3 week in service still trying to get some resolution until it failed it worked great not impressed at all now do not recommend this product
Product: CyberPower PR3000LCDRTXL2U Smart App Sinewave UPS System, 3000VA/3000W, 8 Outlets, AVR, 2U Rack/Tower

Header: it all work very well and is very reliable
Review: i m in the process of moving from 18 x 10 node to an insteon system all of the insteon gear is absolutely reliable it take a little time to get used the process of creating and scheduling scene the instruction could be a little more user friendly and there are some capability which may be missing for example a device switching off on off and dimming brightening during one 24 hour period also there cannot be more than one scene which us sunset and or sunrise for scheduling time note that i may be having these issue because i ve spent over 15 year with x 10 as the hub is ota upgradable and smartphone app is too the chance are these feature will be enhanced over time so far these are nit for me and overall i am very optimistic about insteon
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: expensive for what it is but work well
Review: it work for what i needed which is to turn on my amazon basics bluetooth receiver when i tell alexa to turn on amazon music through the harmony hub and then instruct her a to what to play this way her everyday voice is through her internal speaker and sound only go the bluetooth route when the av system is in 5 channel music mode and the bluetooth receiver is on the plug responds quickly and seems to work just fine even though i have it plugged into surge protector ups there are cheaper option but since i already had the insteon hub and dimmer module bundle got really cheap at warehouse club i went with this
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: great product but couldn t properly pair to 2 motion sensor a originally intended
Review: i love this product work exactly a described with no problem and easy setup i initially bought it for my christmas tree light i wanted to have it paired to two motion sensor one at my front entrance and one at the back so that entering the house by either door would turn on the light while it wa capable of pairing to both motion sensor the switch wouldn t work consistently sometimes it worked fine and either motion sensor could trigger light on sometimes only 1 would work and sometimes none would work but when paired to 1 motion sensor the system worked flawlessly i am not sure whether it wa this product or the insteon motion sensor causing the conflict i also did have problem when trying to unpair one of my motion sensor to this module the method to unpair a described in the manual didn t seem to work the easiest solution for me wa simply to factory reset the whole module overally great product i have recommended to friend and family already
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: excellent smart plug holds up good outdoors in the element if this unit is too far from the hub or another insteon unit which will repeat the signal it may lose connectivity to the hub and not operate properly this ha only happened to me once leading me to reposition the unit after resetting it a little patience and proper planning design will eliminate this problem

Review: i have four of these in our system if you need a physical on off switch for an appliance this is a good choice even if you want to use it indoors it ha a high wattage capacity so is perfect for heater or ac unit and since it is an actual switch and not a dimmer you are in no danger to short out a motor or appliance i use them for fountain and a heater and they have been outside for two year or more without any problem granted we are in la area so there isn t a lot of rain but we get load of fog and moisture and so far no problem highly reliable unit that sync quickly and don t need periodic re syncing i wish all my insteon item worked this well

Header: works great love insteon wallet wish it wa cheaper
Review: over the past 6 month i ve installed 2 of this particular lamplinc 1 of the older non dual band lamplinc a new dual band outlet receptacle not sure the proper name a number of switch and two 8 button keypad i ve also got the homelinc software and a smartlinc used exclusively a a timer for exterior light the new dual band module is much smaller than the older version that alone is worth the small price difference the extra 1 3 thickness really make a difference when trying to get the product behind a bookshelf the appearance is clean and simple not sure if the dual band is really needed but it s nice not to have phase coupler wart a i ve heard them called installed throughout the house a few tip about insteon in general first once you start you won t want to stop it felt like i wa ordering thing mostly from amazon for free prime shipping every other day second i have most of the first floor under insteon control and i cannot imagine doing the programing with either the homelinc software or something similar for the 8 button switch i have multiple scene and would have pulled my hair out trying to program it all manually third if you get 6 or 8 button switch spend the 20 and get custom button made it will impress your friend and most importantly stop your wife from complaining the house is smarter than me lastly get the homelinc or similar software did i mention this before really just do it imagine you have a program set up with 3 lamp and 2 circuit of overhead light and your wife mention i still think this is a little too bright for the morning without software this is a nightmare to fix with the software you can make the adjustment in 3 minute it took my family a month or so to get the system dialed in exactly for our need the software made me utilize the system much more than i would of if everything wa manual good luck and happy automation
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: great replacement for the x10 equipment
Review: i have been having great luck with the insteon stuff i have been transitioning from x10 with a lot of success so far i have put in 5 wall dimmer 3 plug in dimmer 1 on off plug in module and one 1 on off wall switch wired to a relay for a 220 application and all are working perfect i bought the 2242 hub which can only be used with a smart device app the sunset sunrise option is a actually linked to the timeline you use which mean it is dark when the light come on if you use that option i used a different time zone to get light to come on a little earlier with the scene i just have to remember the difference when programming light by time the scene through the app are not that difficult to set up once you get the hang of it it doe not give you the security option of varying the on time so i am going to go with the usb hub and see if that work better the not so good with led s being controlled through the wall switch they tend to flicker slightly when on really low intensity and the hub is querying the light when the app try to connect this happens during slow connection now the real bad if you lose internet connection you completely lose access to the 2242 hub even under local wi fi this is such a basic level flaw that i consider a fatal flaw hence the reason for going to a usb hub so for the insteon switch and response 5 star because it all work and communicates great if i were rating the entire system with the current hub 3 star
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: an awesome product ideal for vintage christmas light
Review: i love this little device i had been looking for over a year for something that would work well for a vintage christmas tree stand with built in c6 bulb that ran way too hot this wa the perfect option not only doe remember your dimness setting even if you power the outlet off but it also give you the option of slowly increasing the current to your final brightness or going straight to that level with no cycling through full brightness i also want to compliment the smarthome tech support staff when i first tried the dimmer i thought it didn t work because if you tap the up or down button it act a a simple on off switch you have to continuously hold the down button to dim it until you reach the desired level so i called them up within a couple minute i wa speaking to a native english speaker who quickly and courteously helped me out so not only is it a good product but also ha a good support staff to back it up i would definitely buy this again highly recommended for any dimmable light but particularly delicate vintage set

Header: happy with these device work much better than x10
Review: i have been having great luck with the insteon stuff i have been transitioning from x10 with a lot of success so far i have put in 5 wall dimmer 3 plug in dimmer 1 on off plug in module and one 1 on off wall switch wired to a relay for a 220 application and all are working perfect i bought the 2242 hub which can only be used with a smart device app the sunset sunrise option is a actually linked to the timeline you use which mean it is dark when the light come on if you use that option i used a different time zone to get light to come on a little earlier with the scene i just have to remember the difference when programming light by time the scene through the app are not that difficult to set up once you get the hang of it it doe not give you the security option of varying the on time so i am going to go with the usb hub and see if that work better the not so good with led s being controlled through the wall switch they tend to flicker slightly when on really low intensity and the hub is querying the light when the app try to connect this happens during slow connection now the real bad if you lose internet connection you completely lose access to the 2242 hub even under local wi fi this is such a basic level flaw that i consider a fatal flaw hence the reason for going to a usb hub so for the insteon switch and response 5 star because it all work and communicates great if i were rating the entire system with the current hub 3 star
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: great feature and form factor disrupts older unit
Review: i bought two of these unit hoping to use them a signal bridge and improve my network coverage i had a couple of dead spot where a switchlinc would get flakey reception in a 75 unit installation after i added two of these unit to the configuration replacing lamplinc s everything got very flakey watching with a scope there is negligible noise on the line a little switching noise from various dimmer yet group command are now about a reliable a x10 even with the group cleanup stuff my installation is almost all older original gen unit from 2004 and i suspect that firmware bug in them are not playing well with the newer unit as a counter example i have a friend with about 70 unit that are all new and include some of these newer lamplincs and he ha no issue with them a signal bridge for now i m just living with the flakiness and have programmed my isy 99 to repeat group command several time to insure they occur just like in the x10 day it wa nice for a couple of year having a solid system but i m not willing to replace everything again to clear this up
Product: Insteon Outdoor Smart Plug, On/Off, Works with Amazon Alexa
