Review: great for turning lamp on and off in the house based on sunrise and sunset rather than a specific time
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: purchased this because i wanted to be able to remotely power cycle my home server while away unfortunately these wemo switch seem to every once in awhile shut off and take down whatever device wa connected to it opening the app or pressing the button on the switch is enough to bring the device back up but since the intent wa to minimize the amount of downtime this device failed it s main objective by adding new problem into the mix i replaced my previous model and have a second on another computer a well all 3 have done it at random interval not enough for it to be a huge problem but enough for it to be a major annoyance i also didn t like how the mobile remote setup is done i want to open up a port in my router forward it to the device and have a web page with login that i can access when away instead i have to launch the app while on the same wifi network and hope that the setup is robust enough to survive any potential network ip change while i m away their method is significantly easier to initially set up but i want flexibility if you just have a simple use case i want to turn this lamp on while i m away then this work the programming is good enough for a lamp timer but my setting somehow got erased after an update and if you don t care about remote on off then a simple dump 5 timer will do the job just a well ended up just buying a real web power switch to do an even better job at what i want
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: i have two installed 260 mile from my house and they work i can turn on and off two different 120v appliance hour before i arrive very nice installation can be a nightmare one wa easy one took a half hour of resetting rebooting etc power failure seem to have no effect they both come right back on line after ipad use work have not tried any other device so far so good i wa very skeptical i ran a 1500watt heater through one for a couple hour to see how it handled it and no problem it got somewhat warm that is all works from my home network 260 mile away or verizon lte anywhere great idea i have been looking for year more thought after some use 1 needs good strong wifi signal for these switch to work consistently marginal wifi will make operation sporatic 2 the rule you can establish using the ipad app work well and are stored on the switch not on the app so they will work if your ipad is disconnected or off this is very important and i feel they designed this well if no connectivity the rule will still function 3 ifttt is great work well and is something to learn about amazing turn on a heater when it snow turn on a light at sunset flash a light when a email arrives text when a wemo switch is turned on or off or both lot more etc 4 one ipad iphone can control one set of switch on one wifi if you want to control two set of switch on different wifi such a at different location you need another app on a different ipad iphone one each that is it

Review: if you re planning to use the wemo smart plug with the samsung smartthings hub think twice mine ha been a source of endless problem especially when compared with z wave alternative let s start with the basic this plug is enormous and ugly it if you install it in the top socket of a duplex receptacle it doesn t quite block the lower socket but you ll need a relatively slim cord to be able to use it the device ha a prominent lighted on off switch which is good since you ll need to use it frequently the device requires a connection to your wifi network so setup is a little more involved than with a z wave switch controlling the wemo smart plug via the wemo iphone app frequently work but doesn t allow any sort of automation you press the software button and the light turn on press it again and the light turn off occasionally you ll have to tap the software button multiple time to get the switch to activate connecting the wemo smart plug to your smartthings hub is comparatively easy once you ve connected it to your wifi network keeping it online and usable by smartthings is where the problem start all of my smartthings connected device are eminently reliable except the wemo smart plug every couple of day it will show up a being offline for no apparent reason and the only way to make it work again is to physically unplug it from the wall then plug it in again so that it reboots usually that s all that s necessary to get the wemo working again but the disconnect happen frequently enough that you simply can t rely on this switch to work i ve had one or two occasion where a simple reboot didn t work and i ended up having to delete the switch from smartthings repair it and then update all of the smartapps and routines that used it if you need a reliable smart plug i would recommend using the ge lighting duplex receptacle for in wall installation or a z wave controlled smart plug like the samsung smartthings outlet ge lighting appliance module or ge lighting lamp module with dimmer control all of these are far more reliable than the wemo smart plug in my experience

Review: these work well for low power item like a lamp or a lamp but absolutely do not use on anything that is mid to high wattage like a heater or laptop desktop computer a the wemo will melt your power cord and burn the wemo unit once the wemo get burnt it is really no longer safe to use and also break the wifi functionality they claim it can handle up to 1800 watt but i believe they must be measuring in peak and not rms because i have had two of these burn and melt fusing the power cord permanently to the wemo i don t know why there is no thermal safety sensor thermal breaker or even software update that could calculate watt usage over time and have adjustable safty shut off prior to melting and causing electrical fire i guess a few dozen house or apartment complex have to burn down first before belkin update this serious design flaw i would recommend not to us these on any item that require sustained level of power greater than that of a 60 incandescent bulb serious fire hazard

Header: works but not without connectivity issue and logic setting improvement plus now random power recycling
Review: when it come to remote wifi switch or anything with networking review are always mixed i purchased a different wifi switch and it wa not even recognized by my phone so i returned it i tried the belkin and had luck in establishing a connection and set it up to start with the instruction could be a little more clearer be patient and look up video even during my setup i had issue connecting the device and the firmware upgrade wa wonky i also saw a review about one that wa burned that wa connected to a heater and i have to disagree with the review first it is rated for 15a resistive loading i have a heater rated at 15a but that is inductive load big difference in power dissipation at maximum loading the actual power dissipated would be more than rated power which would burn the device i just set my heater switch to one and that s it for the price i would have liked to see energy usage i also don t like the logic setting for the schedule however it work so i ll see what happens i m yet to monitor out of home operation so we ll see updated on 12 13 2016 i ve down graded to 2 star i have a voip adapter that somehow need daily power recycling so i am using this to just that i wa on my computer and saw heard the smart plug recycling power every so often hence my phone wa cutting in and out i ve ordered the tp link so we ll see i m buying an ev and will need a reliable smart switch switch to do what need to be done

Header: buggy software make this unreliable and potentially unsafe
Review: i purchased this product to control an espresso machine hoping it would preheat the machine before i woke up in the morning i have had a very mixed experience with this product and all of it seems to boil down to bug in the wemo software my quick summary is that the product is good but that the recurring software problem left me with the opinion that this isn t just a bad product it can also become an unsafe product depending on what you are controlling with that outlet wemo illustrates an iron being controlled by this outlet imagine what could happen if that came on at the wrong time it is just too unreliable in the 10 month i have owned this product the one recurring theme ha been that at various time the outlet ha turned on when it wasn t supposed to according to the rule i have set two of the three period where i saw this happen were the week after the clock changed for daylight savings time when i first got the product thing were off by one hour so i adjusted my rule to match that error then one day they corrected something and the rule started running on time when daylight savings time began i had to reset everything to get it working right the outlet would turn on at the wrong time most recently following the end of daylight savings time the outlet is coming on at 7pm instead of 8am so it isn t just a matter of them losing track of one hour once the setup go into this mode the only solution is to start over with the configuration they have again directed me to reinstall my entire setup mobile software resetting the outlet device and re entering the rule it is consuming more time than it is worth a simple mechanical timer would be more reliable than this thing i think if you have the patience to fiddle with their software and endure through the problem when they arise then maybe wemo is for you i ve had my fill of it at this point

Header: doesn t work perfectly with amazon echo easy setup
Review: just got my switch i have never used a switch like this before but it wa pretty easy to setup and get working with my echo i used the ios wemo app on an ipad air 2 i did wait 10 minute while it said it updated the unit s firmware so far i really like it hopefully it will keep working without issue only time will tell but i wa pleasantly surprised after all the negativity it s working great at least for now i can now turn on and off my light by simply saying alexa turn on the light or alexa turn off the light should anything change then i ll update this review yes see below update 2015 10 18 i m reducing my rating to 4 star because sometimes when i tell alexa to turn the light on or off she say ok but the light doesn t turn on or off asking the same thing again usually work but it s annoying update 2015 12 01 seems to be working much better after the last firmware update that fixed memory leak and other stuff i want another now to control the christmas tree update 2016 11 21 downrating to 3 star because i m trying to setup some new switch and it is taking me way more time that it should due to bug and quirk very frustrating i would have thought they would have gotten this process fixed by now

Header: beware electronic v manual on off switch
Review: received this yesterday 01 05 16 set it up in the afternoon instruction that come with the switch leave much to be desired lacking is an understatement took me a while to set it up properly but finally got it despite my effort i could not get it to turn on my room air cleaner they would turn off using the android app and voice command with alexa but would not turn on my air cleaner have electronic on off switching the belkin web site state plug any device or appliance into the switch you can but it may not work i then contacted belkin using a chat support portal the support person told me through his text reply s that these switch only work with manual on off switch not with electronic on off switch fact is most all modern electronics come with electronic switch i can only imagine how many people have ordered these switch and spent time trying to figure out how to configure them returning them in frustration or writing the cost off a a loss the promotion of these switch by belkin seems a bit deceptive to me yes i am unhappy with this switch i saw it a a way to make my amazon dot more useful
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: nine hour and 40 reboots to set up three device
Review: i have seven of these switch four are the plugin type and three are the wall switch the wall switch are pure crap and constantly loose there signal even when the wifi signal is full strength as bad a the hardware is the software is even worse i had previously installed two of the light switch and two of the plugin device the setup for the first four device wa very time consuming and i had many problem the documentation is useless the three device i installed yesterday had so many problem that it took nine hours to get them to run and this is after i had already set up the previous four so i know how these should operate and i have a lot of experience in setting them up i have a very fast internet and wifi connection and the firmware update took hour at one point i lost the connection to all of the device i had to cycle the power to various device and during the nine hour period i had to reboot my new iphone 6 plus over 40 time the belkin software is so poor that you need to reboot you phone over and over again to discover the device at this point it is hit or miss a to the number of device that will show up and i have never been able to get one of them to show up on my ipad the concept is great and when they work they are great but i ll buy a different brand in the future

Review: the set up of this product is absolutely ridiculous i have again wasted no le than 3 hour of my time trying to set it up and on the phone with wemo s customer service for over an hour and i still do not have my second device connected it took over 2 hour to get the first one connected as for the second device that gave me angst today be aware that you can only use wemo device in one location i happen to have an alexa at my home and one at my studio both alexa device work exceptionally well and one cell phone it seems a though wemo s smart device cannot be connected to two different internet network even though it is two separate device in two separate location in other word it considers the cell phone the controlling device not alexa and cannot be overridden i am trashing this product and buying the competitor you would be well served to start your controller purchase somewhere else

Header: the user interface from hell v2 0
Review: i wasted a half hour trying to get this to work maybe i can t read english maybe i m too old i ll let my kid try before i turn this into a tire chock or use it for batting practice i d give it zero star if i could so i tried to get the wemo to work and it would not the online instruction were not helpful and the unit s reliance on blinking light make it like trying to have a meaningful conversation with an r2 unit my review here got their attention good and i spent about 40 minute today with one of their tech support people we did this and we did that repeatedly and then he had the good sense to check my router setting that turned out to be the problem my router asus had it control channel set to auto and the wemo doe better when the control channel is static of course this wa not in the online instruction my comment amout their ui still stand but them reaching out to me to sort this make a huge difference in this customer s mind their instruction need to be re written perhaps by a real tech writer so i will revise their star to four from zero and had we not done this exercise they would have gotten a five

Header: i am always amaze at these large company allocate very little budget in
Review: i am always amaze at these large company allocate very little budget in making the product plug n play reliable but spend million on packing and branding and yet no one in their own company test and used their own product you would think belkin could design a wireless switch to turn on off reliably take a note of all the negative review and either include some detail trouble shooting instruction or pull the product off the shelf belkin make simple instruction to a device that doe not simply work out of the box wemo switch came with only iconic instruction with le than a dozen word on it there are two push button on the device with no mention to them on any packaging or instruction like the button there is a multi color led with no information either why put on push button and multicolor led if you are not going to even describe what they are used for i discovered the wemo on my wifi network and worked fine with ios device but when i went to use it with another device the wemo no longer broadcast it network i started to guess maybe you have to push on of the two button or put it into another state unplug power to it and reapplied power instead of wasting more time guessing on how to trouble shoot the product i felt my time wa worth more posting a review i thought it would be better to use a red color button indication when power is applied to the switch using the smart phone application instead of green on the display i did not even bother installing the wemo light switch after the outlet switch unit did not work a advertised talking to my fellow co worker he said the rf connection is probably flaky because of it antenna design mounted inside an electrical box surrounded with wire also belkin software app programmer must have written a bunch of spaghetti code for an application so simple is 60mb in size to turn on off a switch i saw other user posting the same problem with the unit stop broadcasting it network with no clear fix

Header: the jetson s have arrived great basic home automation to be had
Review: if you own a smartphone or the amazon echo these device allow some great automation in the form of turning thing on and off after plugging this in downloading the app to my android phone i wa up and running in about 2 minute i went to the echo app and grouped this to the living room it wa a easy a telling alexa amazon echo to turn on turn off the living room light worked perfectly pros easy to install and configure easy to group device to control section or area no fluff simple and worked with the amazon echo cons pretty pricey that wa my only complaint i like the device it worked flawlessly with the echo i just purchased and i am excited to do some home automation but if you add up the cost each room can easily go over 100 i had to be very selective in what device in what room i opted to configure this for a couple of light and switch here and there around a small home it s not a big deal otherwise figure this into your overall budget

Header: while there were many whiny review i took a shot
Review: well i am quite a nerd i want to have a house that can be fully controlled using my iphone this belkin wemo switch wa the next step i could read many people saying that it would brick or that the connectivity would not work etc but amazon decrease the price to 40 and with an additional free 10 gift card it wa the best time to go and try this switch well it took me le than 5 minute to sync the belkin to my wifi router you first need to download the app then go to wifi and connect to the wemo not your router then go to the app and do the adjustment it works that s all i don t know why many people have issue because it wa very very easy also i have some issue with wifi and the belkin still get it the switch is very responsive via wifi and a little le via 3g remote like 1 second lag ifttt work great too for example you can create a rule to blink your light when your favorite sport team will start a game or more effectively when you arrive to your place using gps i love this device and purchased two more

Header: app make this switch a pain to deal with
Review: the plug itself might be okay and when it is paired it doe work well but the number of problem with it meant i had to return it 1 pairing is extremely painful and unreliable for starter the app for some reason kept looking for the plug on my cellular 3g connection obviously not finding any plug there instead of the wemo switch own wi fi network which i wa connected to after i turned off cellular data on my phone it finally decided to use the wemo switch wi fi and discovered the switch the entire process wa punctuated every few second by the app just hanging during discovery or wi fi connection 2 i had two of these switch and one of the switch wa just never discovered at all or paired 3 the switch that did pair kept losing it connection every few day making the home automation unreliable i think all of these problem really stem from a poorly written android app which definitely hang if you have to go to another app in the middle of the process and switched back to it but even if you stay on the app it will eventually hang when working the switch work beautifully the away mode is nicely done and the switch is operable remotely but the setup and constant disconnect meant i had to give this up i researched some more and ended up buying the tp link smart plug wi fi works with alexa which while having some problem of it own paired without problem and work very nicely

Header: can t add already set up device when remote make this product worthless
Review: i really wanted to like this product i keep a slingbox set up attached to a cable box at my parent s house a i tend to travel around a bit and don t want to pay for another tv service at my own apartment since my slingbox is rather old it tends to lock up at time and require a power cycle to get back in a working state so i bought this a it wa cheaper than most other network control power switch on the market and seemed pretty simple to set up and use it worked great exactly a i wa hoping for the first month or so it wa pretty simple to set up and worked flawlessly whenever i needed to use it however after a month or two of use it suddenly stopped working trying to do anything in the wemo app didn t respond so i wa sol regarding trying to use my device eventually when i got back to my parent house even on the local network the device wouldn t work i ended up having to do a manual factory reset of the device in order to get it back and usable after the factory reset it worked fine however my biggest complaint is the wemo app s lack of having any form of account management i m currently nowhere near my parent house and my phone died so i had to get a new one with my new phone when i installed the wemo app there no way for me to recover my old list of device the only thing the app let me do is add new device connected to my local network however since i m nowhere near my wemo switch that is impossible and so i m once again without access to controlling my device if they added the ability to recover our device remotely this review would instantly go back to a 4 star review for a device that s intended purpose it to allow you to control it from anywhere in the world not having a way of re setting up access to it when remote is a huge flaw in their design tldr device work well enough however the lack of ability to setup add your wemo switch on a new device unless you re physically at the device is a huge design flaw that keep this device from being useful
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: 1 month later it would no longer connect to my wifi tried resetting and it just doesnt work anymore dont waste your money update this device work ok however the app that come with it is not very user friendly unfortunately this device is nothing more than a glorified wifi switch without a good app to go with it i have figured out after hour of trial and error that you need to disable remote setting and all that nonsense from all your device that use it not an easy task if you set it up with multiple device there should be a master reset option instead of these thing i tried using the help on the app without getting any either i have tried this both on an iphone and an android phone they are equally difficult to manage and maintain sometimes the remote access feature doe not work for me at all so i would have to be in the wifi network to use it i think a lot of improvement is needed for this device to be useful at all i m leaving this with a 1 star review because all it s done so far is annoy me with multiple unintelligent setting and terrible re setup update 2016 other than a 5ghz wifi band incompatibility after it is set up it work very well with amazon echo i am bumping this up to 2 star because the app still isn t good with it but is functional and very convenient with echo

Review: what a great idea what poor poor execution these bad boy went on sale so i picked up three right off the bat it took me about 2 hour to set up the 3 the android app struggled with connecting to the actual product to the wifi and really just about everything once i finally got them up and running i find that for some reason when i m within my network i cannot see the name i set for my wemo s in fact i can t do anything but turn them off and on from within my network i try to contact support and they tell me i should try some generic reset everything technique that sounded like a canned response so i download the older beta app and finally i can see what i m actually turning on and turning off funny that an app that is about 6 month older work better than the new one right well today they just stop working so now i have no choice but to try reset them this is where it get bad it take 10 to 20 try just to use the physical button on the device to reset them tie that in with the usual unable to actually set up anything correctly app and i m 4 hour in and only one is actually setup one i would not recommend this product to anyone not in it s current form i think the android app is most to blame the app unbelievably deficient slow and just doesn t work most the time i would return these if i wasn t so head hard and intent on making them work for me but please whatever you do save yourself the pain

Header: the reaction time of the works absolutely seamlessly with the amazon echo alexa they need to add dimming
Review: had some issue finding a compatible version of android to configure this with android n beta would not work android 4 3 worked i haven t tried setting one up since n ha been officially released once set up the app work well for what it is it provides quick accessibility to the on off feature of the switch the reaction time of the switch to app command is fantastic works absolutely seamlessly with the amazon echo alexa easy to add to echo easy to control the switch with voice control no additional trigger word needed just direct voice command the scheduling is nice but i wish i could set up a random on off sequence for the time where i am away from the home for extended period this is a minor complaint though a bigger issue is no support for dimming a lamp i get that there is a little added cost and complexity from adding dimming but at this price point this feature is expected once this feature is added i m buying one of these for every outlet in my home

Header: when a product fails at it primary purpose it is useless
Review: look for a different switch these are terrible i bought three of them i started with two the set up wa not a easy a it should be one of them took five try to get it set up the app is awful it is confusing and difficult to figure out how to assign share and configure rule i consider myself to be more than moderately tech savvy if you are not that then i would imagine setting this up and working the app would be near impossible ok so i get the first two set up and they are working fairly well at first so i buy a third one with the experience of setting the first two up this one wa slightly le difficult to set up but still not a easy a it should be almost immediately the third one would go on and off randomly during it scheduled time to be on maybe resetting it and starting over may have solved this but the set up is so painful on these that i never did it i guess they recently did an update of the firmware on these and after that now none of the light turn poff they turn on when scheduled but they do not shut off so i took the irritating frustrating and painful time to reset all three of the switch guess what they still do not turn off i awoke the next morning to all three light being on i am not sure if the resetting ha or ha not fixed the random on off of the third one a i really didn t pay attention and i just did this all yesterday i think the worst part of this is the seeming indifference of wemo to even acknowledge this a quick check online show that this is a common issue with wemo owner all over for sometime some people who have contacted wemo state that wemo give them some form of it is not u it is you response i will give it this it doe interact with the echo well and i do enjoy that aspect but that is a secondary reason i bought these certainly a reason but the main reason i have these is to turn light on and off if they do not do that reliably then i consider them useless the sad thing is well it should be sad for wemo that i wa just getting ready to buy 2 or 3 more of these again i am a fairly competent person with tech stuff i can set up almost anything even more complicated household installation so i can say with certainty it is not me it is them i will be looking for a different brand do not buy wemo

Header: works but not sure if my phone s wifi connection is le secure now because of the wemo
Review: i m no tech wizard so please don t hold my ignorance against me i wa unsure if this wa going to work for my room based on some of the online review but overall i m glad i bought this because it did exactly what i needed it to do which wa create a remote controlled light i had a plug located in an inconvenient location and it made it difficult to use the light switch on the wall to turn the light on and off in my room thanks to the wemo i only had to worry about plugging in my lamp once and i never had to touch the light switch on the wall again one thing that i m not really comfortable with is that the wemo set up required that i route the wifi connection of my smartphone through the wemo app software versus connecting my phone directly to my home wifi like it used to be before the wemo now when i use my phone at home to browse the web i get constant error message stating that my phone is not connected to the internet maybe i made a mistake during set up but it s really annoying and somewhat unsettling to think my connection may be compromised

Header: belkin wemo switch good for target practice only
Review: of the almost 40 iot and home automation device sensor hub and platform that i have used tested and integrated into my home the wemo switch wa alway s the first to fail quite possibly the worst home automation product i have ever owned consistent at one thing going offline and you can be guaranteed that when you do a firmware update you ll have to reset the device any schedule you had and any integration with product like smartthings since it is wifi based only and ha no real local functional reliability it need cloud integration to automate with other non belkin sensor it will consistently fail when you have daylight saving s transition firmware upgrade power outage or any internet home networking interruption one would expect some level of redundancy so that during any of those event it could revert to last known setting or through battery backup non volatile memory etc provide a little redundancy but it doesn t it is good however for target practice

Header: alexa wanted nothing to do with this thing
Review: this thing is absolute junk wemo switch probably all of these also backwards engineering ridiculous idea on how ifttt should bend around them plus alexa hate it as in the echo didn t find it didn t want to find it and preferred to not integrate and have it circuitry mixed up touched synchronized or associated with this thing please don t think i m just here to bash this item a i m not in fact i can t remember the last time i wrote a review but this thing pi ed me off so much i thought i d possibly save someone else the headache the setup process is beyond logic a in you have to download their app install it on your phone using wifi then disconnect use their network being broadcast from the switch to get it registered to the app then switch back to wifi and complete the process i wa able to get the switch to turn on and off from the app but not with alexa which wa the main reason for getting this nor wa i able to use it from my phone using the cellular network and yes i had a signal and wa able to use other apps only on wifi the thing also seemed a bit warm for my taste and it took up too much of the plug to be able to effectively use the other outlet look i wanted to like this and i wanted to use it but it just doesn t do or live up to anything close to what it say it can or eludes to being able to do without sounding conceited i am pretty competent when it come to electronics and technology so i knew what i wa doing but this thing is just a joke and i guess i should ve known better than to trust belkin a i have never thought too much of their product before and even le now researching through the so called help they have posted and listed throughout the internet just show the lack of support or care because i obviously wasn t the first person to have any of these problem i already requested a return and will be shipping it back tomorrow i can get my money back but not the time i wasted on this don t do what i did look for something else which is what i will be doing mike

Review: this worked well for a little bit i wa having trouble with my internet my provider while trying to get my internet speed working correctly i updated the firmware on my router and had shut it down to reboot a couple time as soon a i had done that my wemo switch quit working the app couldn t find the device and the switch just flashed orange i tried the tech support web sight and the web sight came up blank not kidding nothing so i went back to amazon and read the review that helped i deleted the app on my phone and then reinstalled the app i powered down the wemo unplugged i then held the reset switch while plugging it back in i went through the setup process again and found the wemo network again to connect to the app the app pulled up and found it and connected but it would not set up the remote connection failed i thought it wa going to work though and i wa back up and running but then it started flashing orange again the app couldn t find the wemo again so i give up i feel frustrated and like i wasted 40 buck do not power down or change your router in any way you will screw everything up trust me

Header: continuously loses wifi connectivity rendering it useless
Review: i bought two of these in hope of controlling two wall plug track light in my living room set up wa relatively easy using the wemo app for ios i tried on my android and it failed to control either device when associated with it own wireless network i had to configure a 2 4ghz network on my access point i only broadcasted in 5ghz but these thing don t support 5ghz the deal break for me with these is how inconsistent they work with my amazon echo i configured the echo to control the two so i could turn my light on and off via voice command they constantly lose connection to my network and a a result the echo can t communicate and control them i set reservation for them on my router so they always picked up the same ip and setting a continuous ping to them revealed how they lost and regained access to my wifi randomly i have no other device on my network that doe this i wish it worked reliably when it doe work it s great but for the great majority of the time they simply don t work

Header: i bought one wemo smart plug and one orvibo smart plug in hope that
Review: i bought one wemo smart plug and one orvibo smart plug in hope that highly rated wemo would provide reliability and easy to use experience and use it at some critical place while use much cheaper orvibo at not so critical place after going through initial setup and few hour of usage the result is quite different from what i expected the setup process on wemo is confusing and took longer time once all set i got disconnected from the device many time and the worst of all sometimes when i flip the switch on my smartphone the app indicates the switch is on but in reality it is off the setup for orvibo is easy and straight forward i never get connection problem and it work reliably i tried with wifi connection and lte connection manual switch and timer all worked a expected i have returned wemo and ordered another orvibo
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: to begin with the wemo switch isn t a sufficiently robust player in the wifi world plugged into an outlet in a room with a strong network signal according to four cell phone two laptop and a signal strength meter the wemo continually faded in and out of availability a if faraday s ghost were wandering between me and the switch if i have to spend a couple of minute rediscovering switch every time i run the wemo app i might just a well use the time to walk into the room where the light is and that s after the mandatory you re asked if you want it but it doesn t matter what you pick software upgrade which take so long i expected to see the code delivered by a telegram messenger on my front porch but even if the hardware were reliable the wemo app for android wa shipped before it wa finished not just before qa mind you which would have put on brake had it happened at all but before the design wa done the ux designer wa evidently my next door neighbor s feeble minded golden retriever edit the device name go ahead but by the way you ll always see the factory default so change it a often a you like specify a programmed on time have at it we assume you ll never want to turn it off isn t that right turn on at dusk fine but we ll define dusk not by light but by a forecast for your city provided that you live in a place of our choice state capital and populous city omitted at random have a map handy fun idea but this product is not ready to ship i take that back about the dog dogs are color blind so the ui might have been more accessible if actually canine designed

Header: great product on paper that doesn t work in reality
Review: on paper this is 1 of the best smart switch i especially liked the integration with alexa and ifttt but unfortunately this is a seriously flawed product because of it unreliability i got this switch to work the first time successfully then tried to move it and it never worked again even after half a dozen reset technical support wa unable to resolve the issue and in the end wanted me to make all kind of change to my network that shouldn t have anything to do with the connectivity problem changing the channel of the 2 4ghz band that my router were transmitting on and disabling the security my suspicion is that they hacked this product together by a team unrelated to the router team or it wa through an acquisition how else can you explain a renowned wi fi router producer that can t produce a reliable easy to use connected smart switch even when it worked the first time it took way too long to connect the phone to the switch and then set it up inside the wi fi network all sign of bad product development in short believe the 1 star review this time and don t snooker yourself buying half a dozen of these and be stuck with brick after a few month i m switching to tp link even though they don t have ifttt integration yet

Header: using outdoors 100 from router works perfect

Review: i should have listened to the other reviewer fortunately i can return it it took some doing to get this set up you need to connect the phone to the wemo s own wifi network and from there you enter your home wifi info problem is that my phone galaxy s3 always scan for the best network so after a minute or so it would revert to my home network i found a work around for that and got it to work feeling slightly smug with this small victory i headed out for some errand i glanced at my phone and noticed the 4g symbol wasn t there nor wa the 3g after lot of reset and experimentation i realized that for some reason the wemo software is preventing my phone from connecting to the data network i took the software off and the 4g came back i really wanted the wemo switch to work so i reinstalled the software to give it a second chance same result i m printing up my return label now

Header: they seem to only work properly for a short amount of time before being borderline useless i purchased two of these outlet swit
Review: i have always had problem with belkin product they seem to only work properly for a short amount of time before being borderline useless i purchased two of these outlet switch with the intention of being able to control the connected device my computer monitor via either the amazon echo or my smartthings hub for a time it work great with no issue but then either a firmware update will come out or it just will not be detected by echo or st anymore i will add that anytime i pull up the app the switch always show up and can be controlled manually just fine for me though the whole point of getting all these smart home device wa so i would not need to be tethered to my phone or tablet to control them if you re one of those people that can t walk 2 foot anywhere without your phone in your hand i suppose this will not be an issue if you re ok with not having st connectivity get the tp link switch instead installation wa a breeze by comparison and my echo discovered it right away i believe the tp link doe not have the correct frequency to connect to st but if the alternative is a switch that only work some of the time it s relatively the same thing to me don t support poor hardware and cumbersome software

Header: then it popped up like i d been successful on the reinstall before
Review: first the wemo app would not download and install took several attempt first attempt to join a wemo wi fi network on my ipod touch wa successful wemo switch 90e but when i tried the next step to watch it find and connect to my home network it located a signal so and i entered the wi fi network name i don t transmit my ssid and then i entered the wi fi password it timed out without success again and again so on a hunch i googled doe wemo use 5ghz network and guess what so i connected my ipod touch to my 2 4ghz network and tried to start over but the wemo app kept trying to connect to the 5ghz network and wouldn t let me reentered any information so i had to forget that wemo wi fi network more on that later next i uninstalled the wemo app and tried to reinstall it but i wa unsuccessful so i rebooted my ipod touch then it popped up like i d been successful on the reinstall before so now i try again and it ha so totally forgotten the old wemo switch 90e that it can t find it at all so i try a new switch i bought 3 and it find the wemo switch 854 network no problem this time i enter the ssid and password for my 2 4gh network guess what it fails to find it again and again belkin wemo is not ready for prime time

Header: very unreliable avoid at all cost
Review: i really liked the idea of this switch and bought two of them in december one of them would only work when in the same room a the router orange flashing light with anything more than 10 foot from the router i returned this one the second had a better range and worked in a room about 40 foot from the router the set up wa ok but it required a software update on the switch i went away and set up a schedule for the switch for about a week everything worked perfectly after a week it stopped working and i get a flashing orange light in the mean time my wife threw away the packaging and so i wa forced to call belkin to try to arrange for a replacement i have just spent about 40 minute on the phone resetting the switch and trying to get it to work after this first call they would not let me return it but have authorized a higher level support person to call me within 48 hour to try some other thing painful painful they seem to be having a real qc problem with this switch i still like the idea of the switch and i like their software but i would not buy this until you start to see a consistent set of good review

Header: works great wish it wa smaller way too big for what it is
Review: this is not my first foray into wemo product so i wa familiar with the quick and easy setup i do prefer the insight switch over this smart plug primarily because this wemo switch feel like there is a lot of wasted plastic the wemo insight switch while more expensive ha a much smaller and more aesthetically pleasing footprint setup is easy a long a your device find your wireless network that seems to be the biggest struggle and it took a while for it to find the network i wish there wa a better way to set these up let me access the switch to select which network and put in a key instead of having to depend on the device just finding the right network there is not enough feedback on how the setup network connection is going in my opinion i love the option the wemo app give you turn on at sunset off at a pre defined time it s great the alexa enabled voice control is also excellent and ha simplified a lot of thing in our house i also have a wemo insight switch and a tp link smart switch the tp link and this are very similar but the tp link is cheaper i use both and both are alexa enabled so both are a good step toward a smart home environment

Header: so incredibly terrible and completely unusable
Review: i wanted to like this product i really liked the hub le idea but my user experience over the past 24 hour ha been dismal i d recommend the old x10 stuff before i d recommend this the first thing you need to do is get these moved from their own little network into your home s network to do this you need to download their android or ios app the number of permission that are requested by the app are stunning and disturbing they attempt to justify them but what really come out after you look around a bit is that they are completely unfamiliar with android development get comfortable with the innards of your phone because never before have you had to become so accustomed to your phone s force stop feature the app doesn t crash per se but it spends most of it time in a drugged out haze trying to remember the state of the world and the support document recommend uninstalling reinstalling force stopping and all kind of other indication of an app gone seriously seriously wrong but at least at this point you ve got light turning on and off but it all get so much worse once it asks for a firmware update the device ship with an ancient firmware such that it appears to take multiple step to get them up to the right level and each of those level is a nigh insurmountable task it start easy enough you just click the little upgrade button on the app that s when the blinking start the blinking oh god the blinking first it blink blue then green or is that amber then it turn off then it is blue again then it is off then it sits and blink amber for hour the documentation tell you that this mean that it is unable to connect to your network this is odd since the on off button still seem to function until they too stop responding and then they disappear from the network entirely so you re left with the one thing you ve been told to never do when updating firmware you power cycle it and it come back up maybe maybe you need to reset it maybe not but you might get it to show back up in the app after force closing and uninstalling and reinstalling it but you ll only discover that all those blinking light were nothing by a lie for it is still stuck at the original firmware version the blinking light now won t stop at all and you re beginning to think that saving the box wa a prescient move on your part after hour of fidgeting with this i m left thinking that my time is not worth this and these device need to go not back to the factory but to some third world electronics recycling fire where at least the device s burning corpse will keep a poor family warm for the night if they re able to sleep through all the blinking that is edit after continued misery with tech support they were returned today just in case it will save you time when you have to call them here s the script from the support people 1 what is the brand and model of wireless router 2 did you reset the wemo switch by holding the restore button for 15 second without the power and then plug in the wemo switch and still holding the restore button for another 15 second 3 have you tried using different handheld device in running upgrade 4 how far are the wemo switch from the router 5 have you tried changing the wireless channel of your router and used 1 3 6 9 11 6 did you clear cache or clear data on your android smart device 7 are you able to disable and enable remote access without any error 8 are the wemo rule created being followed after answering those question these came back 1 please change the wireless channel of your router and used 1 or 9 2 make sure the 2 4 ghz ssid wireless name is not the same 5 ghz ssid 3 check if the upnp is enabled on your router 4 ensure to disable igmp vlan vpn are other advanced security on the router 5 port forward or port trigger port on your router 3475 3478 5228 8080 and 8443 nevermind that you can only forward one port to one switch 6 disable enable remote access on wemo app 7 disable mobile data and connect to 2 4 ghz network and run firmware update i don t even know what this mean 8 lastly disable router firewall temporarily to allow firmware update of wemo to go through

Header: do you need to control your light from your phone
Review: the switch is a advertised however one should think about whether it will be useful if you re in a small apartment for example there isn t much reason to be able to control a light from your phone when you can easily take a few step to turn it off the main reason i purchased this wa for the scheduling feature to turn on a light in the morning a a visual alarm and in that regard it work albeit clunkily the app feel somewhat primitive and isn t easy to use for example it should be a straightforward exercise to set a time to turn on and off a switch with a single action instead it requires multiple step also the unit is fairly bulky and block another port on a power strip overall i can t say it s a bad product but i think it s worth asking if it s a needed component in your house

Header: pain to install and keep working not plug and play
Review: 1 5 star this wa a pain to deal with from the start installation took 3 4 attempt to fully get the device broadcasting and then getting the app to work with my wifi after finally getting it set up it worked for 2 day until a firmware update wa needed after that the wemo plug stopped broadcasting over wifi i had to do a manual reset which involves holding down this annoying restore button for upwards of 30 second after the plug wa restored i had to go through the set up process again with twice a many error got the device working again only to have the app not find the plug a device like this should be plug and play there should be no need to have to contact customer service to find out why the device isn t broadcasting router setting should not have to be changed and i sure shouldn t need to do a fresh install every time there is a firmware update perhaps update in the future will fix these issue but i am not paying 40 per plug to be a beta tester for belkin when it work it s extremely convenient but there are still far too many bug to recommend this for anyone

Review: there are two huge flaw with this device it doesn t work on 5 ghz wi fi which is really useful in congested urban area or apartment and more importantly can t handle secure network password the latter issue is a deal breaker if your wi fi password ha any character other than number and letter then this device can t connect to use it you need to lower the security profile of your network and use password that are easily prone to hacking given the recent spate of malware attack on iot device it really inconceivable that a mainstream company would be so extremely careless personally i m not going to change my network password and reconfigure a dozen device just to accommodate the limitation of the wemo switch unfortunately i didn t try to hook up the device right away so it probably can t be returned and it s become a pretty useless paperweight i love my phillips hue light and their alexa echo voice control i wa hoping that wemo would provide similar satisfaction but i have to recommend that people look at phillips and other option rather than wemo belkin

Header: good switches no hub required check out ifttt make sure the price is worth it for you
Review: good switches no hub required check out ifttt i m editing my review because i now own both the outlet switch and light switch i like the idea of having switch that don t require a hub like so many others do i own this light switch a well a the version that plug into an outlet see my review of that one a well i think that the wemo platform is stable and well thought out although i do wish there wa a laptop desktop non mobile interface if you only have a few switch it is fine but if you had like 3 or more it would get cumbersome don t let the other review scare you if you are technology competent i hesitated to buy this because of the connectivity problem in other review i can only conclude that those people are more like my grandmother than myself i will say that installing the light switch requires a bit of electrical knowledge or at least willingness to learn and a bit of patience with the wifi setup i also had to switch wifi network at one point and it wa a bit of a hassle and required a decent amount of googling around forum there is a helpful video on this page no it isn t absolutely an easy 1 2 3 set up but i don t really have any complaint either this thing doe what it say it doe ha a good app and work well for me in the app you can also set up more complicated rule for on off so it isn t like your light go on and off at the same time every day making it obvious they are on a timer you can use sunrise set i also like that you can disable rule without deleting them so i can basically have a set for when i m home and a set when i m out and it is a simple transition from one to the other what i like about the light switch a opposed to the outlet switch is that you can use it without the app you can just press the switch and never have to care that it is a wemo switch if you want this is nice because with the outlet switch you have to leave the lamp on and control it only with the app yes there is a button but it is inconvenient this mean that guest or anyone else ha to learn about your nutty setup just to turn on a lamp this light switch fix this problem and i really enjoy that i travel a lot for work and so i use these mostly a a light timer just so it isn t so obvious when i m not home what i like is that when i am in a hurry out the door i don t have to bother setting anything and i can just do it once i m waiting at the airport you can do all kind of nutty stuff like setting it up with a motion sensor but for me it is just a controllable light timer it should be noted that this literally 16x the price of a normal light timer so you pay a hefty premium for all of this i have the light switch installed in my bedroom and i use it to help myself wake up i m a heavy sleeper and having the light turn on is a huge help by the time you are reading this i will assume that you know that the light switch will require a neutral wire and a deep electrical box this is almost guaranteed in newer construction but you should check you switch box before purchasing obviously this doesn t apply to the outlet switch an often overlooked aspect of the wemo platform is the ifttt integration i think this provides two huge opportunity the first is that you can add do button to your lock screen this mean you can control the light without unlocking your phone or opening an app it s just like swiping up and opening the camera i ve included a picture of what this look like the second nice part of the ifttt is that you can utilize the actual if functionality for example i have mine setup so that if i lose my phone i can press and hold the light switch and it will call me however i bought the light switch when it wa 42 and it ha been going up in price i think that a it approach 50 the competition really open up and the alternative are worth consideration this is a 20 price hike and i think that is substantial also two minor complaint first the outlet switch itself if huge i feel like it should be 1 3 the size it is also the light switch ha an indicator light on it which is a bit bright for my taste you can see in one of the picture that i have a bit of card stock taped over it to make it dimmer
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: why is the wemo switch referred to here a wemo switch smart plug i find no reference to smart plug on the wemo website actually i think smart outlet would be a more appropriate name but wemo needs to give it a unque product name and and update their website so we can find stuff about this product on their website i ve tried to find an operation manual to no avail so i can find out what the restore button on the back of the thing is something so simple and yet nowhere to be found an operation manual would also hopefully document all state of the status light try looking for that info here or on wemo website impossible update 7sep2016 i stumbled upon didn t find it via search the status light info at 122247 search for 122247 on the wemo website support page i also stumbled upon what the restore button is for covered in a youtube video yuvfmvbq7wm search for yuvfmvbq7wm at youtube com that video tell you to press and hold the button while plugging the device back into the outlet and release after 5 10 second previously i wa just pressing the restore button without unplugging and replugging the device back in i did the correct procedure and my 3 wemo switches outlets have not dropped their connection all day and have worked like they should previously i wa finding these thing to be very unreliable and needed reset sometimes multiple time a day yes i ve did everything on their 7960 webpage updated firmware etc etc however i did not set my router to use a specific channel shouldn t have to for none of my other device require that if the power blink they come back online by themselves no mus no fuss but like i said above they ve been working okay for almost 24 hour now so i m keeping my finger crossed i have a galaxy note 3 and don t keep up with android version

Header: review for basic outlet switch only
Review: this review section is confusing a amazon combine review for nearly the whole wemo line of product into one i can t tell how well my product is reviewed by other customer but this review is for the switch which is a device that plug into an outlet and provides an alternative outlet that is controlled by the device the version i bought doesn t provide information about electricity usage it just turn power to your appliance on off initial setup wa a bit rocky the device take a few minute to establish itself and start sending out it own wifi signal i think people will have better luck connecting their phone to the device if they wait 10 minute after plugging it in once the app connects to the device and you ve updated the firmware you re set to go and can access it from home wifi the device can be connected remotely from outside home wifi but this ha to be set up every time you connect a new device i have 2 of these outlet switch and had to disconnect and reset the remote connection after setting up the 2nd switch it s been running a week so far and no trouble at all it work via 4g although it say 3g on the app or wifi and ifttt work fine a well no complaint update a week later still no problem from browsing the web i noticed a few helpful hint 1 the box state it need to be connected to a wifi router but there are all kind of router and i am not sure if it connects to every one mine is connected to a 2 4ghz band b g n router actually it s connected to an apple airport base station router that ha both 2 4ghz b g n and 5ghz a n band but it connected itself to the 2 4ghz b g n band if you don t have a g router or don t know what your router is check the web or call belkin i bet most people have g capability on their router so it may not be an issue 2 i noted that someone on the web had an issue with his router s security setting it wa set to wpa wpa2 personal which didn t work he reset it to wpa2 personal without wpa and that worked mine wa set to wpa2 personal from the beginning so i had no issue 3 the ssid name of your wifi network apparently can t have 2 capital letter according to a post on the web so myweb won t work but myweb will my ssid complies but if this is true i wouldn t be surprised if it s the major reason people have issue connecting with their wemo device i haven t found any other wrinkle by luck my router and it setting worked fine from the outset none of these setting are mentioned on the packaging or the one page instruction i could not find system requirement on belkin s wemo page either hope this help someone
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: initial setup is hit or miss when it s connected it work well
Review: updated 3 15 17 as the title said my initial setup wa tedious taking a few try to work but now that i ve replace the router home wifi wa flaky this plug work fine 99 of the time original review i have 3 wemo device i only bought this one via amazon 1 light switch a switch smart plug and an insight switch i got them all a month apart because i wanted to avoid paying for a hub from another manufacturer i also chose it because i saw reasonably good review here on amazon i figured that since i m technically inclined i wouldn t have the trouble that others reported but i ve found getting them connected initially is very flaky and it s taken multiple try for each of them requiring a device reset each time connecting to my wifi network ha been the toughest part though i also find them very slow setting up their own wifi to enable this connection taking up to 5 minute to show up each time since each device took 3 8 try to complete that s a lot of frustration and wasted time i have two locked wifi connection but the iphone app didn t recognize the password entry properly the first time for any of the wemos the iphone app is also very finicky at identifying a new device and it also doesn t allow you to change wifi network i also have an amazon echo that us my wifi but it managed to get the wifi password directly from my phone so i didn t need to re enter it why can t the wemos do that this original switch smart plug wa working pretty solidly for a few week but wa offline for a while last night now the other two are offline and only this switch outlet is connected seen by the iphone app i just contacted support though i don t have high hope i am so glad that i didn t install one of these on my elderly mother in law s tv a i wa planning i do enough tech support for her a it is
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: which is worse the device or the app
Review: either the switch won t connect to my wireless or the app shuts down before i can complete set up i ve been restarting my phone the wemo switch and my router i ve uninstalled reinstalled cleared my cache i ve been on the phone with wemo support nothing work now the theory is that the problem is the latest version of the app it is too new but the old one is not available seriously do yourself and your sanity a favor and find a different product update 1 hour and 45 minute on the phone with tech support and about an hour and a half on my own and now i have 2 working wemo switch worth it not yet but at least they work i had to use both an iphone 5 and a samsung s5 because i could only accomplish the initial set up with the iphone but then the wemo only properly work with the samsung phone the way i wanted it my echo is really how i control it and that pairing wa a breeze i still suggest a better switch i have one more wemo switch in it box which i am too scared to set up at this point i ll wait until a weekend where i have absolutely nothing else to do and then attempt it way too much work for an outlet
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: promising but set up and wifi reliability let it down
Review: promising would be the best word to describe the wemo switch unfortunately it fall short the set up is very finicky often losing track of the wifi network i ve told it to join even when right next to the base station hit join fail hit join fail hit join fail hey it worked immediately it asks for a firmware update which kill the unit so i repeat the whole process again it s now been over an hour of mucking around with the wemo on my 3rd attempt the unit stayed online but i have not unplugged it to see if it will survive a power down i m not hopeful belkin 1 fix the app it crashed on me several time latest ios7 iphone 5 2 fix the firmware upgrade process to not break your setting 3 find out why your wifi is so unreliable and fix it 4 polish the set up process this wa possibly the worst wifi device set up i ve been through would a micro usb port be too much to ask for bouncing back and forth between wifi network ssids is clumsy at best and mostly just unreliable hacky

Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: best smart home gadget i own
Review: the wemo switch is a very easy to use device that can come handy in many different scenario you can use the switch to power just about anything that can be plugged into a standard outlet i have 2 lamp hooked up to my switch that are set to turn on and wake me up every morning at a certain time the possibility with the wemo switch are endless to turn it on you can manually click the button but the best way is through your phone you can even turn it on from the other side of the world no joke to get the switch up and running you need download the wemo app which is available for ios and android the app will give you a simple set of instruction on setting it up it s shouldn t take any more than 5 minute to finish my tip for you is to make sure that the wemo is connected under the same wifi network that your phone is connected to a super awesome feature of the app is rule you can set specific rule for the switch with rule you can make the switch turn on and off at specific time on specific day you can even have it turn on at sunrise each day you can also manually virtually click the button inside the app to turn the switch on or off overall the wemo switch is a very reliable product that can be used in an infinite amount of situation please note that it is not made of the high quality plastic but is still durable this doesn t effect me because mine is hidden behind a nightstand the only problem i have found is that the outlet on it is a very tight fit you can look at this in a good and bad way it is good because whatever you plug in it will never get pulled out of the outlet accidentally this is bad if you need to move the wemo switch around and plug device in and out on a daily basis to be honest the tight outlet doe t affect me because i don t even have a reason to unplug my lamp from it i am sure over time it would get looser the more thing you plug and unplug from it so if you are looking for a place to start in the smart home world this is great way to start if you own other wemo product you can also control them inside the same wemo app
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: looks like we re throwing away all of these plug a a
Review: this worked for about two month and then we such internet provider and thus ended up with a new wireless network name and password which we are now trying to switch the wemo device over to if you ever find yourself in the same situation then may god help you because these were not designed to ever be updated in any way looks like we re throwing away all of these plug a a result we ve spent hour trying to reset reinstall etc all to no avail
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: i have tested 3 of these unit all with the same poor result the firmware fails to maintain connection to the network which prevents the app from showing the correct status and prevents the user from manually pressing the button to turn off light the only way to turn off on light when in this state is to unplug the outlet and replug this kind of behavior on firmware is blatantly unacceptable the firmware test group need to preform many many more extensive test the unit will only work 24hrs before require power cycling in order to get it back on the network and allow the manual switch to work
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: nice idea doe not work quite a well a i would like
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: i am disappointed in this device it ha great potential the mobile application is good and it ha integration with ifttt it is very straightforward to setup the setup is similar to other device in it class once on the wireless network it soon forgot it wa connected i had to reset the device several time to see it again every now and again it woke up for a little while but then dropped off the network again i have no reason to believe the device is faulty it is just flakey typically a faulty device would exhibit some type of extreme behavior as far a accessing it remotely this is just a flakey on and off obviously because it cannot stay connected to the wireless network the last thing i tried wa to create a new dedicated wireless network just for the device i let it run for a week and could only connected to it twice for brief movement i purchased a tp link wi fi smart plug a few month back and this device is incredibly stable my only complaint is that it doe not support ifttt which is why i tried the wemo but i will stick with the tp link product belkin also dropped support for their developer api due to lack of interest if i had to guess the lack of interest is due to the instability of the device if a company want stop play in the iot or home automation space a developer api is critical in my opinion maybe dropping the api is an indication that they are not serious about this product space
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Review: really i cannot express my disgust and disdain for this product i went all in and bought 10 for the house the setup process is not hard but is a pain and it is hit or miss the biggest pain and if you do your research you will find this out on your own these damn thing just disconnect randomly and then you have to go through the 20 minute process ot fix each and every single one any time there is a firmware upgrade they lose all their info including your network name their connection detail their name you have set everything and you have to go to each one individually and reset it you have to connect to the device by setting it up in your network setting a your network then hope that it connects after 30 second or so then open the app and hope it see the device then connect to the device name it set it up and then hope that it see your network i mean it is an ordeal and you have to do it all the time do not buy these
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: great idea not ready for primetime
Review: great idea not ready for primetime if you thought the setup of the wemo switch wa exhausting buggy and not a promised don t worry you ll have a chance to repeat your installation every three week while it is reasonable hardware and a great idea this version is too early and not ready it go off line randomly every 20 day and or else you find pleasure in asking alexa to turn off the light and finding out that you have to reinstall the switch yet again this product will frustrate you the idea is great the hardware look fine the software is not ready i m happy that i only bought one a amazon is now opening echo application to 3rd party and i will wait for a product well more consistent than this before a fill all my outlet with echo and future dot compatible device
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa

Header: buggy software to say the least update 7 29 2017
Review: let me just say on the outset that i have many of these smart home device from many different brand and they are almost more trouble than they are worth i m a retired it guy and i know my way around network hardware and software the problem with these device is they come with phone based software that s buggy to say the least and i have used the software on a variety of phone and version of android and it is very inconsistent and always ha problem and with all but my ihome device they almost always won t recover from a power failure without having to be re configured or re set up i m hoping that these device manufacturer will come out with some solid pc based software for their product because that would cure a lot of problem i have yet to get the software to work properly on my moto z2 play running android 7 1 1 as it finish up installing a new device it can t find the home wifi network so the setup dy i m glad i kept my old motorola razr running android 4 4 at least it will work after 3 or 4 attempt update 7 29 2017 it would appear now that not only can i not get both of these wemo smart plug set up one of them won t even reset and go into setup mode anymore they are both only about 7 month old and have only controlled light le than 75 watt
Product: WeMo Switch Smart Plug, Wi-Fi, Works with Amazon Alexa
